# copyright_long:       Source: http://www.peshito.com/<br>Rights: Public Domain<br><br>The Peschito Syriac New Testament by J.W. Etheridge, comprising: The Syrian Churches: their Early History, Liturgies, and Literature. With a literal Translation of the Four Gospels, from the Peschito, etc. 1846  and The Apostolical Acts and Epistles from the Peschito or Ancient Syriac: to which are added, the remaining epistles and the Book of Revelation, after a later syrian text, etc. 1849.
40001001	THE RECORD of the generation of Jeshu the Meshicha , the son of David , son of Abraham .
40001002	Abraham begat Ishok , Ishok begat Jakub , Jakub begat Jehuda and his brethren ,
40001003	Jehuda begat Pharets and Zoroch from Thomar . Pharets begat Hetsron , Hetsron begat Arom ,
40001004	Arom begat Aminodob , Aminodob begat Nachshun , Nachshun begat Salmun ,
40001005	Salmun begat Booz from Rochab , Booz begat Ubid from Ruth , Ubid begat Ishai ,
40001006	Ishai begat David the king ; David begat Shelemun from the wife of Uria ;
40001007	Shelemun begat Rehebaam , Rehebaam begat Abia , Abia begat Asa ,
40001008	Asa begat Johushaphat , Johushaphat begat Jurom , Jurom begat Uzia ,
40001009	Uzia begat Juthom , Juthom begat Ahaz , Ahaz begat Hezakia ,
40001010	Hezakia begat Menasha , Menasha begat Amun , Amun begat Jushia ,
40001011	Jushia begat Jukania and his brethren at the exile of Bobel .
40001012	And after the exile of Bobel Jukania begat Shalathiel , Shalathiel begat Zurbobel ,
40001013	Zurbobel begat Abiud , Abiud begat Aliakim , Aliakim begat Ozur ,
40001014	Ozur begat Zoduk , Zoduk begat Akin , Akin begat Aliud ,
40001015	Aliud begat Aliozar , Aliozar begat Mathan , Mathan begat Jakub ,
40001016	Jakub begat Jauseph , husband of Mariam , of whom was born JESHU who is called the Meshicha .
40001017	Thus all the generations from Abraham to David ( were ) fourteen generations ; and from David to the exile of Bobel , fourteen generations ; and from the exile of Bobel to the Meshicha , fourteen generations .
40001018	NOW the nativity of Jeshu the Meshicha was thus : While Mariam his mother was betrothed to Jauseph , before they could be consociated , she was found to be with child from the Spirit of Holiness .
40001019	But Jauseph her husband was just , and , not willing to defame her , meditated privately to release her .
40001020	But while ( on ) these ( things ) he reflected , an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream , and said to him , Jauseph , son of David , fear not to take Mariam thy wife ; for that which is conceived in her is from the Spirit of Holiness .
40001021	She shall give birth to a son , and thou shalt call his name JESHU ; for he shall save his people from their sins .
40001022	Now all this was done , that what was spoken from the Lord by the prophet might be fulfilled :
40001023	Behold , a virgin shall be with child , and shall bring forth the son , and they shall call his name Amanuel ; which is interpreted , With us ( is ) our Aloha .
40001024	Then Jauseph , when he had arisen from his sleep , did as the angel of the Lord commanded him , and took unto him his wife ;
40001025	and knew her not until she had given birth to her son , the firstborn ; and she called his name Jeshu .
40002001	NOW when Jeshu was born in Beth-lechem of Jehuda , in the days of Herodes the king , there came Magians from the East to Urishlem :
40002002	and they said , Where is the king of the Jews who is born ? for we have seen his star in the east , and have come to worship him .
40002003	But Herodes the king heard , and was troubled , and all Urishlem with him .
40002004	And he assembled all the chief priests and scribes of the people , and anxiously inquired of them where the Meshicha should be born .
40002005	But they said , In Beth-lechem of Jehuda ; for so it is written in the prophet :
40002006	Also thou , Beth-lechem of Jehuda , wast not the least among the kings of Jehuda ; for from thee shall come forth the king who shall be as a shepherd to my people Isroel .
40002007	Then Herodes privately called the Magians , and learned from them at what time the star appeared to them :
40002008	and he sent them to Beth-lechem , and said to them , Go and inquire diligently concerning the child ; and when you have found him , come , show me , and I also will go and will worship him .
40002009	But they , when they had heard the king , went forth ; and , lo , the star , which they had seen in the east , proceeded before them , until it came and stood over against where the child was .
40002010	Now when they saw the star , they rejoiced with very great joy .
40002011	And they entered the house , and beheld the child with Mariam his mother ; and they fell down , and worshipped him . And they opened their treasures , and offered unto him oblations ; gold , and myrrh , and frankincense .
40002012	And it was shown to them in a dream , that they should not return unto Herodes ; so , by another way , they went unto their place .
40002013	AND when they were gone , the angel of the Lord appeared in a dream unto Jauseph , and said to him , Arise , take the child and his mother , and flee into Metsreen , and there be until I tell thee ; for it will be that Herodes will seek the child , that he may destroy him .
40002014	Then Jauseph arose , took up the child and his mother , and fled by night into Metsreen ,
40002015	and was there until the death of Herodes . That it might be fulfilled which was spoken from the Lord by the prophet , saying , Out of Metsreen have I called my son .
40002016	Then Herodes , when he saw that he had been deluded by the Magians , was greatly wroth , and sent ( and ) killed all the children of Beth-lechem , and all its limits , from two years and under , according to the time which he had inquired from the Magians .
40002017	Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Eramio the prophet , who said ,
40002018	A cry was heard in Rometha ; weeping and great lamentation ; Rochel weeping for her children , and not willing to be comforted , because they are not .
40002019	BUT when Herodes , the king , was dead , the angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Jauseph in Metsreen ,
40002020	and said to him , Arise , take the child and his mother , and go into the land of Isroel ; for they are dead who sought the life of the child .
40002021	And Jauseph arose , ( and ) took the child and his mother , and came into the land of Isroel .
40002022	But when he heard that Arkelaos was the king in Jehud , instead of Herodes his father , he was afraid to go thither : and it was shown to him in a dream , that he should go into the region of Galila .
40002023	And he came and dwelt in a city which is called Natsrath . So would be fulfilled that which was spoken by the prophet , that a Nazarene he should be called .
40003001	NOW in those days came Juchanon the Baptizer preaching in the desert of Jehud ,
40003002	and saying , Repent ! the kingdom of heaven hath drawn nigh .
40003003	For this is he of whom it was spoken by Eshaia the prophet : The voice which crieth in the desert , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths plain .
40003004	But this Juchanon , his clothing was of the hair of camels , with a loins-belt of leather upon his loins ; and his food was locusts and wilderness-honey .
40003005	Then went forth to him Urishlem , and all Jehud , and the whole country about Jurdan ;
40003006	and were baptized of him in Jurdan , the river , while they were confessing their sins .
40003007	But when he saw many of the Pharishee and Zodukoyee coming to be baptized , he said to them , Generation of vipers , who hath showed you to escape from the wrath that cometh ?
40003008	Work , therefore , fruits which are suitable to repentance .
40003009	Neither ruminate and say within yourselves , that Abraham is father to us ; for I say to you that Aloha is able from these stones to raise up sons unto Abraham .
40003010	But , behold , the axe lieth at the root of the trees ; every tree , therefore , which maketh not good fruit is cut down and falleth into the fire .
40003011	I , indeed , baptize you with water unto repentance ; but He who cometh after me is mightier than I ; he , whose sandals I am not worthy to bear , - he baptizeth you with the Spirit of Holiness and with fire .
40003012	He ( it is ) whose fan is in his hand , and , purifying his floors , the wheat he gathereth into his garner , but the chaff he burneth with the fire that is not quenched .
40003013	Then came Jeshu from Galila unto Jurdan to Juchanan to be baptized of him .
40003014	But Juchanon prohibited him , and said , I need from thee to be baptized , and hast thou come unto me ?
40003015	But Jeshu answered and said unto him , Permit now ; for thus it becometh us to accomplish all righteousness . And then he permitted him .
40003016	But when Jeshu was baptized , he immediately ascended from the waters ; and the heaven was opened unto him ; and he saw the Spirit of Aloha , who descended , like the dove , and came upon him .
40003017	And , lo , the voice from heaven , which said , This ( is ) my Son , the Beloved , in whom I have delighted .
40004001	THEN Jeshu was led by the Spirit of Holiness into the desert , that he should be tempted by the Accuser .
40004002	And he fasted forty days and forty nights ; but afterward he hungered .
40004003	And he who tempteth approached and said , If the Son thou art of Aloha , say that these stones shall become bread .
40004004	But he answered and said , It is written that not by bread alone liveth the Son of man , but by every word which proceedeth from the mouth of Aloha .
40004005	Then the Accuser taketh him to the holy city , and caused him to stand on the pinnacle of the temple ;
40004006	and said to him , If the Son thou art of Aloha , throw thyself down ; for it is written that his angels he shall command concerning thee , and upon their hands they shall bear thee , that thou strike not against a stone thy foot .
40004007	Jeshu said to him , Again it is written , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy Aloha .
40004008	Again the Accuser took him to a mountain which is exceeding high , and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory ;
40004009	and said to him , These all to thee will I give , if thou wilt fall and worship me ,
40004010	Then said Jeshu to him , Away with thee , Satana ! for it is written that the Lord thy Aloha thou shalt worship , and him only thou shalt serve .
40004011	Then the Accuser left him , and , behold , the angels drew nigh and ministered unto him .
40004012	BUT when Jeshu heard that Juchanan was perfected , he removed into Galila .
40004013	And he left Natsrath , and came and dwelt in Kaphar-Nachum by the sea-side on the borders of Zabolon and of Naptholi .
40004014	That the thing might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet Eshaia , who said ,
40004015	The land of Zabolon , the land of Naptholi , the way of the sea beyond Jurdan , Galila of the peoples .
40004016	The people who sat in darkness the great light hath seen ; and they who have sat in the region and shadow of death , the light has arisen upon them .
40004017	From that time began Jeshu to preach , and to say , Repent ! for the kingdom of heaven hath drawn nigh .
40004018	And while he walked by the sea of Galila , he saw two brethren , Shemun who was called Kipha , and Andreas his brother , who were casting their nets into the sea , for they were fishers .
40004019	And Jeshu said to them , Come after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
40004020	And they immediately forsook their nets and went after him .
40004021	And when he had passed thence , he saw two other brethren , Jakub-bar-Zabdai and Juchanan his brother , in a vessel with Zabdai their father , repairing their nets : and Jeshu called them ;
40004022	and they forthwith left the vessel and their father , and went after him .
40004023	And Jeshu perambulated all Galila , and taught in their synagogues , and preached the announcement of the kingdom , and healed all disease and affliction in the people .
40004024	And his fame was heard in all Suria ; and they brought to him all those who were grievously affected with various diseases , and those who were pressed down by strong pains , and demoniacs , and lunatics , and the paralysed ; and he healed them .
40004025	And there went after him great gatherings from Galila , and from the ten cities , and from Urishlem , and from Jehud , and from beyond Jurdan .
40005001	BUT when Jeshu saw the multitudes , he ascended a mountain ; and when he had sat down , his disciples drew near to him ;
40005002	and he opened his mouth and taught them , saying :
40005003	BLESSED ( are ) the poor in spirit , for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005004	Blessed the mourners , for they shall be comforted .
40005005	Blessed the meek , for they shall inherit the earth .
40005006	Blessed they who hunger and thirst unto righteousness , for they shall be satisfied .
40005007	Blessed the merciful , for upon them shall be mercy .
40005008	Blessed they who are pure in their hearts , for they shall see Aloha .
40005009	Blessed the makers of peace , for the children of Aloha shall they be called .
40005010	Blessed they who are persecuted because of righteousness , for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40005011	Blessed are you when they treat you with reviling , and persecute you , and say concerning you every evil word , for my sake , in falsity .
40005012	Then be glad and exult , for your reward is great in heaven ; for so persecuted they the prophets who were before you .
40005013	You are the salt of the earth : but if it happen that salt become tasteless , with what shall it be seasoned ? It goeth for nothing but to be thrown without and trodden down by men .
40005014	You are the light of the world : It is not possible that a city which is built upon a hill can be hidden .
40005015	Nor do they kindle a lamp and place it beneath a measure , but on a candlestick , and it enlighteneth all who are in the house .
40005016	So let your light shine before the sons of men , that they may see your good works , and glorify your Father who is in heaven .
40005017	Think not that I came to loose the law or the prophets : not that I might loose , but that I might fulfill .
40005018	For , Amen I say unto you , that until heaven and earth shall pass away , one yod , or one point , shall not pass from the law , till all be done .
40005019	Every one , therefore , who shall set loose one from these least commandments , and shall so teach the children of men , the least shall he be called in the kingdom of heaven : but every one who shall do and teach , this shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
40005020	For I say to you , that unless your righteousness shall abound more than that of the scribes and the Pharishee , you shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven .
40005021	YOU have heard that it was said unto them who were before , Thou shalt not kill ; and whosoever shall kill is obnoxious to the judgment .
40005022	But I say unto you , that he who is angry against his brother rashly , is obnoxious to the judgment ; and he who shall say to his brother , Thou empty one ! is liable to the council ; and every one who shall say , Thou fool ! is liable to the gihano of fire .
40005023	If it occur , therefore , that thou bring thy oblation to the altar , and there rememberest that thy brother retaineth some enmity against thee ;
40005024	leave there thy oblation at the altar , and go , first be reconciled with thy brother , and then come and offer thy oblation .
40005025	Be at one with thine adversary quickly , while thou art with him in the way ; lest thy adversary deliver thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the exactor , and thou fall into the house of the bound .
40005026	And , Amen I say unto thee , that thou shalt not come forth from thence till thou hast rendered the last shamuna .
40005027	You have heard that it hath been said , Thou shalt not commit adultery .
40005028	But I say to you , that every one who beholdeth a woman so as that he shall desire her , already committeth adultery in his heart .
40005029	But if thy right eye cause thee to offend , root it out and cast it from thee : it is better to thee that one of thy members should perish , than that thy whole body should fall into gihano .
40005030	And if thy right hand cause thee to offend , cut it off and cast it from thee ; for it is better to thee that one from thy members should perish , rather than thy whole body should fall into gihano .
40005031	It hath been said , that he who looseth his wife should give her a writing of divorcement .
40005032	But I say unto you , that whosoever looseth his wife , except on account of fornication , maketh her to commit adultery ; and whosoever taketh her who is sent away , committeth adultery .
40005033	Again , you have heard it was said to those beforetime , Thou shalt not lie in thine oaths , but shalt fulfil thine oaths unto the Lord .
40005034	But I say unto you , Swear not at all : not by heaven , for it is the throne of Aloha ;
40005035	nor by earth , for it is the foot-stool beneath his feet ; neither by Urishlem , for it is the city of the great king .
40005036	Neither shalt thou swear by thy head , for thou canst not make a single hair in it either black or white .
40005037	But let your discourse be , Yea , yea ; Nay , nay ; for whatsoever is more than these is from the evil .
40005038	You have heard that it hath been said , An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth .
40005039	But I say unto you , that you shall not rise up against evil : but if any one strike thee on the right cheek , turn to him the other also .
40005040	And if any one will contend with thee to take away thy tunic , leave him thy mantle also ;
40005041	and if a man compel thee one mile , go with him twain .
40005042	Give to him who asketh from thee , and him who would borrow from thee refuse not .
40005043	You have heard that it hath been said , Thou shalt love thy neighbour , and hate thine enemy .
40005044	But I say unto you , Love your enemies ; bless them who execrate you ; do that which is good to him who hateth you ; and pray for them who lead you with a chain , and persecute you .
40005045	That you may be the children of your Father who is in heaven , who causeth his sun to arise on the good and on the evil , and who sendeth showers on the just and on the unjust .
40005046	For if you love those ( only ) who love you , what reward have you ? do not even the tribute-gatherers this ?
40005047	And if you wish peace to your brethren only , what more do you than they ? do not also the tribute-gatherers this ?
40005048	Be ye therefore perfect , as your Father who is in heaven is perfect !
40006001	SEE that in your almsgiving you do it not before men , so as that you may be observed by them ; otherwise no reward is for you with your Father who is in heaven .
40006002	When , therefore , thou art doing alms , sound not a trumpet before thee , as do the assumers of faces in the assemblies and streets , so that they may be praised from men ; and , Amen I say to you , they receive their reward .
40006003	But thou , when thou art doing thy alms , let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth ,
40006004	that thine alms may be in secret ; and thy Father , who seeth in secret , shall recompense thee in openness .
40006005	And when thou prayest , be not as the face-takers , who love to stand in the assemblies and at the corners of the streets to pray , that they may be seen of men ; and truly I say to you that they receive their reward .
40006006	But thou , when thou prayest , enter into thy secret chamber , and shut thy door , and pray to thy Father who is in secret ; and thy Father , who seeth in secret , shall reward thee in openness .
40006007	And when thou art praying , be not wordy , like the profane ; for they think that in much speaking they are heard .
40006008	Be you not like them , for your Father knoweth what is needful for you before that you ask him .
40006009	Thus pray : Our Father who art in the heavens ! be sanctified thy Name .
40006010	Come thy kingdom . Be done thy will , as in heaven , also in earth .
40006011	Give to us the bread of our need to-day ;
40006012	and forgive us our debts , as also we forgive our debtors ;
40006013	and lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from the evil . For thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory to the age of ages .
40006014	For if you forgive men their trespasses , your Father who is in heaven will forgive you also .
40006015	But if you will not forgive men , your Father also forgiveth not your trespasses unto you .
40006016	WHEN , too , you fast , be not morosely sad as the assumers of faces , for they defile their countenances so as that they may appear unto men to fast : and , Amen I say unto you , they receive their reward .
40006017	But thou , when thou art fasting , wash thy face and anoint thine head ,
40006018	that it may not appear to men that thou art fasting , but to thy Father who is in secret ; and thy Father who seeth in secret , he shall reward thee .
40006019	Lay not up for yourselves treasures in the earth , a place where moth and rust corrupt , and where thieves dig through and steal :
40006020	but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where no moth and no rust corrupt , and where thieves do not dig through and steal .
40006021	For where your treasure is , there also your hearts are .
40006022	The lamp of the body is the eye : if thine eye therefore be perfect , thy whole body will be illuminated ;
40006023	but if thine eye be evil , thy whole body will be dark . If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness , what will thy darkness be ?
40006024	No man can serve two lords ; for the one he will hate , and the other he will love , or the one he will honour , and the other he will neglect : you cannot serve Aloha and riches .
40006025	WHEREFORE I say unto you , Let not your souls be anxious what you shall eat and what you shall drink , and for your bodies what you shall wear . Is not the life more excellent than food , and the body than raiment ?
40006026	Behold the fowls of the heaven ; they sow not , neither do they reap , nor collect into granaries ; yet your Father who is in heaven nourisheth them : are you not far more considerable than they ?
40006027	But who among you by being anxious can add to his stature one cubit ?
40006028	and concerning raiment why are you anxious ? Look upon the lilies of the wilderness how they increase ; they toil not , neither do they spin .
40006029	Yet I say to you , Not even Shelemun in all his glory was covered like one from among these .
40006030	But if the herb of the field , which to-day exists , and tomorrow falleth into the oven , Aloha thus clotheth , how much more you , little of faith ?
40006031	Be not anxious , therefore , nor say , What shall we eat , or , What shall we drink , or , How shall we be covered ?
40006032	For after all these things do the people of the world inquire : but your Father who is in heaven knoweth that also by you are required these all .
40006033	But seek first the kingdom of Aloha and his righteousness , and all these shall be added unto you .
40006034	Be not therefore anxious for to-morrow ; the morrow shall care for its own : the evil of to-day is enough for it .
40007001	JUDGE not , that you be not judged .
40007002	For with the judgment that you judge , you shall be judged ; and with the measure that you mete , it shall be measured to you .
40007003	But why dost thou look at the rod that is in thy brother's eye , while the rafter that is in thine own eye thou dost not consider ?
40007004	Or how sayest thou to thy brother , Permit that I draw forth the rod from thine eye , and , behold , there is a rafter in thine own eye ?
40007005	Hypocrite ! draw forth first the rafter from thine own eye , and then thou wilt see to draw forth the rod from thy brother's eye .
40007006	Give not the holy unto dogs , and throw not your precious stones before swine , lest they trample them under their feet , and turn again and rend you .
40007007	Ask , and it shall be given to you ; seek , and you shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you .
40007008	For every one who asketh receiveth , and he who seeketh findeth ; and to him who knocketh it is opened .
40007009	Or what man from among you , who if his son shall ask bread , will reach forth a stone to him ?
40007010	if a fish he shall ask of him , a serpent will he reach forth to him ?
40007011	If , therefore , you who are evil know to give good gifts unto your children , how much more shall your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him ?
40007012	All therefore that you will that men shall do unto you , so also do you unto them : for this is the law and the prophets .
40007013	ENTER in at the narrow gate : for wide is the gate , and spacious the way , that conducteth to destruction ; and they are many who go therein .
40007014	How small is the gate , and narrow the way , that leadeth unto salvation ; and they are few who find it !
40007015	Beware of false prophets , who come to you in the clothing of sheep , but within are ravening wolves .
40007016	By their fruits you shall know them . Do they gather from thorns grapes , or from briers figs ?
40007017	So every good tree maketh good fruits ; but an evil tree maketh evil fruits .
40007018	A good tree cannot make evil fruits , nor an evil tree make good fruits .
40007019	Every tree that maketh not good fruits is cut down , and falleth into the fire .
40007020	Wherefore by their fruits you shall know them .
40007021	Not every one that saith to me , My Lord , my Lord , entereth into the kingdom of heaven ; but he who doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven .
40007022	Multitudes will say to me in that day My Lord , my Lord , in thy name have we not prophesied , and in thy name ejected devils , and in thy name performed many mighty works ?
40007023	And then will I confess to them , I never knew you ; go far from me , ye workers of iniquity .
40007024	Every one therefore who heareth these my words , and doeth them , shall be likened to a wise man , who built his house upon a rock .
40007025	And the rain descended , and the torrents came , and the winds blew , and rushed against that house , but it fell not , for its foundations were placed upon the rock .
40007026	And every one who heareth these my words , and doeth them not , shall be likened to a man who built his house upon sand .
40007027	And the rain descended , and the torrents came , and the winds blew , and rushed against that house , and it fell , and the ruin of it was great .
40007028	And when Jeshu had finished these words , the multitudes wondered at his doctrine .
40007029	For he taught them as one having power , and not as their scribes and the Pharishee .
40008001	WHEN he had descended from the mountain , great multitudes clave to him .
40008002	And , behold , a certain leper came ( and ) worshipped him , and said , My Lord , if thou art willing , thou canst cleanse me .
40008003	And Jeshu extended his hand , and touched him , and said , I am willing : be clean ; and in that very hour his leprosy was cleansed .
40008004	And Jeshu said to him , See that thou tell no man , but go , show thyself to the priests , and offer the oblation that Musha required for their testimony .
40008005	Then when Jeshu had entered into Kapharnachum , a certain centurion approached him , and besought of him ,
40008006	saying , My Lord , my child is lying in the house , paralysed and grievously tormented .
40008007	Jeshu saith to him , I will come and heal him .
40008008	The centurion answered and saith , My Lord , I am not worthy that thou shouldst come beneath my roof ; only speak in a word , and my child shall be healed .
40008009	For I also am a man under authority , and under my hand there are soldiers . I say to this one , Go , and he goeth ; and to the other , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth .
40008010	When Jeshu heard this , he was moved with admiration , and said to those with him , Truly I say to you , that in Isroel I have not found faith like this .
40008011	But I tell you , That many shall come from the east , and from the west , and shall recline with Abraham , and Is'hok , and Jakub , in the kingdom of the heavens ;
40008012	but the children of the kingdom shall go forth into outer darknesses ; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
40008013	And Jeshu said unto the centurion , Go ; as thou hast believed , it shall be to thee . And his child was healed in that very hour .
40008014	AND Jeshu came to the house of Shemun , and saw his mother-in-law lying , a fever having seized her .
40008015	And he touched her with his hand , and the fever left her ; and she arose and ministered to them .
40008016	And when it was evening , they brought before him many demoniacs , and he cast out their devils by a word ; and all those who were heavily afflicted he healed .
40008017	So was fulfilled what had been spoken by the prophet Eshaia , who said , That he should take our griefs , and bear our infirmities .
40008018	Now when Jeshu saw the great multitudes which encompassed him , he commanded that they should go to the opposite shore .
40008019	And a certain scribe approached him , and said , Rabi , I will come after thee to the place whither thou goest .
40008020	Jeshu saith to him , The foxes have their dens , and the fowls of heaven a bower , but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
40008021	And another from his disciples said to him , My Lord , permit me first to go and bury my father .
40008022	But Jeshu said to him Come after me , and leave the dead ones burying their dead .
40008023	AND when Jeshu had ascended into the ship , his disciples ascended with him .
40008024	And , behold , a great commotion was made on the sea , insomuch that the vessel was covered by the waves ; but Jeshu himself was asleep .
40008025	And the disciples approached him , that they might awake him , saying to him , Our Lord , deliver us , we are perishing !
40008026	And Jeshu said to them , Why are you fearful , you little in faith ? Then he arose , and forbade the wind and the sea , and there was a great calm .
40008027	But the men were struck with wonder , saying , What ( being ) is this , to whom the winds and the sea are obedient ?
40008028	And when Jeshu came to the other side , to the region of the Godroyee , there met him two demoniacs , who came forth from the place of sepulchres , exceedingly malignant , insomuch that no man could pass by that way .
40008029	And they shouted , saying , What to us , and to thee , Jeshu , son of Aloha ? Hast thou come hither before the time , to torment us ?
40008030	Now there was at a distance from them a herd of many swine feeding .
40008031	Those demons , therefore , supplicated from him , saying , If thou cast us out , suffer us to go into the herd of swine .
40008032	Jeshu saith to them , Go : and immediately they went forth , and entered into the swine ; and the whole herd rushed directly over the rock , and , plunging into the sea , perished in the waters .
40008033	And they who tended them , fled , and went into the city , and showed every thing that was done , and what concerned these demoniacs .
40008034	the whole city came forth to meet Jeshu himself ; and when they beheld him , they besought from him that he would remove from their coasts .
40009001	And he ascended ( into ) the ship , and went over , and came to his city .
40009002	And they brought to him a paralytic lying on a bed ; and Jeshu saw their faith , and said to the paralytic , Be comforted , my son , thy sins are forgiven thee .
40009003	But men from among the scribes said within themselves , This blasphemeth .
40009004	But Jeshu knew their reasonings , and said to them , Why reason ye evil in your hearts ?
40009005	For which is easier , to say , Forgiven are thy sins , or to say , Arise , walk ?
40009006	But that ye may know that authority hath the Son of man in the earth to remit sins , he saith to him-the paralytic , - Arise , lift up thy bed , and go to thy house :
40009007	and he arose ( and ) went to his house .
40009008	When the assembly saw this , they feared , and glorified Aloha who had given such power as this unto men .
40009009	AND when Jeshu had passed thence , he saw a man who was sitting at the place of the tribute-takers , whose name was Mathai ; and he said to him , Come after me ; and he arose and went after him .
40009010	And while he reclined in the house , there came to him many tribute-gatherers and sinners , and reclined with Jeshu and with his disciples .
40009011	And when the Pharishee saw ( it ) , they say to his disciples , Why doth your master eat with tribute-takers and sinners ?
40009012	But Jeshu , when he heard ( it ) , said to them , The healthful have no need for the physician , but they who are diseased .
40009013	Go , learn what that is : - " I require mercy , and not sacrifice ; " for I am not come to call the righteous , but the sinners .
40009014	Then drew nigh to him the disciples of Juchanon , and said , Why do we and the Pharishee fast much , and thy disciples fast not ?
40009015	Jeshu said to them , Neither can the sons of the marriage-chamber fast while the bridegroom is with them : but the days are coming when the bridegroom shall be taken up from them , and then shall they fast .
40009016	No man inserteth a piece of new cloth upon an old garment , lest he should take away its fulness from that garment , and the rent be greater .
40009017	Neither do they pour new wine into old bottles , that the bottles may not be broken , and the wine be spilled , and the bottles perish . But they pour new wine into new bottles , and both are preserved .
40009018	WHILE he spake these words with them , a certain chief came , drew near , worshipped him , and said , My daughter is now dead ; but come , lay thy hand upon her , and she shall live !
40009019	And Jeshu arose , with his disciples , and went after him .
40009020	And , behold , a woman whose blood had flowed twelve years , came behind him , and touched the edge of his vestment .
40009021	For she was saying within herself , If I touch but his garment , I shall be healed .
40009022	But Jeshu turned and seeth her , and said to her , Be comforted , my daughter , thy faith hath saved thee . And the woman was healed from that very hour .
40009023	And Jeshu came to the ruler's house , and saw the minstrels and the crowds which were making a tumult .
40009024	And he said to them , Retire ; for the damsel is not dead , but asleep . And they laughed at him .
40009025	And when he had put forth the crowds , he entered , and took her by the hand ; and the damsel arose .
40009026	And the rumour of this went forth through all that land .
40009027	AND when Jeshu had passed thence , two blind men clave to him , and besought him , and said , Have compassion on us , Son of David !
40009028	And when he had come into the house , these blind men were brought to him . Jeshu saith to them , Believe you that I am able to do this ? They say to him , Yes , our Lord !
40009029	Then he touched their eyes , and said , As you believe be it to you .
40009030	And immediately their eyes were opened . And Jeshu forbad them and said , Beware lest any man know .
40009031	But they went forth and spread the report of it through all that land .
40009032	And when Jeshu went forth , they brought to him a dumb person in whom was a demon .
40009033	And when the demon had gone out , the dumb spake ; and the multitudes were astonished , and said , Never was it thus seen in Isroel .
40009034	But the Pharishee said , By the chief of the devils he casteth out devils .
40009035	And Jeshu itinerated in all their cities and villages , and taught in their assemblies , and preached the gospel of the kingdom , and healed all diseases and all pains .
40009036	BUT when Jeshu saw the multitudes , he had compassion upon them , because they fainted and were dispersed as sheep that had no shepherd ;
40009037	and said to his disciples , The harvest is great , and the labourers few .
40009038	Ask , therefore , from the Lord of the harvest , that he would thrust forth labourers into his harvest .
40010001	And he called his twelve disciples , and gave them power over unclean spirits to cast them out , and to cure every disease and infirmity .
40010002	Now , of the twelve apostles the names are these : the first of them , Shemun who is called Kipha , and Andreas his brother , and Jakubbar-Zabdai , and Juchanon his brother ,
40010003	and Philipos , and Bar-Tholmai , and Thoma , and Mathai the tribute-gatherer , and Jakubbar-Chalphai , and Labi who was surnamed Thadai ,
40010004	and Shemun the zealous , and Jihuda S'carjuta , he who betrayed him .
40010005	These twelve Jeshu sent , and commanded them and said , In the way of the heathens go not , and into the city of the Shomroyee do not enter ;
40010006	but go rather unto the sheep which have perished from the house of Isroel .
40010007	And as you go , proclaim and say that the kingdom of heaven hath drawn near .
40010008	The diseased heal , the lepers cleanse , the dead raise , and the demons cast forth . Freely you have received , freely give .
40010009	Provide neither gold , nor silver , nor brass in your purses ,
40010010	nor a wallet for the road ; neither two tunics , nor sandals , nor staff : for worthy is the workman of his meat .
40010011	And into whatsoever city or town you enter , inquire who is worthy in it , and there be till you depart .
40010012	And when you enter into the house , invoke peace for the house ;
40010013	and if the house be worthy , your peace shall come upon it ; but if it be not worthy , your peace upon yourselves shall revert .
40010014	But whosoever doth not receive you or hear your words , when you depart from that house , or that town , set free the dust from your feet .
40010015	And , Amen , I say unto you , that for the land of Sadum and of Amura it will be more tolerable , in the day of the judgment , than for that city .
40010016	LO , I send you forth as sheep among wolves : be you , therefore , wise as serpents and guileless as doves .
40010017	But beware of the sons of men ; for , delivering you to the house of judgments , in their synagogues they will scourge you ,
40010018	and before governors and kings bring you , on my account , for the testimony concerning them and the gentiles .
40010019	But when they deliver you up , be not solicitous how or what you shall speak ; for it is given you in that hour what you shall speak .
40010020	For it is not you speaking , but the Spirit of your Father speaking in you .
40010021	But the brother shall deliver his brother unto death , and the father his son ; and the sons shall rise up against their fathers , and shall slay them .
40010022	And you shall be abhorred by all men on account of my name : but he who shall persevere until the end , he shall be saved .
40010023	When they persecute you in this city , escape to the other ; for , Amen I say unto you , that you shall not have completed all the cities of the house of Isroel , till the Son of man shall come .
40010024	The disciple is not greater than his master , nor the servant than his lord .
40010025	It sufficeth the disciple that he be as his master , and the servant as his lord . If the master of the house they have called Beelzebub , how much more his house-sons !
40010026	You shall not fear , therefore , from them ; for there is nothing covered which shall not be revealed , nor secret which shall not be known .
40010027	Whatsoever I say to you in darkness , declare you in the light ; and whatsoever you have heard in your ears , proclaim upon the roofs .
40010028	And fear not them who kill the body , but the soul cannot kill ; but fear rather One who the soul and the body can destroy in gihano .
40010029	Are not two sparrows sold for an asor ? yet one of them , without your Father , doth not fall upon the earth .
40010030	But of you , also , the hairs of your head are all numbered .
40010031	Fear not , therefore ; than many sparrows more precious are you .
40010032	Every man , therefore , who shall confess me before the sons of men , I myself will confess him also before my Father who is in heaven .
40010033	But whosoever shall deny me before the sons of men , I also will deny him , I , before my Father who is in heaven .
40010034	EXPECT not that I have come to send forth peace on the earth ; I have not come to send forth peace , but the sword .
40010035	For I have come to cause a man to separate from his father , and a daughter from her mother , and a daughter-in-law from her mother-in-law ;
40010036	and the adversaries of a man ( to be ) his own house-sons .
40010037	Whosoever loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy ( of ) me ; and whosoever loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy ( of ) me .
40010038	And every one who taketh not his cross and cometh after me , is not worthy of me .
40010039	Whosoever will find his life shall lose it , and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake shall find it .
40010040	Whosoever receiveth you , receiveth me ; and whosoever receiveth me , Him who sent me he receiveth .
40010041	Whosoever entertaineth a prophet in the name of a prophet , the reward of a prophet receiveth . Whosoever entertaineth a just man in the name of a just man , the reward of the just man he receiveth .
40010042	And whosoever only giveth one of these little ones a cup of cold ( waters ) to drink in the name of a disciple , Amen , I say unto you , he shall not lose his reward .
40011001	AND it was that when Jeshu had finished instructing his twelve disciples , he removed from thence to teach and preach in their cities .
40011002	But Juchanon , when he heard in the house of the bound the works of the Meshicha , sent by his disciples ,
40011003	and said to him , Art thou He that cometh , or another are we to expect ?
40011004	Jeshu answered and said to them , Go , recount to Juchanon these things which you hear and see ;
40011005	( that ) the blind see , the lame are walking , the lepers are made clean , the deaf hear , the dead arise , and the poor are evangelized ;
40011006	and blessed is he who shall not be offended with me .
40011007	But when they were gone , Jeshu began to speak to the assembly concerning Juchanon : What went you forth into the waste to see ? a reed that by the wind was shaken ?
40011008	And if not , what went you forth to see ? a man clothed in soft vestments ? Behold , they who are softly clothed are in the house of kings .
40011009	And if not , what went you forth to see ? a prophet ? I tell you , Yes ; and more than a prophet .
40011010	For this is he concerning whom it is written , Behold , I send my angel before thy face , to prepare the way before thee .
40011011	Amen I say to you , there hath not arisen among them born of women who greater than Juchanon the Baptizer : yet , the least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he .
40011012	But from the days of Juchanon the Baptizer until now , the kingdom of the heavens by violence is taken , and the violent ones seize it .
40011013	For all the prophets and the law prophesied until Juchanon ;
40011014	and if you are willing , receive , that he is Elia who was to come .
40011015	Whoever hath ears to hear , he shall hear .
40011016	BUT to what shall I compare this generation ? It is like children who sit in the public place , and cry to their companions ,
40011017	and say , We have sung to you , and you have not danced ; we have wailed unto you , and you have not mourned .
40011018	For Juchanon came neither eating nor drinking , and they say , He hath a devil .
40011019	The Son of man came eating and drinking , and they say , See a man a devourer , a wine-drinker , a friend of tribute-takers and of sinners . But justified is wisdom by her servants .
40011020	Then began Jeshu to reproach those cities in which were done many of his miracles , and which did not repent ,
40011021	saying , Woe to thee , Korazin ! woe to thee , Bethtsaida ! for if in Tsur and in Tsaidon those miracles had been done which have been performed in you , they would a while ago in sackcloth and ashes have repented .
40011022	But I say to you , that for Tsur and Tsaidon it shall be more tolerable in the day of judgment than for you .
40011023	And thou , Kaphernachum , who unto heaven art exalted , unto Shiul shalt be brought down ; for if in Sadum had been done those miracles which have been done in thee , it would have stood until this day .
40011024	But I tell you that for the land of Sadum it shall be more tolerable in the day of judgment than for thee .
40011025	IN that time Jeshu answered and said , I praise thee , my Father , the Lord of the heavens and of the earth , that thou hast concealed these ( things ) from the wise and prudent , but hast revealed them unto little children .
40011026	Yes , my Father , for thus was it pleasing before thee !
40011027	All things are delivered to me from my Father ; and no man knoweth the Son but the Father ; also the Father no man knoweth , except the Son , and he ( to ) whom the Son pleaseth to reveal ( him ) .
40011028	Come unto me , all you ( who ) are wearied and bearing burdens , and I will give you rest .
40011029	Bear my yoke upon you , and learn of me ; for I am peaceful and lowly in my heart , and you shall find repose for your souls .
40011030	For my yoke is kindly , and my burden is light .
40012001	At that time Jeshu was walking on the sabbath among the grain ; and his disciples hungered , and began to pluck the ears and to eat .
40012002	But when the Pharishee saw them , they say to him , Look , thy disciples do something which is not lawful to be done on the sabbath .
40012003	But he said to them , Have you not read what David did when he hungered , and they who were with him ?
40012004	how he went to the house of Aloha , and the bread of the table of the Lord did he eat , - that which was not lawful for him to eat , nor for them who were with him , but for the priests only ?
40012005	Or have you not read in the law that the priests in the temple profane the sabbath in it , and are without blame ?
40012006	But I say to you , that ( one ) greater than the temple is here .
40012007	Moreover , if you knew what that ( meaneth ) , " I desire mercy and not a sacrifice , " you would not have condemned them who are not faulty .
40012008	For the Lord of the sabbath is the Son of man .
40012009	AND Jeshu passed thence , and came into their synagogue .
40012010	And a certain man was there whose hand was withered . And they questioned him , saying , Is it lawful on the sabbath to heal ? that they might accuse him .
40012011	But he said to them , What man is there among you that hath one sheep , ( who ) , if it fall into a pit on the sabbath-day , doth not take and lift it up ?
40012012	How much more precious is a child of man than a sheep ! Wherefore it is lawful on the sabbath-day to do that which is good .
40012013	Then saith he to the man , Stretch forth thine hand ! and he stretched forth his hand , and it was restored like the other its fellow .
40012014	And the Pharishee went forth and took counsel against him , how they might destroy him .
40012015	But Jeshu knew , and passed from thence ; and great crowds went after him , and he healed them all .
40012016	And he forbad that they should make him known .
40012017	That what was spoken by the prophet Eshaia might be fulfilled , who said ,
40012018	Behold my servant , in whom is my pleasure : My beloved , in whom my soul delighteth . My Spirit will I put upon him , And judgment to the peoples shall he preach .
40012019	He shall not contend nor cry , And no man shall hear his voice in the street .
40012020	A bruised reed he will not break , And a flickering lamp he will not extinguish , Until he bring forth judgment unto victory .
40012021	And in his name shall the gentiles hope .
40012022	THEN they brought to him a certain demoniac who was dumb and blind ; and he healed him , so that the dumb and blind could speak and see .
40012023	And all the multitude were amazed , and said , Is not this the Son of David ?
40012024	But the Pharishee , when they heard , said , This ( man ) doth not cast forth demons unless by Beelzebub , the prince of the devils .
40012025	But Jeshu knew their reasonings , and said to them , Every kingdom that is divided against itself is destroyed ; and every city which is divided against itself shall not stand .
40012026	And if Satan cast out Satan , he is divided against himself ; how then standeth his kingdom ?
40012027	And if I by Beelzebub cast forth demons , your sons , by whom do they cast them forth ? On this account they shall be your judges .
40012028	But if I by the Spirit of Aloha cast forth demons , the kingdom of Aloha hath come nigh upon you .
40012029	Or , how can one enter the strong one's house , and spoil his goods , unless he first bind the strong one ? and then can he spoil his house .
40012030	He who is not with me is against me ; and he who gathereth not with me , in scattering scattereth .
40012031	Wherefore , this I say to you : That all sins and blasphemies shall be forgiven unto the sons of men ; but the blasphemy which is against the Spirit shall not be forgiven to the sons of men .
40012032	And every one who shall speak a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him ; but every one who against the Spirit of Holiness shall speak , it shall not be forgiven to him , neither in this world nor in the world to come .
40012033	Or make the tree good , and the fruits ( will be ) good ; or make the tree evil , and the fruits ( will be ) evil : for by the fruits the tree is known .
40012034	Brood of vipers ! how can you speak good who are evil ? For from the abundancies of the heart the mouth speaketh .
40012035	A good man from the good treasuries bringeth forth good things , and an evil man out of the evil treasuries bringeth forth evil ( things ) .
40012036	But I tell you , that for every useless word which the sons of men shall speak , they must give the answer for it in the day of judgment .
40012037	For by thy words thou shalt be justified , and by thy words thou shalt be condemned .
40012038	THEN answered certain from the scribes and Pharishee , and said to him , Teacher , we would wish to see a sign from thee .
40012039	But he answered them and said , A generation depraved and adulterous requireth a sign ; but a sign shall not be given to it , but the sign of Jaunon the prophet ;
40012040	for as Jaunon was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights , so the Son of man shall be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights .
40012041	The men of Ninevoë . shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it ; for they repented at the preaching of Jaunon ; and , behold , a greater than Jaunon ( is ) here .
40012042	The queen of the south shall arise in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it ; for she came from the confines of the earth that she might hear the wisdom of Shelemun ; but one more excellent than Shelemun is here .
40012043	When the unclean spirit shall have gone forth from a child of man , he wandereth through places that have no waters in them , and seeketh repose , but findeth ( it ) not .
40012044	Then he saith , I will return unto the house from whence I came forth ; and coming , he findeth it untenanted , cleansed , and decorated .
40012045	Then he goeth and taketh with him seven other spirits , than himself more wicked , and they enter and dwell in him . And the end of that man is worse than his beginning . So shall it be with this wicked race !
40012046	While he spake to the assembly , his mother and his brethren came , standing without , and seeking to speak with him .
40012047	And a man said to him , Thy mother and thy brethren are standing without , and are requesting to speak with thee .
40012048	But he answered and said to him who spake to him , Who is my mother , and who are my brethren ?
40012049	And he stretched forth his hand towards his disciples , and said , Behold my mother , and behold my brethren !
40012050	For every one who doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven , he is my brother , and my sister , and my mother .
40013001	IN that day Jeshu went forth from the house and sat by the sea-side ;
40013002	and great multitudes gathered near him , so that he went up and sat in a vessel ; and all the multitude were standing on the shore of the sea .
40013003	And he discoursed largely to them in parables , and said : Behold , there went forth a sower to sow ;
40013004	and as he sowed , some fell by the road-side , and the fowl came and devoured it .
40013005	Another ( portion ) fell upon the rock , where there was not much soil ; and immediately it sprung up , because there was no depth of earth .
40013006	But when the sun was risen , it burned , and , because it had no root , it withered away .
40013007	And another fell among the thorns , and the thorns sprang up and choked it .
40013008	And another fell into good earth , and gave fruits , this a hundred , another sixty , and another thirty .
40013009	He who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
40013010	And his disciples approached , saying to him , Why dost thou speak to them in parables ?
40013011	He replied and said to them , Because unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of heaven , but unto them it is not given .
40013012	For unto him who hath , it shall be given , and it shall be increased to him : but to him who hath not , that also which he hath shall be taken from him .
40013013	On this account I speak to them in parables . Hence they see , and ( yet ) see not ; and they hear , and ( yet ) hear not , neither understand ;
40013014	and accomplished in them is the prophecy of Eshaia , who said , that hearing they should hear , but not understand , and seeing they should see , but not know .
40013015	For the heart of this people is become gross , and with their ears they have heard heavily , and their eyes they have shut , that they may not see with their eyes , nor hear with their ears , nor understand with their hearts , and be converted , and I heal them .
40013016	But blessed are your eyes which see , and your ears which hear :
40013017	for , Amen I say unto you , that many prophets and just ones have desired to behold what you see , and have not beheld , and to hear what you hear , and have not heard .
40013018	You , then , attend to the comparison of the seed :
40013019	( When ) any one who heareth the doctrine of the kingdom doth not understand it , there cometh the evil ( one ) , and snatcheth away the doctrine that was sown in his heart : this is what by the road-side was sown .
40013020	But that which was sown upon the rock is he who heareth the word , and at once with joy apprehendeth it .
40013021	Yet hath he no root in him , but is ( only ) for a time ; and when affliction or persecution occurs on account of the doctrine , he is quickly offended .
40013022	That sown the place of thorns , is he who heareth the word , but the anxious thought of this world and the illusions of riches stifle the word in him , and he is without fruits .
40013023	But that which upon good ground was sown is he who heareth my doctrine , and understandeth ( it ) , and giveth fruits , and produceth , whether a hundred , or sixty , or thirty fold .
40013024	ANOTHER comparison he allegorized unto them , and said : The kingdom of heaven is like unto a man who sowed good seed in his field .
40013025	And while men slept , came his adversary , and sowed zizania among the wheat , and went .
40013026	And when the plant sprang up and produced fruit , then appeared the zizania .
40013027	And the labourers of the house-lord drew near and said to him , Our lord , didst thou not sow good seed in thy field ? From whence then is the zizania in it ?
40013028	But he said to them , A foeman hath done this . The labourers say to him , Art thou willing that we go and gather them ?
40013029	But he said to them , ( No , ) lest , when ye gather the zizania , you root out with them the wheat also .
40013030	Leave ( them ) , that both may grow together till the harvest ; and in the season of harvest I will say to the reapers , Gather first the zizania , and bind them ( together in ) bundles , that they may burn ; but the wheat collect into my barns .
40013031	Another comparison allegorized he to them , and said : The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard , which a man took and sowed in his field .
40013032	This is less than all other seeds ; but when it has grown , it is greater than all herbs , and becometh a tree , so that the fowl of the heavens come ( and ) build in its branches .
40013033	Another parable he spake to them : The kingdom of heaven resembles that leaven which a woman took and hid in three satas of meal , until the whole was leavened .
40013034	All these spake Jeshu in parables to the multitude ; and without a parable he did not speak with them .
40013035	That there should be fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet , who said , I will open my mouth in comparisons , and pour forth things hidden from before the foundation of the world .
40013036	Then Jeshu dismissed the multitudes , and came into the house ; and his disciples drew near him , and said to him , Expound to us the comparison of the zizania of the field .
40013037	He answered and said to them , He who sowed the good seed is the Son of man .
40013038	The field is the world . Now , the good seed are the sons of the kingdom , but the zizania are the sons of the evil one .
40013039	The adversary who sowed them is Satana ; the harvest is the consummation of the world ; the reapers are the angels .
40013040	As , therefore , the zizania are gathered and burned in the fire , so shall it be in the completion of this world .
40013041	The Son of man shall send forth his angels , and they shall collect from his kingdom all those who cause offence , and all ( who ) work iniquity ,
40013042	and shall throw them into a furnace of fire ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
40013043	Then the just shall shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father . He who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
40013044	Again , the kingdom of heaven is like a treasure which was hidden in a field , ( and ) which a man found and concealed , and from joy went and sold all that he had , and bought that field .
40013045	Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man a merchant , who sought goodly pearls ;
40013046	but who , when he had found one pearl of exceeding price , went , sold all that he had , and bought it .
40013047	Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net , which was thrown into the sea , and from every kind collected .
40013048	And when it was full , they drew to the shore , and sat down , and selected ; and the good they threw into vessels , and the bad they cast without .
40013049	Thus shall it be at the consummation of the world . The angels shall go forth , and separate the evil from among the just ,
40013050	and cast them into the furnace of fire ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth !
40013051	Jeshu said to them , Have you understood all these ? They say to him , Yes , our Lord .
40013052	He saith to them , On this account every scribe who is learned in the kingdom of heaven , is like to a man a house-lord , who bringeth forth from his treasuries the new and the old .
40013053	AND when Jeshu had finished these parables , he passed from thence ,
40013054	and came to his city , and taught them in their synagogues , so that they were astounded and said , Whence hath he ( Whence to him ) this wisdom and these powers ?
40013055	Is not this the son of the carpenter ? Is not his mother called Mariam , and his brothers , Jakub , and Josi , and Shemun , and Jehuda ?
40013056	and his sisters , all , are they not with us ? Whence to this one all these ?
40013057	And they were offended with him . But Jeshu said to them , No prophet is contemned except in his own city , and in his own house .
40013058	And he did not many miracles there on account of their unbelief .
40014001	In that time Herodes Tetrarka heard the rumour concerning Jeshu ;
40014002	and he said to his servants , This is Juchanon the Baptizer : he hath risen from the house of the dead , therefore powerful works are wrought by him .
40014003	For he , Herodes , had seized Juchanon , and bound him , and cast him ( into ) the house of the chained , because of Herodia the wife of Philip his brother .
40014004	for Juchanon had said to him , It is not lawful that she should be to thee a wife .
40014005	And he would have killed him , but he feared the people , because as a prophet they held him .
40014006	But at the birth-day of Herodes , the daughter of Herodia danced before those who reclined , and she pleased Herodes ;
40014007	wherefore with an oath he sware to her to give her whatever she should demand .
40014008	Then she , because instructed by her mother , said , Give me here in a dish the head of Juchanon the Baptizer .
40014009	And the king sickened , yet , on account of the oath and the guests , he commanded that it should be given to her .
40014010	And he sent cut off the head of Juchanon in the house of the chained .
40014011	And his head was brought in a dish , and given to the girl , and she carried it herself to her mother .
40014012	And his disciples came near , took up his corpse , buried ( it ) , and came and showed Jeshu .
40014013	Then Jeshu , when he heard , removed from thence by ship to a desert place by himself ; and when the multitude heard it , they came after him on dry land from the cities .
40014014	And Jeshu came forth , and saw great multitudes , and felt compassion for them , and healed their diseases .
40014015	BUT when it was eventide , his disciples approached him , and said to him , The place is desert , and the time passed over ; send away these multitudes of men , that they may go to the villages , and buy for themselves food .
40014016	But he said to them , It is not needful that they should go ; give you them to eat .
40014017	They said to him , We have nothing here but five cakes and two fishes .
40014018	Jeshu said to them , Bring them hither to me .
40014019	And he directed the multitudes to recline upon the ground ; and he took the five loaves and two fishes , and looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake , and gave to his disciples , and the disciples themselves placed ( it ) before the multitudes .
40014020	And all did eat , and were satisfied ; and they took up , of the abundance of the fragments , twelve baskets when full .
40014021	Now those men who had eaten were five thousand , besides women and children .
40014022	And immediately he constrained his disciples to ascend into the bark , and proceed before him to the other shore , while he was dismissing the crowds .
40014023	And when he had sent the multitudes away , he went up to a mountain by himself , to pray . AND when it was dark , he alone was there .
40014024	But the vessel was distant from the land many stadia , being greatly beaten with the waves , for the wind was against them .
40014025	But in the fourth watch of the night , Jeshu came to them , walking upon the waters .
40014026	And the disciples beheld him walking on the waters , and they were troubled , saying , That it was a spectre ; and from fear they cried out .
40014027	But Jeshu at once spoke to them , and said , Take courage , I am , fear not !
40014028	And Kipha answered , and said to him , My Lord , if it be thou , command me to come to thee upon the waters .
40014029	Jeshu said to him , Come . And Kipha descended from the ship , and walked on the waters to go to Jeshu .
40014030	But when he saw the furious wind , he feared , and began to sink ; and he lifted up his voice , and said , My Lord , deliver me !
40014031	And immediately our Lord reached forth his hand , and seized him , and said to him , Little of faith , why art thou divided ( in mind ) ?
40014032	And when they had ascended into the ship , the wind was tranquil .
40014033	And they who were in the ship , came and adored him , and said , Truly the Son thou art of Aloha .
40014034	And they rowed , and came to the land of Genésar ;
40014035	and the men of that country recognized him , and sent to all the villages that were about them , and they brought to him all those who were grievously afflicted ,
40014036	and besought from him that they might touch only the border of his mantle ; and those who touched were healed .
40015001	THEN came to Jeshu Pharishee and Sophree , who were from Urishlem , saying ,
40015002	Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders , and wash not their hands when they eat bread ?
40015003	Jeshu answered , and said to them , Why also do ye transgress the commandment of Aloha for the sake of your tradition ?
40015004	For Aloha hath said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and whoso curseth his father or his mother , to die he shall die :
40015005	but ye say , Every one who shall say to a father , or to a mother , ( It is ) my oblation whatever thou wouldst be profited by me ,
40015006	and shall not honour his father or his mother ( shall be guiltless ) . Thus you have abolished the word of Aloha for the sake of your tradition .
40015007	Ye hypocrites ! rightly prophesied concerning you Eshaia the prophet , and said ,
40015008	This people with the lips honour me , but their heart ( is ) very far from me .
40015009	But in vain they reverence me , while they teach the doctrines of the commandments of men .
40015010	And he called to the multitudes , and said to them , Hear , and understand :
40015011	It is not that which , entering the mouth , contaminates a man ; but that which shall come from the mouth , that contaminates a man .
40015012	Then drew near his disciples , saying to him , Knowest thou that the Pharishee who heard this word were offended ?
40015013	But he answered , and said to them , Every plantation which my Father who is in heaven hath not planted shall be rooted up .
40015014	Leave them : they are blind leaders of the blind ; but if a blind man shall lead a blind man , both shall fall into the ditch .
40015015	And Shemun Kipha answered and said , My Lord , expound to us this parable .
40015016	But he said to them , Do you also not yet understand ?
40015017	Know you not that whatsoever entereth the mouth , goeth into the belly , and from thence in purification it is cast without ?
40015018	But whatsoever from the mouth shall come forth , from the heart cometh forth , and this contaminates a child of man .
40015019	For from the heart proceed evil thoughts , adultery , murder , fornication , robbery , false witness , blasphemy .
40015020	These are they which defile a man ; but if any one eat when his hands are not washed , he is not defiled .
40015021	AND Jeshu went forth from thence , and came to the borders of Tsur and Tsaidon .
40015022	And , beheld , a Canaanite woman from those coasts came forth crying , and saying , Have mercy upon me , my Lord , son of David ! my daughter is grievously possessed with the demon !
40015023	But he did not return her an answer . And the disciples approached and requested from him , saying , Dismiss her , for she crieth after us .
40015024	But he answered and said to them , I am not sent but to the sheep which have wandered from the house of Israel .
40015025	Then she came , worshipped him , and said , My Lord , help me !
40015026	Jeshu said to her , It is not proper to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs .
40015027	But she said , Even so , my Lord ; yet the dogs eat from the crumbs that fall from the tables of their masters , and live .
40015028	Then said Jeshu to her , O woman , great is thy faith ! be it to thee as thou wilt ! And healed was her daughter from that hour .
40015029	And Jeshu passed from thence , and came near the sea of Galila ; and he ascended the mountain and sat there .
40015030	And there drew near to him great gatherings ( of people ) , and with them there were the lame , and the blind , and the dumb , and the mutilated , and many others ; and they cast them at the feet of Jeshu , and he healed them .
40015031	So that those multitudes were astounded as they beheld the dumb speaking , and the mutilated made whole , and the lame walking , and the blind seeing ; and they glorified the Aloha of Isroel .
40015032	BUT Jeshu himself called his disciples , and said to them , I have pity for this multitude , who , behold , for three days have continued with me , but there is nothing for them to eat ; and to send them away fasting , I am unwilling , lest they should faint in the way .
40015033	The disciples say to him , Whence can we have bread in the wilderness , that we may satisfy this whole multitude ?
40015034	Jeshu saith to them , How many loaves have you ? They say to him , Seven , and a few small fishes .
40015035	And he directed that the multitudes should recline upon the ground .
40015036	And he took those seven loaves and the fishes , and offered praise , and brake , and gave to his disciples , and the disciples gave to the multitudes ;
40015037	and they all did eat and were satisfied : and they took up of the abundance of fragments seven baskets full .
40015038	And they who had eaten , were four thousand men , besides women and children .
40015039	And when he had dismissed the multitudes , he ascended into a ship , and came to the coasts of Magodu .
40016001	And there came Pharishee and Zadukoyee , tempting him , and demanding that he would show them a sign from heaven .
40016002	But he answered and said to them , When it is evening , you say , It will be serene weather , for the heaven hath reddened .
40016003	And in the early morning you say , To-day will be tempestuous , for the heaven hath reddened gloomily . Hypocrites ! the aspect of the heaven you are skilful to discriminate , ( but ) the signs of this time you know not how to distinguish .
40016004	A depraved and adulterous race requireth a sign , but a sign shall not be given to it , save the sign of Jaunon the prophet ; and he left them , and went away .
40016005	And when his disciples had come to the opposite , they had forgotten to take bread with them .
40016006	But he said to them , Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharishee and Zadukoyee .
40016007	But they thought within themselves , saying , ( It is ) because bread we have not taken .
40016008	But Jeshu knew , and said to them , Why reason you within yourselves , little in faith , because bread you have not brought ?
40016009	Have you not yet understood ? Do you not remember those five loaves for the five thousand , and how many panniers you took up ?
40016010	Or those seven loaves and the four thousand , and how many baskets you took up ?
40016011	Why do you not understand that it was not concerning bread I spoke to you , but that you should beware of the leaven of the Pharishee and of the Zadukoyee ?
40016012	Then they understood that he did not say that they should beware of the leaven of bread , but of the doctrine of the Pharishee and of the Zadukoyee .
40016013	NOW when Jeshu had come to the place of Cesarea of Philipos , he questioned his disciples , saying , What do men say concerning me who am the Son of man ?
40016014	They said to him , Some say that thou art Juchanon the Baptizer , but others Elia , and others Eramia , or one from the prophets .
40016015	He saith to them , But you , whom say you that I am ?
40016016	Shemun Kipha answered and said , Thou art the Meshicha , Son of Aloha the Living .
40016017	Jeshu responded and said to him , Blessed art thou , Shemun-bar-Jona ; because flesh and blood have not revealed ( this ) to thee , but my Father who is in heaven .
40016018	Also I say unto thee , that thou art Kipha , and upon this rock will I build my church , and the gates of Sheul shall not prevail against her .
40016019	To thee will I give the keys of the kingdom of heaven ; and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth , shall be bound in heaven ; and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth , shall be loosed in heaven .
40016020	Then he commanded his disciples that no man they should tell that he was the Meshicha .
40016021	AND from that time began Jeshu to show to his disciples that it was to be that he should go to Urishlem , and suffer much from the elders and the chief priests and scribes , and be slain , and the third day arise again .
40016022	Then Kipha took him ( apart ? ) and began to expostulate with him , and said , Far be it from thee , my Lord , that this should be to thee !
40016023	But he turned and said to Kipha , Get thee behind me , Satana ! thou art a stumbling-block to me , because thou thinkest not from Aloha , but from the sons of men !
40016024	Then said Jeshu to his disciples . Whosoever willeth to come after me , let him deny himself , and let him take up his cross and follow me .
40016025	For whosoever willeth to save his life , shall lose it ; and whosoever will lose his life for my sake , shall find it .
40016026	For what shall a man be profited , if the whole world he shall acquire , and his soul shall perish ? or what equivalent shall a man give for his soul ?
40016027	For it is to be , that the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his holy angels , and then shall he render unto every man according to his works .
40016028	AMEN , I say unto you , There are men standing here who shall not taste death , until they shall have seen the Son of man coming in his kingdom .
40017001	And after six days , Jeshu took Kipha , and Jakub , and Juchanon his brother , and led them to a high mountain by themselves .
40017002	And Jeshu was changed before them ; and his countenance shone like the sun , and his vestments were resplendent as the light .
40017003	And there were seen with them Musha and Elia talking with him .
40017004	Then answered Kipha , and said to Jeshu , My Lord , it is good for us to be here ; and if thou art willing , we will make here three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Musha , and one for Elia .
40017005	But while he spake , behold , a bright cloud overspread them , and the voice was from the cloud , saying , This is my Son , the Beloved , in whom I have delighted : to him attend .
40017006	And when the disciples heard , they fell upon their faces and feared greatly .
40017007	And Jeshu approached them and touched them , and said , Arise , fear not .
40017008	And they lifted up their eyes and saw no man , except Jeshu by himself .
40017009	And while they were descending from the mountain , Jeshu charged them , and said to them , Before no man declare this vision , until the Son of man be risen from the dead .
40017010	And the disciples asked and said to him , Why therefore say the scribes that Elia must come first ?
40017011	Jeshu answered and said to them , Elia cometh first that he may fulfil every thing ;
40017012	but I say to you , that , behold , Elia hath come , but they knew him not , and have done to him as they would . So also is the Son of man to suffer from them .
40017013	Then understood the disciples that concerning Juchanon the Baptizer he spake to them .
40017014	AND when they came to the multitude , a man approached him and kneeled upon his knees , and said to him ,
40017015	My Lord , have mercy on me ! my son is lunatic and grievously afflicted ; for often he falleth into the fire and often into the water .
40017016	And I brought him to thy disciples , but they could not heal him .
40017017	Jeshu answered and said , O unbelieving and perverse generation ! how long shall I be with you , how long shall I bear with you ? Bring him hither to me .
40017018	And Jeshu rebuked him , and the demon went forth from him , and the youth was healed from that hour .
40017019	Then came the disciples to Jeshu by himself , and said to him , Why were we not able to heal him ?
40017020	Jeshu saith to them , Because of your unbelief ; for assuredly I tell you , if there were in you faith as a grain of mustard , you should say to this mountain , Pass hence , and it would pass away ; and nothing should overcome you .
40017021	But this kind goeth not forth but by fasting and by prayer .
40017022	WHEN they had returned into Galila , Jeshu said to them , It is coming that the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men ,
40017023	and they shall kill him ; and in the third day he shall arise . And it grieved them exceedingly .
40017024	And when they came to Kapher-nachum , they who took the two zuzis , the head-silver , approached Kipha and said to him , Your master , doth he not give his two zuzeen ?
40017025	He saith to them , Yes . And when Kipha entered the house , Jeshu anticipated him , and said to him , How doth it appear to thee , Shemun ? the kings of the earth , from whom do they take custom and headsilver , from their children , or from aliens ?
40017026	Shemun saith to him , From aliens : Jeshu saith to him , Then the children are free .
40017027	But that we may not offend them , go to the sea , and cast the hook ; and the fish that first cometh up , open his mouth ; and thou shalt find a stater , that take and present for me and thee .
40018001	IN that hour the disciples came near to Jeshu , saying , Who is greatest in the kingdom of heaven ?
40018002	And Jeshu called a child , and made him stand in the midst of them ,
40018003	and said , Amen I say to you , unless you be converted and become as children , you shall not enter the kingdom of heaven .
40018004	Whosoever therefore humbleth himself as this child , he shall be greatest in the kingdom of heaven .
40018005	And whosoever shall receive as like this child in my name , he receiveth me .
40018006	And every one that shall offend one of these little ones who believe in me , to him it had been better that the mill-stone of an ass were hung to his neck , and himself plunged into the depths of the sea .
40018007	Woe to the world from causes of offence ! for it is unavoidable that causes of offence will come ;
40018008	but woe to the man by whom the causes of offence shall come ! If , then , thine hand or thy foot shall be a cause of offence to thee , cut it off , and cast it from thee ; for it is good for thee that thou enter into life lame or mutilated ; and not that , having two hands or two feet , thou fall into the fire of eternity .
40018009	And if thine eye be a cause of offence to thee , dig it out , and cast it from thee ; good ( it is ) for thee that with one eye thou enter into life ; and not that , having two eyes , thou fall into the gihâna of fire .
40018010	See that you contemn not one of these little ones : for I say unto you that their angels in all time are beholding the face of my Father who is in heaven .
40018011	For the Son of man is come to save that which had perished .
40018012	How doth it appear to you ? if a man have an hundred sheep , and one of them shall wander from them , doth he not leave the ninety and nine on the mountain , and , going , seek that which had wandered ?
40018013	And if he shall find it , assuredly I tell you that he rejoiceth in it more than ( in ) the ninety and nine which wandered not .
40018014	So it is not good before your Father who is in heaven , that one of these little ones should perish .
40018015	NOW if thy brother offend against thee , go , and argue ( the matter ) between thyself and him alone ; and if he hear thee , thou hast gained thy brother .
