40018016	But if he hear thee not , take with thee one or two , that upon the mouth of two or three witnesses may be established every word .
40018017	And if , also , he will not hear them , tell the church ; but if he will neither hear the church , let him be to thee as a publican and as a heathen .
40018018	And , Amen I say unto you , that whatsoever you shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven ; and whatsoever you shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
40018019	Again I say to you , that if two of you shall consent on earth concerning every thing that they shall ask , it shall be done for them by my Father who is in heaven .
40018020	For where two or three are assembled in my name , there am I in the midst of them .
40018021	Then Kipha came near to him , and said to him , My Lord , how many times , if my brother offend me , shall I forgive him ; until seven times ?
40018022	Jeshu said to him , I say not to thee , Until seven , but , Until seventy times seven and seven .
40018023	THEREFORE is the kingdom of the heavens likened to a royal person who would take the account from his servants .
40018024	And when he began to receive , they brought to him one who owed a myriad talents .
40018025	And when he had nothing to pay , his lord commanded that they should sell ( both ) himself , his wife , and his children , and all that he had , and to pay .
40018026	And that servant fell and worshipped him , saying , My lord , be patient of spirit toward me , and all things I ( will ) pay thee .
40018027	And the lord of that servant had mercy , and absolved him , and forgave him his debt .
40018028	Then went forth that servant , and found one of his fellows who owed him a hundred pence ; and he seized him , strangling , and saying to him , Give me what thou owest to me .
40018029	His fellow-servant fell at his feet , beseeching him , and saying , Be patient of spirit towards me , and I ( will ) pay thee .
40018030	But he would not , but went and threw him into the house of the chained until he should have rendered him what he owed him .
40018031	When their fellow-servants saw what was done , they were greatly grieved , and went and declared to their lord all that was done .
40018032	Then his lord summoned him and said to him , Evil servant ! all that debt did I forgive thee , because thou didst entreat me .
40018033	Oughtest thou not to have been as gracious to thy fellow-servant as I was gracious unto thee ?
40018034	And his lord was indignant , and delivered him to the tormentors , until he should have paid all whatsoever he owed to him .
40018035	Thus will your heavenly Father deal with you unless you forgive each his brother from your heart his trespasses .
40019001	AND it was that when Jeshu had finished these words , he removed from Galila and came into the confines of Jehud beyond Jurdan .
40019002	And great multitudes came after him , and he healed them there .
40019003	And the Pharishee approached him , and , tempting him , propounded to him whether it was lawful for a man to send away his wife for every cause .
40019004	But he answered and said to them , Have you not read that He who created from the beginning , male and female hath made them ?
40019005	And he said , On this account a man shall leave his father and his mother , and shall cleave to his wife , and they two shall be one flesh .
40019006	Wherefore they were not two , but one body . That , therefore , which Aloha hath conjoined , man shall not separate .
40019007	They said to him , Why then did Musha direct that he should give a writing of dismissal and send her away ?
40019008	He said to them , Musha , on account of the hardness of your heart , permitted you to send away your wives ; but from the beginning it was not so .
40019009	And I say to you that whosoever shall forsake his wife who is not adulterous , and take another , committeth adultery ; and whosoever taketh the deserted one , committeth adultery .
40019010	His disciples say to him , If thus be the case between the man and the woman , it is not expedient to take a wife .
40019011	But he said to them , Not every man is sufficient for this doctrine , but he to whom it is given .
40019012	For there are some eunuchs who from their mother's womb are born so ; and there are some eunuchs who by men are made eunuchs ; and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs on account of the kingdom of heaven . Whosoever is capable of receiving ( this ) , let him receive ( it ) .
40019013	Then they brought to him children , that he should put his hand upon them and pray . And his disciples forbad them .
40019014	But Jeshu himself said , Suffer children to come unto me , and forbid them not ; for of those who are as these , is the kingdom of heaven .
40019015	And he put his hand upon them , and went thence .
40019016	AND one came and approached and said to him , Good teacher , what of good shall I do , that I may have the life of eternity ?
40019017	But he said to him , Why dost thou call me good ? none is good but one , Aloha . But if thou wilt enter into life , keep the commandments .
40019018	He said to him , Which ? Jeshu answered him , Thou shalt not kill , neither commit adultery , nor steal , neither shalt thou witness false testimony ;
40019019	and honour thy father and thy mother , and love thy neighbour as thyself .
40019020	The young man saith to him , These all have I kept from my childhood : how am I deficient ?
40019021	Jeshu saith to him , If thou wilt become perfect , go , sell thy possession and give to the poor , and there shall be for thee a treasure in heaven : and come after me .
40019022	But he , the young man , heard this word , and went away with sadness , for he had great property .
40019023	But Jeshu said to his disciples , Amen I say unto you , that it is difficult for the rich to enter the kingdom of heaven .
40019024	Again I say to you , that it is easier for a camel to enter through the aperture of a needle , than the rich to enter into the kingdom of Aloha .
40019025	But the disciples when they heard were greatly hurt , saying , Who then can be saved ?
40019026	Jeshu , beholding them , said , With the sons of men it is not possible ; but with Aloha every thing is possible .
40019027	THEN answered Kipha and said to him , Behold , we have abandoned every thing , and have come after thee : what then shall there be for us ?
40019028	Jeshu saith to them , Amen I say to you , that you who have come after me , in the new world , when the Son of man shall sit upon the throne of his glory , you also shall sit upon twelve seats , and shall judge the twelve tribes of Isroel .
40019029	And every man who hath relinquished houses , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , on account of my name , shall receive a hundred-fold , and shall inherit the life of eternity ,
40019030	Many however are first who shall be last , and the last first .
40020001	FOR the kingdom of heaven is like a man , a house-lord , who went forth in the early morn to hire labourers for his vinery .
40020002	And he bargained with the labourers for a denarius a day , and sent them into his vinery .
40020003	And he went forth in three hours , and saw others who were standing in the public place and unemployed .
40020004	And he said to them , Go also you in the vinery , and what is suitable I will give you . Then went they .
40020005	And he went forth again in six and nine hours , and did the same .
40020006	And about eleven hours he went out , and found others who were standing and unemployed ; and he said to them , Why are you standing all the day unemployed ?
40020007	They say to him , Because no man hath hired us . He saith to them , Go also you into the vinery , and whatever is suitable you shall receive .
40020008	But when it was evening , the lord of the vinery said to the chief of his household , Call the workmen and give to them their wages ; and begin from the last unto the first .
40020009	And they came who ( had wrought ) from eleven hours ; and they received each a denarius .
40020010	But when the first came , they expected to take more ; but they also received each a denarius .
40020011	And when they had received , they murmured against the house-lord ,
40020012	and said , These last have wrought one hour , and thou hast made them equal with us , who have borne the burden of the day and its heat .
40020013	But he answered and said to one of them , My friend , I am not unjust towards thee : didst thou not bargain with me for a denarius ?
40020014	Take what is thine and go : I will unto these last to give as unto thee .
40020015	Is it not lawful for me that whatsoever l am willing , I may do with mine own ? Is thine eye evil because I am good ?
40020016	Thus the last shall be first , and the first last ; for many are the called , but few the chosen .
40020017	NOW Jeshu was about to go up to Urishlem , and he took his twelve disciples by themselves in the way , and said to them ,
40020018	Behold , we go up to Urishlem , and the Son of man is betrayed to the chief priests and to the scribes , and they shall condemn him to the death ;
40020019	and they shall consign him to the Gentiles , and they shall mock him , and scourge him , and shall crucify him , and on the third day he shall arise .
40020020	Then came to him the mother of the sons of Zabdai , she and her sons , and worshipped him , and supplicated a certain thing of him .
40020021	But he said to her , What wilt thou ? She said to him , Declare that these my two sons shall sit , one at thy right hand , and one at thy left , in thy kingdom .
40020022	Jeshu answered and said , You know not what you ask : are you able to drink the cup of which I am about to drink , or with the baptism with which I am baptized will you be baptized ? They say unto him , We are able !
40020023	He saith to them , My cup you shall drink , and with the baptism with which I am baptized you shall be baptized : but that you may sit at my right hand , and at my left , is not mine to give , unless to them for whom it is prepared by my Father .
40020024	And when the ten heard it , they were indignant against those two brothers .
40020025	And Jeshu called them , and said to them , You know that the princes of the Gentiles are their lords , and their great ones exercise power over them ;
40020026	but it shall not be so among you ; but whoever among you willeth to be great , let him be minister to you .
40020027	And whoever among you willeth to be first , let him be to you the servant .
40020028	So , the Son of man came not to be served , but to serve , and to give his life the redemption for many .
40020029	AND when Jeshu went forth from Jirichu , a great multitude cometh after him .
40020030	And , behold , two blind men were sitting by the side of the way ; and when they heard that Jeshu was passing , they gave voice , saying , Be merciful upon us , my Lord , Son of David !
40020031	But the crowds rebuked them that they should be silent ; but they lifted up their voice the more , saying , Our Lord , be merciful upon us , O Son of David !
40020032	And Jeshu stood and called them , and said , What will you that I should do for you ?
40020033	They say to him , Our Lord , that our eyes may be opened .
40020034	And he had compassion on them , and touched their eyes , and immediately their eyes were opened , and they went after him .
40021001	AND when he drew nigh to Urishlem , and had come to Beth-phage , at the mount of Olives , Jeshu sent two of his disciples ,
40021002	and said to them , Go to this village which is over against you , and you shall at once find an ass tied , and her colt with her ; loose and bring ( them ) to me .
40021003	And if any one say ought to you , say to him that it is requested for our Lord , and immediately he will send them hither .
40021004	But all this was done that there should be fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet , who said ,
40021005	Tell you the daughter of Tsheum , Behold , thy king cometh to thee , lowly , and riding on an ass , and on a colt the foal of an ass .
40021006	Then the disciples went , and did as Jeshu had commanded them ;
40021007	and brought the ass and the colt , and laid upon the colt their clothes , and Jeshu rode upon him .
40021008	And many of the crowds spread their vestments in the way ; and others cut down branches from the trees , and strewed them in the way .
40021009	But the throngs who went before him , and came after him , cried out and said , Ushana to the son of David ! blessed be He who cometh in the name of the Lord ! Ushana in the heights !
40021010	And when he had entered Urishlem , the whole city was commoved , and said , Who is this ?
40021011	But the multitude answered , This is Jeshu , the prophet who is from Natsrath of Galila .
40021012	And Jeshu went into the temple of Aloha , and cast out all those who sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the money-changers , and the seats of those who sold doves ;
40021013	and said to them , It is written , that my house shall the house of prayer be called , but ye have made it a den of thieves .
40021014	And there came to him in the temple the blind and the lame , and he healed them .
40021015	But when the chief priests and Pharishee saw the wondrous things which he did , and the children who were crying in the temple , and saying , Ushana to the son of David , they were displeased with them ,
40021016	saying to him , Hearest thou what these say ? Jeshu saith to them , Yes : have ye not read , that from the mouth of children and of babes thou hast prepared praise ?
40021017	AND he abandoned them , and went forth without the city to Bethania , and lodged there .
40021018	But in the early morn , as he returned to the city , he hungered :
40021019	and he saw a certain fig-tree in the way , and came to it , but found nothing thereon but leaves only ; and he said , Let there be no fruit upon thee again for ever . And immediately that fig-tree withered .
40021020	And the disciples saw , and were astonished , saying , How in a moment is the fig-tree withered !
40021021	Jeshu answered and said to them , Amen I say to you , that if faith were in you , and you did not hesitate , you should not only do ( as ) to this fig-tree , but also were you to say to this mountain , Be thou lifted up and fall into the sea , it should be done .
40021022	And whatsoever you shall ask in prayer and shall believe , you shall obtain .
40021023	And when Jeshu came to the temple , the chief priests and elders of the people approached him , while he taught , saying to him , By what authority doest thou these things , and who gave thee this authority ?
40021024	Jeshu answered and said to them , I will also ask you one word ; and if you will tell me , I will also tell you by what authority I do these ( things ) .
40021025	The baptism of Juchanon , whence is it , from heaven or from men ? But they thought within themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven , he saith to us , Why did ye not believe him ?
40021026	And if we shall say , From men , we fear from the crowd ; for all have regarded Juchanon as a prophet .
40021027	And they answered , saying to him , We know not : Jeshu saith to them , Also I tell not you by what authority I do these ( things ) .
40021028	BUT how doth appear to you ? a certain man had two sons ; and he came to the elder , and said to him , My son , go to-day work in the vinery .
40021029	But he answered and said , I am not willing : yet afterwards he relented , and went .
40021030	He came to the other , and said likewise . He answered and said , I ( will ) , my lord ; yet went not .
40021031	Which of these two did the will of his father ? They say to him , The elder . Jeshu saith to them , Amen I tell you , the tribute-takers and harlots go before you into the kingdom of Aloha .
40021032	For Juchanon came to you in the way of righteousness ; and you believed him not . But the tribute-takers and harlots believed him : but you neither when you saw ( him , nor ) afterwards , repented , that you might believe him .
40021033	Hear another comparison : A certain man was a house-lord ; and he planted a vinery , and surrounded it with an hedge , and dug a wine-press in it , and built in it a tower , and had it taken by labourers , and journeyed .
40021034	And when the time of fruits drew near , he sent his servants to the husbandmen , that they might send him of the fruits of his vinery .
40021035	And the husband-men took his servants , and beat some , and stoned some , and killed others .
40021036	And again he sent other servants more than the first , and they acted towards them likewise :
40021037	last , he sent to them his son , saying , Now will they be ashamed from my son .
40021038	But the husbandmen , when they saw the son , said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and take the inheritance .
40021039	And they seized and cast him without the vinery , and killed him .
40021040	When the lord of the vinery , therefore , cometh , what will he do to these husbandmen ?
40021041	They say to him , Most miserably will he destroy them , and the vinery will he cause to be held by other labourers , ( even ) such as will give him the fruits in their seasons .
40021042	Jeshu saith to them , Have you not read in the scripture , that the stone which the builders rejected , this is become the head of the corner ? By the Lord was this done , and it is wondrous in our eyes .
40021043	On this account I tell you , that the kingdom of Aloha is taken from you , and shall be given to a people who will yield fruits .
40021044	And whosoever shall fall upon this stone shall be broken ; but every one upon whom it shall fall , it will scatter ( him ) .
40021045	And when the chief priests and Pharishee heard his comparisons , they knew that concerning themselves he had spoken .
40021046	And they sought to apprehend him , but feared the people , because as a prophet they regarded him .
40022001	AND Jeshu answered again by comparisons , and said ,
40022002	The kingdom of heaven resembles a royal person who made a feast to his son ;
40022003	and he sent his servants to call the invited ones to the feast , but they were not willing to come .
40022004	And again he sent other servants , and said , Tell the invited ones , Behold , my dinner is prepared , my oxen and my fatlings are killed , and all things are ready ; come to the feast .
40022005	But they despised ( it ) , and went , one to his domain , and another to his business .
40022006	But the rest took his servants and shamefully treated and killed ( them ) .
40022007	But when the king heard , he was wroth ; and sent his forces and destroyed those murderers , and burned their city .
40022008	Then said he to his servants , The feast is prepared , and those who were invited were not worthy .
40022009	Go therefore into the outlets of the highways , and every one whom you find call to the feast .
40022010	And those servants went forth into the highways , and assembled all whom they found , the bad and the good ; and the place of feasting was filled with guests ,
40022011	And the king entered to see the guests , and he saw there a man who was not dressed in the garments of a festival .
40022012	And he said to him , My friend , how didst thou enter here , when thou hast not the vestments of the feast ? But he was silent .
40022013	Then said the king unto the servitors , Bind his hands and his feet , and cast him forth into the darknesses without : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
40022014	For many are the called , but few the chosen .
40022015	THEN went the Pharishee and took counsel how they might ensnare him in discourse .
40022016	And they sent to him their disciples with ( certain ) of the household of Herodes , saying to him , Doctor , we know that thou art resolutely true , and ( that ) the way of Aloha in truth thou teachest ; neither carriest thou fear for man , for thou acceptest not the person of men .
40022017	Tell us then , how doth it appear to thee ? is it lawful to give head-money unto Cesar or not ?
40022018	But Jeshu knew their malice , and said , Why do you tempt me , you hypocrites ?
40022019	Show me the denarius of the head-silver . And they presented to him a denarius .
40022020	And Jeshu said to them , Whose are this image and inscription ?
40022021	They say , Cesar's . He saith to them , Give then ( the things ) of Cesar unto Cesar , and ( the things ) of Aloha unto Aloha .
40022022	And when they heard , they wondered , and left him , and went .
40022023	IN that ( same ) day came the Zadukoyee , affirming to him , ( that ) there is no life for the dead . And they questioned him ,
40022024	saying to him , Doctor , Musha has said to us that if a man die having no children , his brother shall take his wife and raise up seed unto his brother .
40022025	But there were with us seven brethren : the eldest ( of whom ) took a wife , and died . And because he had no children , he left his wife unto his brother .
40022026	So also did he who was second , and he who was the third , and unto the seventh of them .
40022027	But the last of all the woman also is dead .
40022028	In the resurrection , therefore , of whom from these seven shall she be the wife ? for all had taken her .
40022029	Jeshu answered and said to them , You do err , because you understand not the scriptures nor the power of Aloha .
40022030	For in the resurrection of the dead , they take not wives , neither are wives to husbands ; but as the angels of Aloha in heaven are they .
40022031	But concerning the resurrection of the dead , have you not read that which has been spoken to you by Aloha , who said ,
40022032	I am the God of Abraham , the God of Is'hok , the God of Jakub ? But Aloha is not of those who are dead , but of those who are alive .
40022033	And when the multitudes heard , they were wonder-struck at his doctrine .
40022034	BUT when the Pharishee heard that he had silenced the Zadukoyee , they gathered together .
40022035	And one from them , who was skilful in the law , questioned him , tempting him ,
40022036	Doctor , which commandment is greatest in the law ?
40022037	Jeshu said to him , Thou shalt love the Lord thy Aloha with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy strength , and with all thy mind .
40022038	This is the commandment , the great and the first .
40022039	And the second is like unto it , That thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
40022040	On these two commandments hang the law and the prophets .
40022041	while the Pharishee were gathered together , Jeshu questioned them ,
40022042	and said , What say you concerning the Meshicha , - whose son ? They say to him , Son of David .
40022043	Saith he to them , And how doth David in spirit call him THE LORD ? For he said ,
40022044	that the Lord said unto my Lord , Sit thou at my right hand until I put thine adversaries beneath thy feet .
40022045	If , then , David calleth him the Lord , how is he his son ?
40022046	And no man could give to him the answer ; nor did any man dare again from that day to question him .
40023001	Then Jeshu discoursed with the multitudes and with his disciples ,
40023002	and said to them , Upon the chair of Musha sit the scribes and the Pharishee .
40023003	Every thing , therefore , which they tell you to observe , observe and do ; but after their practices do not act ; for they say , and do not .
40023004	And they bind heavy burdens , and lay them on the shoulders of men , but they with their fingers are not willing to touch them .
40023005	And all their works they do that they may be seen of men ; for they widen their tephillin , and lengthen the fringes of their waving vestments ,
40023006	and love the chief reclining-places at evening feasts , and the highest seats in synagogues ,
40023007	and the shaloma in public places , and to be called of men Râbi .
40023008	But be you not called Râbi : for One is your Master ; but all ye are brethren .
40023009	And call no man Abâ to you upon earth : for One is your Father , who is in heaven .
40023010	Neither be ye called Medabronee : for One is your Guide , - the Meshicha .
40023011	But he who is great among you , let him be your servitor .
40023012	For whosoever will exalt himself shall be humbled ; and whosoever will abase himself shall be exalted .
40023013	Woe to you , scribes and Pharishee , hypocrites ! because you hold the kingdom of heaven closed before the children of men ; for you will not enter in yourselves , and them who are entering you will not permit to enter .
40023014	WOE to you , scribes and Pharishee , hypocrites ! because you devour the houses of widows , with the pretext of prolonging your prayers ; on account of which you shall receive the greater judgment .
40023015	Woe to you , scribes and Pharishee , hypocrites ! because you go over sea and dry ( land ) to make one proselyte ; and when you have done it , you make him doubly more a son of gihana than yourselves .
40023016	Woe to you , ye blind guides , who say , That who sweareth by the temple , it is nothing ; but if he swear by the gold which is in the temple , he is liable !
40023017	You senseless and blind ! for which is greater , the gold , or the temple that sanctifieth the gold ?
40023018	And ( that ) whoever sweareth by the altar , it is nothing ; but he swear by the oblation which is upon it , he is liable .
40023019	You foolish and sightless ! for which is greater , the oblation , or the altar that sanctifieth the oblation ?
40023020	He therefore who sweareth by the altar , sweareth by it , and by all things that are upon it .
40023021	And he who sweareth by the temple , sweareth by it , and by whatever abideth in it .
40023022	And whosoever sweareth by heaven , sweareth by the throne of Aloha , and by Him who sitteth thereon .
40023023	Woe to you , scribes , Pharishee , hypocrites ! because you tithe mint , dill , and cummin , and omit the more grave of the law , - justice , benignity , and faithfulness . For these you should have done , and those not omitted .
40023024	You blind guides , who strain out gnats and swallow camels .
40023025	Woe to you , scribes and Pharishee , hypocrites ! who cleanse the outside of the cup and dish ( which ) within are full of rapine and injustice .
40023026	Sightless Pharishee ! cleanse first the inside of the cup and the dish , that their outside also may be clean .
40023027	Woe to you , scribes and Pharishee , hypocrites ! for you are like whited sepulchres , which without appear beautiful , but within are full of the bones of the dead and all impurity .
40023028	So you also from without appear to the sons of men as righteous , but within you are full of unrighteousness and hypocrisy .
40023029	WOE to you , scribes and Pharishee , hypocrites ! because you rebuild the tombs of the prophets and beautify the sepulchres of the just ; and say ,
40023030	If we had been in the days of our fathers , we would not have been with them partakers in the blood of the prophets :
40023031	thus bearing witness against yourselves , that you are the sons of them who killed the prophets .
40023032	And you also , - complete the measure of your fathers .
40023033	Serpents , birth of vipers ! how will you escape from the judgment of gihana ?
40023034	On this account , behold , I send to you prophets , and wise men , and scribes ; ( some ) of these you shall kill and crucify ; and ( some ) of these you shall scourge in your synagogues , and persecute them from city to city .
40023035	So that there shall come upon you all the blood of the just which hath been shed upon the earth ; from the blood of Habil the righteous , unto the blood of Zakaria-bar-Barakia , whom you slew between the temple and the altar .
40023036	Amen I say unto you , that all these shall come upon this generation .
40023037	Urishlem , Urishlem ! who killest the prophets , and stonest them who are sent unto her , what times would I have gathered thy children , as gathereth the hen her young ones beneath her wings , and you would not !
40023038	Lo , your house is left unto you desolate .
40023039	For I say unto you , That you shall not see me from henceforth , until you shall say , Blessed is he who cometh in the name of the Lord .
40024001	AND Jeshu went forth from the temple to depart : and his disciples approached him , showing him the building of the temple .
40024002	But he said to them , See you not all these ? Amen I say to you , There shall not be left here a stone upon a stone which shall not be destroyed .
40024003	And while Jeshu sat upon the mount of Olives , his disciples drew near and said between themselves and him , Tell us when these things shall be ; and what is the sign of thy coming and of the consummation of the world .
40024004	Jeshu answered and said to them , Beware that no man cause you to err ;
40024005	for many will come in my name and will say , I am the Meshicha ; and many will be deceived .
40024006	But it will be for you to hear wars and the noise of battles ; ( yet ) see that you be not perturbed ; for all these will take place , but not yet is the end .
40024007	For people will rise against people , and kingdom against kingdom ; and there shall be famines , and plagues , and earthquakes in various places .
40024008	But these are all the beginning of sorrows .
40024009	Then shall they deliver you to affliction , and shall kill you ; and you shall be hated of all peoples on account of my name .
40024010	Then shall many be offended , and shall hate one another , and betray one another .
40024011	And many lying prophets shall stand up , and shall delude the multitudes .
40024012	And because of the abounding of iniquity , the love of many will languish .
40024013	But he who shall persevere unto the end , - he shall live .
40024014	And this annunciation of the kingdom shall be proclaimed in the whole world as a testimony for all nations ; and then will come the end .
40024015	But when you see the unclean sign of desolation which was spoken of by Daniel the prophet , that it standeth in the holy place ; - he who readeth let him understand ! -
40024016	then let those who are in Jehud escape to the mountain .
40024017	And let not him who is on the roof descend to take what his house ;
40024018	nor he who is in the field turn back to take his vestment .
40024019	But woe to those who are with child , and to those who give suck in those days !
40024020	But pray that your flight may not be in the winter , nor on the shabath .
40024021	For then shall be the great affliction , such as hath not been from the beginning of the world until now , neither shall be ( again ) .
40024022	And unless those days be cut short , none could live of all flesh : but on account of the chosen those days shall be cut short .
40024023	Then if any one shall say to you , Lo , here is the Meshicha , or there ; believe them not .
40024024	For there shall arise false Meshichas and prophets of untruth ; and they shall give forth magnificent signs , so as to seduce , if possible , the chosen also .
40024025	( observe ! I have told you before , )
40024026	If therefore they shall say to you , Behold , he is in the desert ; go not forth : or , Behold , he is in the inner chamber ; believe not .
40024027	As the lightning cometh forth from the east , and is seen unto the west , so shall be the advent of the Son of man .
40024028	But where the body shall be , there will be assembled the eagles .
40024029	But immediately after the affliction of those days , the sun will become dark , and the moon show not her light , and the stars shall fall from heaven , and the powers of heaven be commoved .
40024030	And then shall be seen the standard of the Son of man in heaven , and then all the generations of the earth shall wail , and they shall see the Son of man coming upon the clouds of heaven , with great power and glory .
40024031	And he shall send his angels with the great trumpet , and they shall gather the chosen who are his from the four winds and from the ends of heaven .
40024032	But from the fig-tree learn a parable : As soon as her branches are soft , and they put forth her leaves , you know that summer draweth nigh .
40024033	So also , when all these are seen , you know that it cometh to the door .
40024034	Amen I say to you , that this race shall not have passed away until all these shall take place .
40024035	Heaven and earth shall pass away ; but my words shall not pass away .
40024036	BUT concerning that day and concerning that hour , no man knoweth ; neither the angels of heaven , but the Father only .
40024037	But as the days of Nûch , so shall be the coming of the Son of man .
40024038	For as before the deluge they were eating and drinking , taking wives and giving to husbands , until the day that Nûch went into the ark ;
40024039	and knew not till the deluge came , and carried them all away ; so shalt be the advent of the Son of man .
40024040	Then two shall be in the field ; one shall be taken , and one be left .
40024041	Two shall be grinding in the mill ; one is taken , and one is left .
40024042	Be wakeful therefore , because ye know not in what hour cometh your Lord .
40024043	But this know ; that if the master of the house knew in what watch the thief would come , he would have been watching , and not have suffered his house to be broken through .
40024044	Wherefore be ye also prepared , because in the hour that ye expect not shall come the Son of man .
40024045	WHO is the servant faithful and wise whom his lord shall appoint over the children of his house , to give every one his meat in his time ?
40024046	Blessed is that servant , who , when cometh his lord , shall be found doing so .
40024047	Amen I say to you , that he will establish him over all that he hath .
40024048	But if that evil servant shall say in his heart , My lord withholdeth to come ;
40024049	and shall begin to beat his fellow-servants , and shall be eating and drinking with drunkards ;
40024050	the lord of that servant shall come in a day that he computeth not , and in an hour which he doth not know ,
40024051	and shall sunder him , and set his lot with the hypocrites . There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
40025001	THEN shall be likened the kingdom of heaven unto ten virgins , who took their lamps , and went forth to meet the bridegroom and the bride .
40025002	But five of them were wise , and five foolish .
40025003	And those foolish ( ones ) took their lamps , but did not take with them the oil :
40025004	but those were wise who took oil in vessels with their lamps .
40025005	But while the bridegroom withheld , they all dozed and slept .
40025006	And in the dividing of the night there was the cry , Behold , the bridegroom cometh ; go forth to his meeting .
40025007	Then all the virgins arose , and prepared their lamps .
40025008	But those foolish ones said to the wise , Give to us from your oil ; for , behold , our lamps are gone out .
40025009	But the wise ones answered them , saying , Lest it should not suffice for us and for you ; but go to those who sell , and buy for you .
40025010	And while they were gone to buy , the bridegroom came , and those who were prepared entered with him into the house of festivity , and the gate was shut .
40025011	At last came also those other virgins , saying , Our Lord , our Lord , open to us !
40025012	But he answered and said to them , Assuredly I tell you , I know you not .
40025013	Be wakeful therefore , for you know not that day nor the hour .
40025014	FOR as a man who journeyed called his servants , and delivered to them his property :
40025015	To one he gave five talents , and to another two , and to another one , each man according to his faculty ; and forthwith went away .
40025016	But he who had received five talents went and traded with them , and gained five others .
40025017	Likewise he who ( had received ) two by trading gained two others .
40025018	But he who had received one went , dug in the earth , and hid the money of his lord .
40025019	After a long time the lord of those servants came , and received from them the account .
40025020	Then he drew near who had received the five talents , and brought five others , and said , My lord , five talents thou gavest me : behold , five others I have gained by them .
40025021	His lord said to him , It is well , good and faithful servant ; over a little thou hast been faithful , over much I will establish thee : enter into the joy of thy lord .
40025022	And he of the two talents approached , and said , My lord , two talents thou gavest me : behold , two others I have gained by them .
40025023	His lord saith to him , It is well , servant good and faithful ; over a little thou hast been faithful , over much will I establish thee : enter into the joy of thy lord .
40025024	But he also drew near who had received the one talent , and said , My lord , I knew thee , that thou wast a hard man , reaping where thou hadst not sowed , and gathering together from whence thou hadst not dispersed .
40025025	And I feared , and went and hid thy talent in the earth : behold , thou hast thine own .
40025026	His lord answered , Thou evil and slothful servant , thou didst know me that I reap where I have not sowed , and collect from whence I have not dispersed .
40025027	Did it not behove thee to cast my money upon the table , that when I came I might require mine own with its increase ?
40025028	Take therefore from him the talent , and give it unto him who hath ten talents .
40025029	For unto him who hath shall be given , and it shall be added to him ; but he who hath not , that also which he hath shall be taken from him .
40025030	And the indolent servant cast forth into the darknesses without ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
40025031	WHEN the Son of man cometh in his glory , and all his holy angels with him , then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory .
40025032	And before him shall be gathered all nations : and he shall separate them one from another , as the shepherd separateth the sheep from the goats .
40025033	And he shall cause the sheep to stand upon his right hand , and the goats on his left .
40025034	Then shall the King say to them on his right hand , Come , blessed of my Father , inherit the kingdom which was to be for you from the foundation of the world .
40025035	For I was hungry , and you gave me to eat ; I thirsted , and you made me to drink ; I was a stranger , and you received me ;
40025036	I was naked , and you covered me ; I was sick , and you cared for me ; and I was in prison , and you came to me .
40025037	Then shall say unto him those righteous , Our Lord ! when did we see that thou wast hungry , and fed thee , or that thou didst thirst , and we gave thee drink ?
40025038	and when did we see thee a stranger , and received thee , or naked , and covered thee ?
40025039	and when did we see thee sick , or in prison , and came to thee ?
40025040	And the King shall answer and say to them , Amen I say to you , Inasmuch as you did it unto one of these my least brethren , unto me you did it .
40025041	Then shall he say also unto them on his left hand , Go from me , accursed , into the fire of eternity , which was prepared for the accuser and for his angels .
40025042	For I was hungry and you gave me not to eat ; and I thirsted , but you made me not to drink ;
40025043	and I was a stranger , and you received me not ; and naked , and you clothed me not ; and I was sick , and in prison , and you visited me not .
40025044	Then shall they also answer and say , Our Lord ! when saw we thee hungry , or thirsty , or a stranger , or naked , or sick , or in prison , and did not minister unto thee ?
40025045	Then shall he answer and say to them , Amen I say unto you , that inasmuch as you did it not unto one of these little ones , you did it not to me .
40025046	And these shall go away into the torment which is eternal , and the just into the life which is eternal .
40026001	AND when Jeshu had finished all these discourses , he said to his disciples ,
40026002	You know not that after two days is the Petzcha , and the Son of man is delivered up to be crucified .
40026003	Then assembled the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders of the people , in the hall of the chief of the priests , who was called Kaiapha .
40026004	And they held counsel concerning Jeshu , how that by artifice they might apprehend and kill him .
40026005	And they said , Let it not be on the festival , lest there be a tumult among the people .
40026006	And when Jeshu was at Bethania , in the house of Shemun the leper ,
40026007	there drew near to him a woman who carried a vase of aromatic balsam , great of price , and she poured it upon the head of Jeshu as he reclined .
40026008	But his disciples saw and were displeased , and said , For what is this destruction ?
40026009	For this could have been sold for much , and given to the poor .
40026010	But Jeshu knew , and said to them , Why grieve you the woman ? a good work hath she wrought upon me .
40026011	For in all time the poor you have with you , but me you have not in all time with you .
40026012	For this ( woman ) who hath poured this balsam upon my body , as unto my funeral hath done .
40026013	And Amen I say unto you , Wheresoever this my Gospel shall be proclaimed , in all the world , this also which she hath done shall be told for her memorial .
40026014	Then went one from the twelve , named Jihuda S'carjuta , unto the chief priests ,
40026015	and said to then , What are you willing to give me , and I will deliver him to you ? But they settled to him thirty of silver .
40026016	And from that time he sought to him opportunity to betray him .
40026017	BUT in the first day of the ( Phatiree ) unleavened-bread days , the disciples came to Jeshu , and said to him , Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover ?
40026018	But he said to them , Go into the city to a certain man , and say to him , Our master saith , My time hath come ! with thee will I perform the passover with my disciples .
40026019	And the disciples did as Jeshu had commanded , and prepared the passover .
40026020	And when it was evening , he reclined with his twelve disciples .
40026021	And while they were eating , he said , Amen I say unto you , that one from you betrayeth me .
40026022	And they were very sad , and began to say to him , one by one of them , My Lord , is it I ?
40026023	But he answered and said , One who dippeth his hand with me in the dish , he shall betray me .
40026024	And the Son of man goeth as it is written concerning him ; but woe to him , to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! Better had it been for that man if he had not been born .
40026025	Then Jihuda the traitor answered and said , Am not I ( he ) , Rabi ? Jeshu replieth to him , Thou hast said !
40026026	But while they were eating , Jeshu took the bread , and blessed , and brake , and gave to his disciples , and said , Take , eat , this ( is ) my body .
40026027	And he took the cup , and offered thanks , and gave to them , and said , Take , drink of this all of you :
40026028	this ( is ) my blood of the new covenant , which for multitudes is shed for the remission of sins .
40026029	But I say to you , that I will not drink from henceforth of this product of the vines , until the day in which I shall drink it with you new in the kingdom of Aloha .
40026030	And they sang praises , and went forth unto the mount of Olives .
40026031	THEN said Jeshu unto them , You all shall be offended in me this night ; for it is written , I will strike the shepherd , and scattered shall be the sheep of his flock .
40026032	But after that I am risen I am before you in Galila .
40026033	Kipha answered and said to him , Though every man should be offended in thee , I never will be offended in thee .
40026034	Jeshu saith to him , Amen I say to thee , that in this night , before the cock shall crow , three times thou wilt deny me .
40026035	Kipha saith to him , If I am to die with thee , I will not deny thee . The same also all the disciples said .
40026036	Then cometh Jeshu with them unto the place which is called Gedsiman ; and he said to his disciples , Sit here while I go and pray .
40026037	And he took Kipha and the two sons of Zabdai ; and he began to be sorrowful , and to be vehemently agonized .
40026038	And he said to them , My soul is afflicted unto death ; wait for me here , and watch with me .
40026039	And he removed a little , and fell upon his face , praying , and saying , My Father , if it be possible , let this cup pass from me ; yet not as I will , but as thou .
40026040	Then he came to his disciples , and found them sleeping ; and he said to Kipha , How , could you not for one hour watch with me ?
40026041	Be watchful and pray , that you enter not into temptation . The spirit is ready , but the body is infirm .
40026042	Again he went the second time , and prayed , and said , My Father , if it be not possible for this cup to pass , unless I drink it , be done thy will !
40026043	And he came again , and found them asleep ; for their eyes had become heavy .
40026044	And he left them , and went again , and prayed the third time , and said the same word .
40026045	Then he came to the disciples , and said to them , Sleep on now , and be at rest ; lo , the hour cometh , and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
40026046	Arise , let us go : behold , he cometh who betrayeth me .
40026047	And while he was speaking , behold , Jihuda the traitor , one from the twelve , came , and a great multitude with him , with swords and clubs , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
40026048	And Jihuda the traitor had given to them a sign , and said , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that is he : take him .
40026049	And immediately he approached Jeshu , and said , Peace , my master ! and kissed him .
40026050	But he , Jeshu , said to him , ( Is it ) for that thou hast come , my companion ? Then they came on , and laid their hands upon Jeshu , and took him .
40026051	And , behold , one from those who were with Jeshu stretched forth his hand , and unsheathed a sword , and struck a servant of the high priest , and took off his ear .
40026052	Then said Jeshu to him , Return thy sword to his place ; for every one of them who take swords , by swords shall die .
40026053	Or thinkest thou that I cannot request from my Father , and he shall appoint to me now more than twelve legions of angels ?
40026054	( But ) how , then , would the scripture be accomplished , that thus it ought to be ?
40026055	In that hour Jeshu said to the multitudes , As against a robber are you come out , with swords , and with clubs , to seize me ? Every day with you in the temple I sat and taught , and you did not apprehend me .
40026056	But this was done that what is written in the prophets might be fulfilled . Then the disciples all deserted him , and fled .
40026057	And they who apprehended Jeshu led him unto Kaiapha , chief of the priests , where the jurists and elders were assembled .
40026058	But Shemun Kipha went after him from afar unto the court of the chief of the priests , and entered and sat within with the attendants , that he might see the end .
40026059	But the chief priests , and the elders , and the whole assembly , sought against Jeshu witnesses , that they might put him to death ;
40026060	but they found not ( any ) . And many witnesses of falsehood came . But , last , two came near ,
40026061	declaring , This said , I can destroy the temple of Aloha , and in three days rebuild it .
40026062	And the chief of the priests arose , and said to him , Dost thou return no word ? What are these witnessing against thee ?
40026063	But Jeshu was silent . And the chief of the priests answered and said to him , I swear thee , by Aloha the Living , that thou declare to us whether thou be the Meshicha , the Son of Aloha ?
40026064	Jeshu saith to him , Thou hast said : but I say to you , That hereafter ye shall see him , the Son of man , sitting at the right hand of Power , and coming on the clouds of heaven .
40026065	Then the chief of the priests tore his robes , and said , Behold , he hath blasphemed ! what further need have we of witnesses ? Behold , now we have heard his blasphemy .
40026066	What will you ? They answered saying , He deserves death .
40026067	Then did they spit in his face , and smote him ; and others struck him ,
40026068	saying , Prophesy to us , Meshicha ! Who is he that smiteth thee ?
40026069	But Kipha was sitting without , in the hall , and a certain female domestic approached him , saying to him , Thou also wast with Jeshu Natsroia .
40026070	But he denied before all , and said , I know not what thou sayest .
40026071	And when he had gone out into the vestibule , another saw him , and said to them , This also was there with Jeshu Natsroia .
40026072	And again he denied with oaths , I know not the man .
40026073	But , after a little while , they who were standing drew near , and said to Kipha , Assuredly thou art of them ; for thy speech also makes thee known .
40026074	Then began he to imprecate and to swear , I know not the man ! And in that hour the cock crowed .
40026075	And Kipha remembered the word of Jeshu , who had said to him , That before the cock shall crow , three times wilt thou have denied me . And he went without , and wept bitterly .
40027001	BUT when it was morning , the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jeshu , how they should put him to death .
40027002	And they bound him , and led him away , and delivered him to Pilatos the governor .
40027003	Then Jihuda the traitor , when he saw that Jeshu was condemned , repented him , and went hastily , and returned those thirty of silver unto the chief priests and elders ,
40027004	and said , I have sinned , for I have betrayed the innocent blood . But they said to him , To us ? what to us ? Thou knowest , - thou !
40027005	And he cast down the silver in the temple , and passed away , and went and strangled himself .
40027006	But the chief priests took up the silver , and said , It is not lawful that we throw it into the place of offering , because it is the price of blood .
40027007	And they took counsel , and bought with it the field of the potter , for the burial-place of strangers .
40027008	Wherefore that field has been called , The field of blood , until this day .
40027009	Then was fulfilled what had been spoken by the prophet , who said , And I took the thirty ( pieces ) of silver , the price of him who was precious , whom the sons of Isroel bargained for ;
40027010	and gave them for the field of the potter , as the Lord commanded me .
40027011	But Jeshu himself stood before the governor . And the governor questioned him , and said to him , Thou art the king of the Jihudoyee ? Jeshu said to him , Thou hast said .
40027012	And while the chief priests and elders were accusing him , he returned not a word .
40027013	Then said Pilatos unto him , Hearest thou not what they witness against thee ?
40027014	But he gave him no answer , no , not in one word ; and upon this ( Pilate ) marvelled greatly .
40027015	Now at every festival the governor was accustomed to release one of the bound unto the people , whomsoever they would .
40027016	But there was ( then ) bound a notorious prisoner who was called Bar-aba .
40027017	And when they were assembled , Pilatos said to them , Whom will you that I release unto you , Bar-aba , or Jeshu who is called the Meshicha ?
40027018	For Pilatos knew that from malice they had delivered him .
40027019	But while the governor sat upon his tribunal , his wife sent to him saying , Let there be nothing between thee and that Just One ; for much have I suffered in a dream to-day on his account .
40027020	But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that he should release to them Bar-aba , that they might destroy Jeshu .
40027021	And the governor answered and said to them , Whom will you that I shall release to you of these two ? Then they said , Bar-aba .
40027022	Pilatos saith to them , And to Jeshu who is called the Meshicha , what shall I do with him ? They all said , Let him be crucified .
40027023	Pilatos saith to them , Why , what evil hath he done ? But they clamoured the more , and said , Let him be crucified !
40027024	Then Pilatos , when he saw that nothing availed , but that the tumult became greater , took waters ( and ) washed his hands before the assembly , and said , I am expiated from the blood of this Just One . You shall know .
40027025	And all the people answered and said , His blood upon us , and upon our children !
40027026	THEN he released to them Bar-aba ; and scourged Jeshu with thongs , and delivered him to be crucified .
40027027	Then the soldiers of the governor took Jeshu to the Praetorium , and the whole cohort gathered against him .
40027028	And they stripped him , and invested him with a cloak of crimson .
40027029	And they interwove a crown of thorns , and set it upon his head , and a cane in his right hand : and they kneeled upon their knees before him , and mocked him , saying , Hail , king of the Jihudoyee !
40027030	And they did spit in his face , and took the cane , and struck him upon his head .
40027031	And when they had derided him , they stripped him of the cloak , and clothed him with his own garments , and led him away to be crucified .
40027032	And when they had gone forth , they found a Kurinean man whose name was Shemun : this ( man ) they compel to carry his cross .
40027033	And they came to a place which is called Gogultho , which is expounded , The skull .
40027034	And they gave him to drink vinegar mingled with gall : and he tasted , but was not willing to drink .
40027035	And when they had crucified him , they divided his garments by lot : that what was spoken by the prophet might be fulfilled , They parted my garments among them , and upon my vesture did they cast lots .
40027036	And they sat down and watched him there .
40027037	And they placed over his head the occasion of his death , in the writing , This ( is ) Jeshu , the King of the Jihudoyee .
40027038	AND they crucified with him two thieves , one on his right hand , and one on his left .
40027039	But they who passed by railed against him , moving their heads ,
40027040	and saying , Destroyer of the temple , and builder of it in three days ! deliver thyself , if thou art the Son of Aloha , and come down from the cross .
40027041	Likewise also the chief priests mocking him , with the scribes and elders and Pharishee , saying ,
40027042	He saved others ; himself he cannot save . If he be the King of Isroel , let him now descend from the cross , that we may see and believe in him .
40027043	He trusted upon Aloha ; let him liberate him now , if he delighteth in him ; for he said , I am the Son of Aloha .
40027044	Likewise also the robbers who were crucified with him reviled him .
40027045	BUT from the sixth hour there was darkness upon all the land until the ninth hour .
40027046	And about the ninth hour Jeshu cried with a high voice , Aloha ! Aloha ! why hast thou forsaken me ?
40027047	But certain of them who stood there , when they heard , said , This hath cried unto Ilio .
40027048	And forthwith ran one from them , and took a sponge , and filled it with vinegar , and set it upon a cane , and gave him to drink .
40027049	But the rest said , Let alone , we will see whether Ilio ( will ) come to deliver him .
40027050	But he , Jeshu , again cried with a high voice , and dismissed his spirit .
40027051	And at once the veil of the temple was rent in twain from above to beneath ; and the earth was shaken , and the rocks were riven .
40027052	And the house of the buried was opened ; and the bodies of many of the saints who had been asleep arose ,
40027053	and came forth , and after his resurrection went into the holy city , and were seen by many .
40027054	But the centurion and those with him , who guarded Jeshu , when they saw the commotion and those ( portents ) which took place , feared greatly , and said , Assuredly this was the Son of Aloha .
40027055	( And ) many women were there , beholding from afar ; those who had come after Jeshu from Galila , and had ministered unto him .
40027056	One of them was Mariam Magdolitha , and Mariam the mother of Jakub and of Josi , and the mother of the sons of Zabdai .
40027057	BUT when it was evening , there came a rich man from Rometha , whose name was Jauseph , who himself also was a disciple of Jeshu .
40027058	This went unto Pilatos , and begged the body of Jeshu . And Pilatos commanded that the body should be given to him .
40027059	And Jauseph took the body , and wound it round in a cloth of pure linen ,
40027060	and laid it in a new house of burial of his own , which was hewn out in the rock . And they rolled a great stone , and heaved it against the door of the sepulchre , and went .
40027061	Now there were there Mariam Magdolitha and the other Mariam , who were sitting over against the sepulchre .
40027062	BUT the day which was next after the preparation , the chief priests and Pharishee came together unto Pilatos ,
40027063	saying to him , Our lord , we remember that that impostor said while alive , That after three days I will arise .
40027064	Command therefore that they watch the sepulchre till ( after ) the third of the days ; lest his disciples come , and steal him away by night , and tell the people that from the house of the dead he has risen , and the last delusion be worse than the first .
40027065	Pilatos saith to them , Ye have guards ; go , watch diligently , as ye know how .
40027066	So they went , and set a watch ( about ) the sepulchre , and sealed the stone along with the guards .
40028001	FROM the evening ( end ) of the sabbath , when the first ( day ) in the week was lightening , Mariam Magdolitha and the other Mariam came to see the sepulchre .
40028002	And , behold , there was a great earthquake ; for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven and drew near , rolled the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
40028003	His aspect was like lightning , and his raiment was white as the snow .
40028004	And with fear of him they who were watching were shaken , and became as the dead .
40028005	But the angel answered and said to the women , Fear not ye ; for I know that for Jeshu who was crucified you are seeking .
40028006	He is not here : for he is risen , even as he said . Come , see the place in which our Lord was laid :
40028007	and go with speed , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the house of the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galila . There shall you see him . Lo , I have told you .
40028008	And they went quickly from the sepulchre , with fear and with great joy , and ran that they might tell his disciples .
40028009	And , behold , Jeshu met them , and said to them , Peace to you ! And they approached , held him by the feet , and adored him .
40028010	Then said Jeshu to them , Fear not ; but go tell my brethren , that I will go into Galila , and there they shall see me .
40028011	But while they went , there came certain from those guards into the city , and told the chief priests every thing that had been done .
40028012	And they assembled with the elders , and took counsel ; and they gave money not a little to the guards ,
40028013	telling them , Say you that his disciples came ( and ) stole him away in the night , while we slept .
40028014	And if this be heard before the governor , we will persuade him , and make you without care .
40028015	But they , when they had received the money , did as they had instructed them ; and that saying went forth among the Jihudoyee until to-day .
40028016	But the eleven disciples went into Galila , unto the mountain where Jeshu had appointed them .
40028017	And when they saw him , they worshipped him ; but from them some had doubted .
40028018	And Jeshu drew near , and discoursed with them , and said to them , There is given unto me all power in heaven and in earth .
40028019	As the Father sent me , so also I send you . Go therefore , disciple all nations , and baptize them in the name ( of ) the Father , and ( of ) the Son , and ( of ) the Spirit of Holiness .
40028020	And teach them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you . And , behold , I am with you all the days , until the consummation of the world . Amen .
41001001	THE beginning of the Gospel of Jeshu Meshicha , the Son of Aloha .
41001002	As it is written in Eshaia the prophet : Behold , I send my angel before thy face , Who shall make straight thy way .
41001003	The voice which crieth in the desert , Prepare the way of the Lord , Make level his paths .
41001004	Juchanon was in the desert , baptizing , and proclaiming the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
41001005	And all the region of Jehud and all the sons of Urishlem went out to him ; and he baptized them in Jurdan the river , while they were confessing their sins .
41001006	But Juchanon himself was clothed with a garment of the hair of camels , and engirded with a belt of leather upon his loins ; and his food was locusts and wilderness honey .
41001007	And he proclaimed and said , Behold , ( One ) cometh after me , who is mightier than I ; he , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to bow myself to unloose .
41001008	I have baptized you with waters ; but he shall baptize you with the Spirit of Holiness .
41001009	And it was in those days that Jeshu came from Natsrath of Galila , and was baptized in Jurdan by Juchanon .
41001010	And as soon as he had ascended from the waters , he saw the heavens part asunder , and the Spirit , as a dove , descend upon him .
41001011	And the voice was from the heavens , Thou art my Son , the Beloved : in thee I have delighted .
41001012	And immediately the Spirit led him forth into the desert .
41001013	And he was there in the desert forty days , being tempted by Satana : and he was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered to him .
41001014	BUT after Juchanon was delivered up , Jeshu came to Galila , and proclaimed the annunciation of the kingdom of Aloha .
41001015	And he said , The time is complete ; the kingdom of Aloha cometh : repent , and believe the gospel .
41001016	And while he walked about the sea of Galila , he saw Shemun and Andreas his brother , who were casting nets into the sea : for they were fishers .
41001017	And Jeshu said to them , Come after me , and I will make you fishers of the sons of men .
41001018	And at once they forsook their nets , and went after him .
41001019	And when he had passed on a little , he saw Jakub bar Zabdai and Juchanon his brother ; and they also were in a vessel , preparing their nets .
41001020	And he called them ; and forthwith they left Zabdai their father with the hirelings , and went after him .
41001021	And when they were come to Kapher-nachum , he forthwith taught on the sabbaths in their assemblies .
41001022	And they wondered at his doctrine ; for he taught them as having power , and not as their Sophree .
41001023	And there was in their assembly a man who had an unclean spirit : and he cried
41001024	and said , What to us and to thee , Jeshu Natsroya ? Art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art , the Holy One of Aloha .
41001025	And Jeshu restrained him , and said , Close thy mouth , and come forth from him .
41001026	And the impure spirit threw him down , and cried with a high voice , and went forth from him .
41001027	And all wondered , and questioned one with another , Who is this ? and what is this new doctrine ? because with authority he commandeth the impure spirits , and they obey him .
41001028	And his fame soon went out through all the region of Galila .
41001029	And he proceeded from the assembly , and came to the house of Shemun and Andreas with Jacub and Juchanon .
41001030	And the mother-in-law of Shemun was lying in a fever ; and they told him concerning her .
41001031	And he approached , took her by her hand ; and she arose , and at once the fever left her , and she served them .
41001032	Then in the evening at sun-setting they brought to him all those who were grievously affected and demoniacs .
41001033	And the whole city was assembled at the gate :
41001034	and he healed multitudes who were grievously affected with various diseases , and cast out many demons , and would not permit the demons to speak ; for they knew him .
41001035	AND in the morning he arose long before ( day ) , and went into a solitude , and there prayed .
41001036	And Shemun and ( they ) who ( were ) with him sought for him ;
41001037	and when they had found him , they said to him , All men are seeking thee .
41001038	He said to them , Proceed you to the neighbouring towns and cities ; for there also I will preach , because for this am I come .
41001039	And he preached in all their assemblies in all Galila , and cast out devils .
41001040	And a leper came to him , and fell at his feet , and besought him , and said to him , If thou wilt , thou canst cleanse me .
41001041	And Jeshu had compassion on him , and stretched forth his hand , touched him , and said , I will , be clean .
41001042	And in that very hour his leprosy went from him , and he was cleansed .
41001043	And he restrained him , and led him forth ,
41001044	and said to him , See lest thou tell any one ; but go , show thyself to the priests , and offer the oblation for thy purification as Musha commanded for their testimony .
41001045	But he , when he was gone forth , began to announce it much , and so divulged the matter as that Jeshu could not go openly in the city , but was without in a solitary part : and they came to him from every place .
41002001	AND Jeshu entered again into Kapher-nachum for some days . And when they had heard that he was in the house ,
41002002	many were gathered together , so that it could not contain them , nor yet ( the space ) before the gate ; and he spake with them the word .
41002003	And they came to him , and brought him a paralytic borne between four .
41002004	And when they could not approach him for the crowd , they ascended to the roof , and took the covering from the place where Jeshu was , and let down the couch on which the paralytic lay .
41002005	When Jeshu saw their faith , he said to the paralytic himself , My son , forgiven to thee are thy sins .
41002006	But some of the Sophree and Pharishee were there , who sat and reasoned in their heart ,
41002007	Who is this uttering blasphemy ? Who can forgive sins but One , Aloha ?
41002008	But Jeshu knew in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves , and said to them , Why reason you these things in your heart ?
41002009	Which is easier , to say to the paralytic , Forgiven are thy sins , or to say , Arise , lift up thy couch , and walk ?
41002010	But , that you may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , he said to the paralytic ,
41002011	To thee I say , Arise , take up thy couch , and go to thy house .
41002012	And he arose at once , and took up his couch , and went forth before them all ; so that all wondered , and glorified Aloha , saying , Never saw we thus .
41002013	AND he went forth again to the sea ; and the whole multitude came to him , and he taught them .
41002014	And when he had passed , he saw Levi bar Chalphai sitting among the publicans : and he said to him , Come after me ; and arising , he went after him .
41002015	And while he reclined in the house , many publicans and sinners reclined with Jeshu and with his disciples ; for they were many , and they followed him .
41002016	And the Sophree and Pharishee , when they saw him eat with publicans and with sinners , said to his disciples , Why with publicans and with sinners doth he eat and drink ?
41002017	But when Jeshu heard , he said to them , The healthy have no need of the physician , but they who are sorely affected : I have not come to call the righteous but the sinners .
41002018	Now the disciples of Juchanon and of the Pharishee fasted . And they came and said to him , ( While ) the disciples of Juchanon and of the Pharishee fast , why do not thy disciples fast ?
41002019	Jeshu said to them , Can the sons of the marriage-chamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? No ;
41002020	but the days shall come when the bridegroom shall be taken up from them : then shall they fast in those days .
41002021	No man inserteth a new piece , and seweth it upon an old vestment ; lest that new should take away its fulness from the old , and make the rent the greater .
41002022	And no man putteth new wine into old bottles ; lest the wine rend the bottles , and the bottles perish , and the wine be spilled : but they put new vine into new bottles .
41002023	AND it was that , as Jeshu went among the grain , his disciples walked and plucked the ears .
41002024	And the Pharishee said to him , See how on the shabath they do what is not lawful .
41002025	Jeshu saith to them , Have you never read what David did , when he needed and was hungry , he , and they ( who were ) with him ?
41002026	how he entered the house of Aloha , when Abiathar was high priest , and did eat the bread of the table of the Lord , that which it is not lawful except for the priests to eat , and gave also to those who were with him ?
41002027	And he said to them , that the shabath on account of the Son of man was made , and not the Son of man on account of the shabath .
41002028	The Son of man , therefore , is the Lord also of the shabath .
41003001	And Jeshu again entered the congregation : and a certain man was there whose hand was withered ;
41003002	and they watched him whether he would cure him on the shabath , that they might accuse him .
41003003	And he said to him , the man with the withered hand , Stand up in the midst .
41003004	He said also to them , Is it lawful on the shabath to do good , or ( that ) which ( is ) evil ? to save life , or to destroy it ? But they were silent .
41003005	And he beheld them with indignation , while it grieved him on account of the hardness of their hearts . And he said to the man , Stretch out thy hand . And he stretched ( it ) ; and his hand straightened .
41003006	And the Pharishee went out immediately , and took counsel against him , how they might destroy him .
41003007	And Jeshu with his disciples went towards the sea : and many people joined him from Galila , and from Jehud ,
41003008	and from Urishlem , and from Edum , and from beyond Jurdan , and from Tsur , and from Tsaidon ; great multitudes , who , having heard all that he had done , came to him .
41003009	And he spoke to his disciples to bring a vessel for him , that the crowds might not oppress him ;
41003010	for he had healed multitudes , until they were falling upon him to touch him .
41003011	And they who were troubled with impure spirits , when they saw him , fell down , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of Aloha .
41003012	And he strongly prohibited them to make him known .
41003013	AND he ascended a mountain , and called those whom he willed ; and they came to him .
41003014	And he chose twelve to be with him , and to send them to preach ,
41003015	and to have authority to heal diseases and to cast out devils .
41003016	And he named to Shemun the name of Kipha ;
41003017	and upon Jacub bar Zabdai , and Juchanon the brother of Jacub , he set the name of B'nai-regesh , which is , ( B'nai-râmo , ) Sons of thunder .
41003018	And Andreas , and Philipos , and Bar-Thulmai , and Mathai , and Thoma , and Jacub bar Chalphai , and Thadai , and Shemun the Zealous ,
41003019	and Jihuda S'carjuta , - he who betrayed him .
41003020	And they came to the house : and the assemblies gathered again , so that they could not eat bread .
41003021	And his relatives heard , and came forth to take him ; for they said , He hath gone out of himself .
41003022	And the Sophree , they who had come down from Urishlem , said , Belzebub is in him , and by the prince of devils he casteth out devils .
41003023	And Jeshu called them , and by similitudes said to them , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
41003024	For if a kingdom against itself be divided , that kingdom cannot stand ;
41003025	and if a house against itself be divided , that house cannot stand ;
41003026	and if Satan rise against Satan , and be divided , he cannot stand , but his end is .
41003027	No one can enter into the house of the strong , and spoil his goods , unless first the strong one he bind ; and then his house he may destroy .
41003028	Amen I say to you , That all sin and blasphemy which the sons of men blaspheme may be remitted them ;
41003029	but whosoever shall blaspheme against the Spirit of Holiness hath no remission for ever , but is condemned to the judgment that is eternal .
41003030	Because they had said that an unclean spirit was in him .
41003031	AND there came his mother and his brethren , standing without ; and they sent to call him to them .
41003032	But the congregation sat about him . And they say to him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without inquire for thee .
41003033	And he answered , and said to them , Who is my mother , and who are my brethren ?
41003034	And looking upon those who sat with him , he said , Behold my mother , and behold my brethren :
41003035	for whosoever shall do the will of Aloha , he is my brother , and my sister , and my mother .
41004001	And he began again to teach by the sea-side : and great assemblies were gathered to him ; so that , ascending , he sat in a bark on the sea , and the whole multitude stood on the land , by the edge of the water .
41004002	And he instructed them by many parables , and said in his teaching ,
41004003	Listen : Behold , a sower went forth to sow ;
41004004	and as he sowed , some fell by the way-side , and the fowl came and devoured it .
41004005	And other fell upon the rock , so that it had not much earth ; and it soon came up , because it had not depth of earth :
41004006	but when the sun arose , it became hot ; and inasmuch as it had no root , it dried up .
41004007	And other fell in a place of thorns ; and the thorns sprang up , and choked it , and it gave no fruits .
41004008	But other fell upon good ground ; and it came up , and grew , and gave fruits , some thirty , some sixty , and some a hundred .
41004009	And he said , Whoever hath ears to hear , let him hear .
41004010	And when he was alone , they who were with him along with his twelve inquired of him that parable .
41004011	And Jeshu said to them , To you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of Aloha ; but to those without every thing is in parables :
41004012	that while seeing they may see , and not see ; and while hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest they should be converted , and their sins be forgiven them .
41004013	And he said to them , Do you not know this parable ? how will you know all parables ?
41004014	The sower who sowed , the word sowed .
41004015	These which were by the way-side , these are they in whom the word is sown ; and when they have heard , immediately cometh Satana , and taketh up the word which was sowed in their heart .
41004016	And these who upon the rock are sowed , these are they who , when they have heard the word , at once with joy receive it :
41004017	but they have no root in themselves , but are ( only ) for a time ; and when there is affliction or persecution on account of the word , they are soon offended .
41004018	And these who in the place of thorns are sown , these are they who hear the word ;
41004019	and the care of this world , and the deceptiveness of wealth , and the remainder of other lusts , entering , choke the word , and it is without fruits .
41004020	And these who in good ground are sowed , these are they who hear the word , and receive , and give fruits , thirty , and sixty , and a hundred .
41004021	And he said to them , A lamp never cometh to be put under a measure , or under a bed : is it not set upon a candlestick ?
41004022	For nothing is hid which shall not be revealed ; nor is there any thing in secret which is not to be manifested .
41004023	If any man hath ears to hear , let him hear .
41004024	AND he said to them , Consider what you hear . With that measure which you mete , you shall have measured to you ; and there shall be , added to you those which you hear .
41004025	For whosoever hath , unto him shall be given ; and whosoever hath not , that also which he hath shall be taken from him .
41004026	And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as a man who shall cast seed into the earth ;
41004027	and shall sleep , and rise up by night and day , and the seed shall increase , and become long , while he knoweth not ,
41004028	For the earth yieldeth him fruit ; and first is there the plant , and after it the ear , but lastly the completed corn in the ear .
41004029	But when the fruit is mature , immediately cometh the sickle , because the harvest is come .
41004030	And he said , To what may we compare the kingdom of Aloha ? and with what comparison shall we compare it ?
41004031	It is like a grain of mustard , which , when sown in the earth , is smaller than all seeds which are in the earth :
41004032	and when it is sown , it springeth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and maketh great branches ; so that in its shadow the fowl can dwell .
41004033	In parables such as these spake Jeshu with them , in parables such as they could hear .
41004034	And without parable did he not speak with them : but to his disciples , between him and them , he explained all .
41004035	AND he said to them that day , in the evening , Let us pass to the opposite shore .
41004036	And they sent away the assembles , and took him into the vessel ; and other vessels were with him .
41004037	And there was a great commotion and wind , and the waves fell upon the vessel , which was nigh being filled .
41004038	But Jeshu upon a pillow slept in the after-part of the vessel , and they came and raised him , saying to him , Raban , hast thou no care that we are perishing ?
41004039	And he arose , and restrained the wind , and said to the sea , Peace , be silent . And the wind ceased , and there was a great stillness .
41004040	And he said to them , Why feared ye ? how is it ye have no faith ?
41004041	And they feared with great fear , and said among themselves , Who is this , to whom the winds and the sea are obedient ?
41005001	AND they came to the other side of the sea , to the region of the Gadroyee .
41005002	And when he had come from the vessel , there met him from the place of tombs a man who had an unclean spirit ,
41005003	and he dwelt in the place of tombs ; and with chains no man could bind him :
41005004	for , so often as with shackles and chains he had been bound , the chains he had broken , and the shackles he had burst asunder ; and no man could subdue him .
41005005	And at all time , by night and by day , he was in the place of tombs , and in the mountains , crying out , and bruising himself with stones .
41005006	But when he saw Jeshu from afar , he ran , worshipped him ,
41005007	and cried with a high voice , and said , What to me and to thee , Jeshu , Son of Aloha the Most High ? I adjure thee by Aloha , that thou torment me not !
41005008	For he had said to him , Come forth from the man , unclean spirit !
41005009	And he questioned him , How is thy name ? And he said to him , Legion is our name , because we are many .
41005010	And he besought him much that he would not send him out of the region .
41005011	Now at the mountain there was a great herd of swine feeding .
41005012	And the devils besought him , saying , Send us into those swine , that into them we may enter .
