41005013	And he suffered them . And those unclean spirits went forth and entered into the swine ; and that herd ran to the rock , and plunged into the sea , as two thousand , and were drowned in the waters .
41005014	And they who kept them fled , and told in the city , and also in the hamlets ; and they came forth to see what was done .
41005015	And they came to Jeshu , and saw him who ( had had ) the devils , sitting , clothed , and sane ; him , who had had in him the legion and they were afraid .
41005016	And they who had seen , related to them what had been done to him who had had the devils , and also concerning those swine .
41005017	And they began to beg of him to go from their coast .
41005018	And when he had ascended the vessel , he in whom had been the devils besought him that he might be with him .
41005019	But he permitted him not ; but said to him , Go to thy house , to thy men , and show them what the Lord hath done for thee , and ( how he ) hath had mercy on thee .
41005020	And he went , and began to preach in the ten cities what Jeshu had done for him : and all marvelled .
41005021	AND when Jeshu had passed in the vessel to the opposite side , there were again congregated unto him great gatherings , while he was upon the shore of the sea .
41005022	And there came one whose name was Jorosh , one of the masters of the synagogue ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
41005023	and besought him much , saying to him , My daughter is greatly afflicted ; come , lay thy hand upon her , and she will be healed , and live .
41005024	And Jeshu went with him ; and a great multitude adhered to him , and oppressed him .
41005025	But a certain woman , who had a defluxion of blood twelve years ,
41005026	who much had suffered from many physicians , and had expended all whatever she had , and was nothing helped , but also the more afflicted ,
41005027	having heard of Jeshu , came in the press of the crowd behind him , and touched his vestment .
41005028	For she said , If I but touch his vestment , I shall live .
41005029	And immediately the fountain of her blood was dried ; and she felt in her body that she had been healed from her plague .
41005030	But Jeshu at once knew within himself that power had gone forth from him , and he turned to the crowd , and said , Who touched my garments ?
41005031	His disciples say to him , Thou seest the crowds that oppress thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
41005032	And he looked round to see who this had done .
41005033	But the woman herself , fearing and trembling , because she knew what had been done for her , came , fell before him , and told him all the truth .
41005034	But he said to her , My daughter , thy faith hath saved thee ; go in peace , and be healed from thy plague .
41005035	And while he was speaking , there came some of the house of the master of the synagogue , saying , Thy daughter is dead : for what then art thou wearying the Teacher ?
41005036	But Jeshu heard the word which they spake , and said to the master of the synagogue , Fear not , only believe .
41005037	And he did not permit any one to go with him , except Shemun Kipha , and Jacub , and Juchanon , brother of Jacub .
41005038	And they came to the house of that master of the synagogue , and he saw how they made a tumult , and wept and bewailed .
41005039	And he entered , and said to them , Why make you a tumult , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but asleep .
41005040	And they derided him . But Jeshu put them all forth , and took the father of the damsel , and her mother , and those who were with her , and went in where the damsel was lying .
41005041	And he took the hand of the damsel , and said to her , Damsel , arise .
41005042	And forthwith the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was a daughter of twelve years . And they wondered with great admiration .
41005043	And he charged them greatly that no one should know this , and spake that they should give her ( somewhat ) to eat .
41006001	AND Jeshu went forth from thence , and came to his city ; and his disciples adhered to him .
41006002	And when it was shabath , he began to teach in the house of the congregation : and many who heard wondered , and said , Whence to him are these ? and what is this wisdom which hath been given him , that miracles such as these by his hands should be done ?
41006003	Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mariam , and the brother of Jacub , and of Josi , and of Jehuda , and of Shemun ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended with him .
41006004	And Jeshu said to them , No prophet is despised , unless in his own city , and among his kinsfolk , and in his own house .
41006005	And he could not do there any miracle , except that upon a few sick he laid his hands , and healed them
41006006	And he wondered at the defectiveness of their faith . AND he itinerated through the villages , teaching .
41006007	And he called his twelve , and began to send them two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits to cast them out .
41006008	And he instructed them to take nothing for the journey , except a staff only ; not a wallet , nor bread , nor brass in their purses ;
41006009	but be shod with sandals , and not to be clothed with two tunics .
41006010	And he said to them , Into whatsoever house you enter , there be until you go forth from thence .
41006011	And every one who will not receive you , nor hear you , when you are going out from thence , beat off the dust that is beneath your feet for their testimony . And Amen I say to you , That it shall be more tolerable for Sadum and for Amura in the day of the judgment , than for that city .
41006012	And they went forth , and preached that they should repent .
41006013	And many devils they cast out , and anointed with oil the sick , and healed many .
41006014	AND Herodes the king heard concerning Jeshu , for his name had become known ; and he said , Juchanon the Baptizer hath risen from among the dead ; therefore works of power are wrought by him .
41006015	Others said , He is Elia ; and others , A prophet as one from the prophets .
41006016	But when Herodes heard , he said , It is Juchanon whom I beheaded ; he hath risen from among the dead .
41006017	For Herodes had sent and had taken Juchanon , and had cast him into the house of the bound , on account of Herodia , wife of Philipos his brother , whom he had taken .
41006018	For Juchanon had said to Herodes , It is not lawful to thee to take the wife of thy brother .
41006019	But Herodia herself was adverse to him , and wished to kill him , but she could not .
41006020	For Herodes feared Juchanon , because he knew that he was a man righteous and holy , and he protected him , and was many ( times ) hearing him , doing , and hearing him favourably .
41006021	And there was a notable day when Herodes , in the house of his nativity , ( b'beth yaldeh , ) made a feast to his chiefs and kiliarchs and the heads of Galila ;
41006022	and the daughter of Herodia came in ( and ) danced ; and she pleased Herodes and them who reclined with him . And the king said to the damsel , Ask of me whatever thou wilt , and I will give to thee .
41006023	And he sware to her , Whatever thou shalt ask ( of ) me , I will give thee , unto the dividing of my kingdom .
41006024	Then went she out and said to her mother , What shall I ask of him ? She saith to her , The head of Juchanon the Baptizer .
41006025	And immediately she entered with solicitude unto the king , and saith to him , I will this hour that thou give me , upon a dish , the head of Juchanon the Baptizer .
41006026	And greatly grieved was the king ; but , for the sake of the oath , and the sake of the guests , he could not deprive her .
41006027	But the king despatched at once a sentinel , and commanded that he should bring the head of Juchanon . And he went and cut off the head of Juchanon in the house of the bound ,
41006028	and brought ( it ) in a dish and gave to the damsel , and the damsel herself gave to her mother .
41006029	And his disciples heard and went , took up his corpse , and laid it in the place of the buried .
41006030	AND the disciples gathered unto Jeshu , and told him all whatever they had done , and whatever they had taught .
41006031	And he said to them , Come and let us go into the desert alone , and rest a little while ; for there were multitudes going and coming , ( so that ) they had not space even to eat ;
41006032	and they went to a wilderness district in a vessel by themselves .
41006033	And many saw them as they went , and knew them ; and into the waste ran they from all the cities , and were there before him .
41006034	And Jeshu coming forth beheld the great assemblies , and had compassion upon them , they being like sheep which had no shepherd ; and he began to teach them many things .
41006035	And when much time had passed , the disciples came to him and said to him , This place is waste , and the time is great ;
41006036	send them away to go to the farms around us and into the villages , and buy for themselves bread , for they have nothing to eat .
41006037	But he said to them , Give you them to eat . They said to him , Shall we go and buy bread for two hundred dinoreen , and give them to eat ?
41006038	But he said , Go see how many loaves you have here ; and when they had seen , they said to him , Five loaves and two fishes .
41006039	And he directed that they should make them all recline in companies upon the herbage ;
41006040	and they reclined in companies , by hundreds and by fifties .
41006041	And he took the five loaves and the two fishes , and looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the bread , and gave to his disciples to set before them : and those two fishes they divided among them all ,
41006042	and they all did eat and were satisfied .
41006043	And they took up the broken pieces , twelve baskets full , and from the fishes .
41006044	Now they who had eaten bread were five thousand men .
41006045	And immediately he constrained his disciples to ascend into the bark , and to go before him across to Beth-tsaida , while he dismissed the assemblies ;
41006046	and when he had sent them away , he went to a mountain to pray .
41006047	BUT when it was eventide , the bark was in the midst of the sea , and himself alone upon the land .
41006048	And he saw them that they were distressed with rowing ; for the wind was against them . And in the fourth watch of the night Jeshu came to them walking upon the waters , ( as though ) he willed to pass by them :
41006049	but they beheld him walking upon the waters , and thought it was a spectre , and they cried out ;
41006050	for all saw him and were afraid . But he immediately spoke to them and said to them , Take heart , I am , fear not .
41006051	And he ascended to them into the ship , and the wind was still : and they wondered greatly , and were astonished among themselves .
41006052	For they understood not from that bread , because their heart was gross .
41006053	And when they had crossed over , they came to the land of Genesar .
41006054	And when they had gone forth from the bark , the men of the place at once recognised him .
41006055	And they ran throughout all that land , and began to bring those who were greatly afflicted , bearing them on couchettes , to where they heard that he was .
41006056	And wherever he entered , into villages and cities , they placed the sick in the streets , and besought from him that they might touch only the edge of his mantle ; and all they who touched him were healed .
41007001	AND there gathered to him Pharishee and Sophree , who had come from Urishlem ;
41007002	and they saw some of his disciples eating bread with their hands not washed ; and they complained .
41007003	For all the Jihudoyee and Pharishee , unless they carefully wash their hands , do not eat , because they hold the tradition of the elders ;
41007004	and ( coming ) from the market , unless they lave , they eat not . And many other of those ( things ) there are which they have received to observe , ( as ) the baptisms of cups , and of measures , and of brasen utensils , and of beds .
41007005	And the Sophree and Pharishee questioned him , Why do not your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders ; but , while their hands are not washed , eat bread ?
41007006	But he said to them , Well prophesied concerning you Eshaia the prophet , you hypocrites ; as it is written , This people with their lips honour me , but their heart is very far from me .
41007007	But in vain do they reverence me while they teach the teachings of the commandments of men .
41007008	For you have abandoned the commandment of God and hold the tradition of men , as the baptisms of cups and measures , and many things like these .
41007009	He said to them ( moreover ) , You decently suppress the commandment of God , that you may establish your tradition .
41007010	For Musha hath said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and whosoever curseth father and mother , the death he shall die .
41007011	But you say , If a man shall say to his father , or to his mother , My oblation , ( be that ) whatever from me thou mayest profit ;
41007012	and you permit him not to do any thing for his father and his mother .
41007013	But you reject the word of Aloha for the sake of the tradition which you have delivered : and many similar ( observances ) to these you practise .
41007014	And Jeshu called the whole multitude , and said to them , Hear me , all of you , and understand :
41007015	It is not that which is without the man , and which entereth into him , that can defile him : but that which proceedeth from him , that defileth a man .
41007016	He who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
41007017	But when Jeshu had gone into the house ( apart ) from the multitude , his disciples asked him concerning that parable .
41007018	He said to them , How dull are even you ! Know you not , that nothing from without that entereth a man can defile him ,
41007019	because it entereth not into his heart , but into his belly , and is cast out in the purgation which all food purgeth ?
41007020	But that which proceedeth from a man , that polluteth a man .
41007021	For from within , from the heart of the sons of men , go forth evil thoughts , adultery , fornication , robbery , murder ,
41007022	rapacity , malice , fraud , obscenity , an evil eye , blasphemy , vain-glory , folly ;
41007023	all these evils come from within , and they defile a man .
41007024	FROM thence Jeshu arose and went to the confine of Tsur and of Tsaidon , and entered into a certain house : and he was unwilling that any man should know of him , but he could not conceal .
41007025	For immediately heard a certain woman concerning him , whose daughter had an unclean spirit ; and she came , ( and ) fell before his feet .
41007026	But that woman was a Gentile of Phuniki of Suria , and she prayed of him to cast out the demon from her daughter .
41007027	But Jeshu said to her , Let the children first be filled ; for it is not well to take the bread of the children and cast it to the dogs .
41007028	But she answering said to him , Yes , my Lord , yet the dogs also from beneath the table eat the crumbs of the children .
41007029	Jeshu saith to her , Go ; on account of that word , the demon hath gone forth from thy daughter .
41007030	And she went to her house , and found her daughter lying on the couch , and the demon had gone out from her .
41007031	Jeshu again departed from the confine of Tsur and of Tsaidon , and came to the sea of Galila , on the confine of the Ten Cities ;
41007032	and they brought to him a blind man , a stammerer , and besought him to lay upon him the hand .
41007033	And he took him aside from the crowd by himself , and put his fingers in his ears , and spat , and touched his tongue .
41007034	And he looked up to heaven , and sighed , and said to him , Be opened :
41007035	and in that hour his ears were opened , and the bond of his tongue was loosed , and he spake plainly .
41007036	And he charged them that to no man they should tell this . But so much as he charged them , they the more proclaimed it ;
41007037	and they were exceedingly astonished , and said , He doeth every thing well ; the deaf he maketh to hear , and them who spoke not , to speak .
41008001	BUT in those days when the multitude was great and there was nothing for them to eat , he called his disciples , and said to them ,
41008002	I have compassion on this multitude , for behold three days have they continued with me , and there is nothing which they may eat .
41008003	And if it be that I send them away fasting to their houses , they will faint in the way ; for some of them come from afar .
41008004	His disciples say to him , Whence can any one here in the wilderness satisfy with bread all these ?
41008005	And he asked them , How many loaves have you ? They say to him , Seven ;
41008006	and he directed the multitudes to recline upon the ground , and he took those seven loaves , and blessed and brake and gave to his disciples that they should set , and they set before the assemblies .
41008007	And there were fishes , a few : and also over them he blessed , and said that they should set them .
41008008	And they all ate and were satisfied , and took up the abundancies of the fragments , seven panniers .
41008009	Now the men who had eaten were about four thousand : and he dismissed them ,
41008010	and immediately ascended into a vessel with his disciples , and came to the region of Dalmanutha .
41008011	AND there came forth Pharishee , and began to question with him , and they demanded of him the sign from heaven , tempting him .
41008012	And he groaned in his spirit , and said , Why seeketh this generation the sign ? Amen I say to you , There shall not be given the sign unto this generation .
41008013	And he left them , and ascended into the ship , and went to that overland .
41008014	And they had forgotten to take with them bread , and but one cake was with them in the ship .
41008015	And he counselled them , and said to them , Look and beware of the leaven of the Pharishee , and of the leaven of Herodes .
41008016	And they reasoned one with another , saying , Because we have no bread .
41008017	But Jeshu knew , and said to them , Why reason you because you have no bread ? do you not yet know nor under stand ? is your heart still hard ?
41008018	and eyes have you , and not see ? and ears have you , and not hear ? neither remember you ?
41008019	When those five loaves I brake to five thousand , how many baskets full of fragments did you take up ? They said to him , Twelve .
41008020	He saith to them . And when seven to four thousand , how many panniers of fragments when filled took you up ? They say , Seven .
41008021	He saith to them , How do you not yet understand ?
41008022	And he came to Beth-tsaida ; and they brought to him a blind man , and prayed of him to touch him .
41008023	And he took the hand of the blind man , and led him forth without from the village ; and spat in his eyes , and laid ( on them ) his hand , and inquired whether he saw .
41008024	And he looked , and said , I see the sons of man as the trees , walking .
41008025	Again he laid his hand upon his eyes , and he was restored , and he saw every thing clearly .
41008026	And he sent him to his house , and told him to go not into the village , nor to inform any man in the village .
41008027	And Jeshu went forth and his disciples into the villages of Kesarea of Philipos , and he interrogated his disciples by the way , saying to them , What say men concerning me that I am ?
41008028	But they answered , That ( thou art ) Juchanon the Baptizer ; and others , that ( thou art ) Elia ; and others , one from the prophets .
41008029	Jeshu said to them , But you , what say you concerning me that I am ? Shemun Kipha answered and said to him , Thus art the Meshicha , the Son of Aloha the Living .
41008030	And he charged them that to any one they should not tell concerning him .
41008031	And he began to teach them , that it was to be that the Son of man should suffer much , and be rejected by the elders , and by the chief priests , and by the Sophree , and be killed , and that the third day he should arise !
41008032	And he spake the word with them fully . And Kipha took him , and began to chide him .
41008033	But he turned , and , beholding his disciples , reprehended Shemun , and said , Get thee behind me , Satana , for thou thinkest not that which is of Aloha , but that which is of the sons of men .
41008034	AND Jeshu called to the assemblies with his disciples , and said to them , Whoever will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and come after me .
41008035	For every one who willeth to save his life shall lose it ; and every one who shall lose his life on account of me and on account of my gospel , shall save it .
41008036	For what is a man profited , if the whole world he gain , and his soul be lost ?
41008037	Or what shall a son of man give ( as ) the compensation for his soul ?
41008038	For whoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this generation , sinful and adulterous , the Son of man will also be ashamed of him , when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
41009001	AND he said to them , Amen I say to you , There are some who are standing here , who shall not taste death , until they shall have seen the kingdom of Aloha come with power .
41009002	And after six days Jeshu took Kipha , and Jacub , and Juchanon , and led them up to a high mountain by themselves . And he was altered before their eyes :
41009003	and his raiment shone , and became exceeding white as the snow ; as the sons of man on earth could not make white .
41009004	And there were seen with them Musha and Elia discoursing with Jeshu .
41009005	And Kipha said to him , Rabi , it is good for us here to be : and let us make three tabernacles ; for thee one , and for Musha one , and for Elia one .
41009006	But he knew not what he said , for they were in fear .
41009007	And there was the cloud , and it shadowed over them : and the voice was from the cloud , saying , This is my Son , the Beloved , him hear .
41009008	And instantly , while the disciples looked , they saw no man , but Jeshu alone with them .
41009009	And while they were descending from the mountain , he charged them to tell no man what they had seen , until the Son of man should have arisen from the dead .
41009010	And they held discourse among themselves , and inquired what was this word , when he should have arisen from among the dead .
41009011	And they asked him , saying , How then say the Sophree that Elia must come before ?
41009012	He said to them , Elia doth come before , to restore all things ; and how it is written concerning the Son of man , that much he should suffer , and be rejected .
41009013	But I tell you , Elia hath also come , and they have done to him whatever they would , as it is written concerning him .
41009014	AND when he came to his disciples , he saw with them a great crowd , and the Sophree questioning with them .
41009015	And immediately all the crowd saw him , and wondered , and ran to salute him .
41009016	And he inquired of the Sophree , What dispute you with them ?
41009017	And one from the company answered and said , Malphona , I had brought my son to thee , because he hath a spirit which speaketh not ;
41009018	and when he seizeth him , he dasheth him , and teareth and grindeth his teeth , and he becometh dry . And I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out , but they could not .
41009019	Jeshu answered , and said to him , O generation that believeth not ! how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I tolerate you ? bring him to me .
41009020	And they brought him unto him : and when the spirit saw him , he immediately dashed him , and he fell upon the ground ; and was convulsed , and was torn .
41009021	And Jeshu asked the father , How long is it from the time from which it was thus ? He saith to him , Behold , from his childhood .
41009022	And many times he casteth him into the fire , and into the waters , to destroy him : but whatever thou canst , help me , and have mercy upon me .
41009023	Jeshu saith to him , If thou canst believe , every thing can be to him who believeth .
41009024	And in a moment the father of the youth cried out , weeping and saying , I am believing ; help the defect of my faith .
41009025	But when Jeshu saw the people running together , and assembling to him , he rebuked the unclean spirit , and said to him , Spirit , deaf and unspeaking ! I command thee , come forth from him , and enter not into him again !
41009026	And that devil cried greatly , and crushed him , and went forth . And he became as the dead ; as that many would say , He is dead .
41009027	But Jeshu took him by the hand , and raised him .
41009028	But when Jeshu had gone into the house , his disciples inquired of him by themselves , Why could not we cast him out ?
41009029	Jeshu said to them , This kind with nothing can be cast out , but by fasting and prayer .
41009030	And when he had gone forth from thence , they passed into Galila : and he was not willing that any man should know of him .
41009031	And he taught his disciples , and told them , That the Son of man would be delivered into the hands of men , and they would kill him ; and that when he was slain , on the third day he should arise .
41009032	But they understood not his word , and feared to ask him .
41009033	AND they came to Kapher-nachum : and when they had entered the house , he asked them of what they had argued in the way among themselves .
41009034	But they were silent : for they had contended in the way one with another , who should be greatest among them .
41009035	And Jeshu sat , and he called the twelve , and said to them , Whoever wills to be the first , shall be the last of all , and the servant of all .
41009036	And he took a certain child , and made him stand in the midst : and he took him upon his arms , and said to them ,
41009037	Every one who receiveth ( one who is ) as this child in my name , me he receiveth : and whoever me receiveth , not me he receiveth , but Him who sent me .
41009038	Juchanon said to him , Rabi , we saw a man casting out devils in thy name ; and we forbad him , because he did not adhere to us .
41009039	Jeshu saith to them , Forbid him not ; for no man who doeth powerful works in my name , can soon speak of me that which is evil .
41009040	He therefore who is not against you is for you .
41009041	For every one who shall give you only a cup of waters to drink in the name that you are of the Meshicha , Amen I say to you , He shall not lose his reward .
41009042	And every one who shall offend one of these little ones who believe in me , it had been better for him that an ass-millstone had been set to his neck , and he had been cast forth into the sea .
41009043	But if thy hand offend thee , cut it off : better for thee mutilated to go into life , than having two hands to go into gihana ;
41009044	where their worm dieth not , and their fire is not quenched .
41009045	And if thy foot offend thee , cut it off : better for thee to go into life lame , than having two feet to fall into gihana :
41009046	where their worm dieth not , and their fire is not quenched .
41009047	And if thine eye offend thee , root it out : better for thee that with one eye thou enter the kingdom of Aloha , than having two eyes to fall into the gihana of fire :
41009048	where their worm dieth not , and their fire is not quenched .
41009049	For every ( thing ) with fire is salted , and every victim with salt shall be salted .
41009050	Good is salt : but if the salt shall ( become ) insipid , how shall it be salted ? Let there be in you salt , and in peace be one with another .
41010001	AND he arose from thence , and came to the borders of Jehud on the other side of the Jurdan : and great multitudes went thither to him ; and he taught them again as he was accustomed .
41010002	And the Pharishee drew nigh , tempting him , and demanding whether it were lawful for a man to dismiss his wife .
41010003	He saith to them , What hath Musha prescribed ?
41010004	But they say , Musha permitted us to write a writing of dismissal , and to send away .
41010005	Jeshu answered and said to them , On account of the hardness of your heart he wrote for you this commandment .
41010006	But from the beginning the male and the female Aloha made them .
41010007	For this cause a man shall leave his father and his mother ,
41010008	and shall cleave unto his wife ; and they two shall be one flesh : henceforth they are not two , but one flesh .
41010009	What Aloha therefore hath conjoined , man may not separate .
41010010	And his disciples asked him again in the house concerning this ( matter ) .
41010011	And he said to them , Every one who shall send away his wife , and take another , adulterizeth .
41010012	And if the wife shall leave her husband , and shall become another's , she adulterizeth .
41010013	And they presented unto him children , that he should touch them : but his disciples rebuked those who presented them .
41010014	But Jeshu , when he saw , was displeased , and said to them , Permit the children to come to me , and forbid them not : for of those who are as these is the kingdom of Aloha .
41010015	Amen I say to you , That whoever shall not receive the kingdom of Aloha as a child , shall not enter into it .
41010016	And he took them on his arms , and laid his hand upon them , and blessed them .
41010017	AND as he journeyed in the way , one ran , fell upon his knees , and asked him , saying , Good Teacher , what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life ?
41010018	Jeshu said to him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good but one , Aloha .
41010019	Thou knowest the commandments , Thou shalt not commit adultery , Thou shalt not steal , Thou shalt not kill , Thou shalt not witness false testimony , Thou shalt not injure , Honour thy father and thy mother .
41010020	But he answered and said to him , Malphona , these all have I kept from my childhood .
41010021	And Jeshu beheld him and loved him , and said to him , One thing is wanting to thee : go , sell all whatever thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have a treasure in heaven : and take up thy cross and come after me .
41010022	But he was grieved at that word , and went away sorrowful : for he had great riches .
41010023	And Jeshu beheld his disciples , and said to them , How hard to those who have riches to enter the kingdom of Aloha !
41010024	But his disciples were astonished at his words . And Jeshu answered again , and said to them , My sons , how hard ( is it ) for those who trust on their riches to enter into the kingdom of Aloha !
41010025	It is easier for a camel to go through the hole of a needle , than for a rich to enter into the kingdom of Aloha .
41010026	And they were the more astonished , and said among themselves , Who can be saved ?
41010027	Jeshu beheld them and said to them , With the sons of men this is not possible , but with Aloha : for every thing is possible with Aloha .
41010028	THEN began Kipha to say , Behold , we have forsaken every thing , and have cleaved to thee .
41010029	Jeshu responded and said , Amen I say to you , There is no man who forsaketh houses , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or fields , on account of me , and on account of my gospel ,
41010030	who shall not receive a hundred-fold now in this time , houses , and brethren , and sisters , and mothers , and children , and fields , with persecution ; and in the world which cometh the life that is eternal .
41010031	But many ( are ) first who will be last , and last ( who will be ) first .
41010032	Now when they were going up in the way to Urishlem , Jeshu himself preceded them ; and they were amazed , and came after him , fearing . And he took his twelve , and began to tell them what it was which was to happen to him .
41010033	Behold , we go up to Urishlem ; and the Son of man ( will be ) betrayed to the chief priests , and to the Sophree ; and they shall condemn him to the death , and shall deliver him to the Gentiles ;
41010034	and shall mock him , and scourge him , and spit in his face , and kill him : and the third day he shall arise .
41010035	AND Jacub and Juchanon , sons of Zabdai , approached him , saying to him , Malphona , we would that whatever we ask thou wilt do for us .
41010036	He saith to them , What will you that I should do for you ?
41010037	They say to him , Give us that one may sit at thy right hand , and one at thy left , in thy glory .
41010038	But he said to them , You know not what you ask : can you drink the cup that I drink ? and ( with ) the baptism that I am baptized ( with ) can you be baptized ?
41010039	They say to him , We can . Jeshu saith to them , The cup that I drink you shall drink ; and ( with ) the baptism that I am baptized ( with ) you shall be baptized :
41010040	but that you sit on my right hand and on my left , is not mine to give , except for those for whom it is prepared .
41010041	And when the ten heard , they began to murmur against Jacub and Juchanon .
41010042	And Jeshu called them and said to them , You know that they who are considered the princes of the Gentiles are lords of them ; and their great ones exercise power over them :
41010043	but not thus shall it be among you . But if any one among you willeth to be great , let him be to you the servant ;
41010044	and whoever of you willeth to be the first , he shall be the labourer for all .
41010045	For even the Son of man came not to be served , but to serve , and to give his life the ransom for many .
41010046	And they came unto Jirichu . And as Jeshu went forth from Jirichu , he and his disciples and a great multitude , Timai bar Timai , the blind man , was sitting by the side of the way begging .
41010047	And he heard that it was Jeshu Natsroia ; and he began to cry out , and to say , Son of David , have mercy on me !
41010048	And many rebuked him , that he should be silent : but he cried out the more , saying , Son of David , have mercy on me !
41010049	And Jeshu stood , and commanded that they should bring him . And they called the blind man , saying to him , Be of heart , rise , he calleth thee .
41010050	But he , the blind , loosed his garment , and rose up , ( and ) came to Jeshu .
41010051	Saith to him Jeshu , What wilt thou that I do for thee ? And he , the blind , said to him , Rabi , that I may see .
41010052	And Jeshu said to him , SEE : thy faith hath saved thee . And instantly he saw , and he went in the way .
41011001	AND when they drew nigh to Urishlem , against Bethphage and Beth-ania , at the mount of Olives , he sent two from his disciples ,
41011002	and said to them , Go to that village which is over against you ; and forthwith as you enter it , you will find a colt tied , which no man hath ridden ; loose , bring him .
41011003	And if any man shall say to you , Why do you this ? say to him , Because for our Lord it is requested , and at once he will send him hither .
41011004	And they went , and found the colt tied at the gate without in the street . And as they were loosing ,
41011005	some of those who were standing said to them , What are you doing that you loosen the colt ?
41011006	But they said to them as Jeshu had instructed them ; and they permitted them .
41011007	And they brought the colt to Jeshu , and threw upon him their garments ; and Jeshu rode upon him .
41011008	But many spread their vestments in the way , and others cut branches from the trees and spread them in the way ;
41011009	and these who went before him , and these who came after him , cried , saying , Save now !
41011010	and blessed be the coming kingdom of our father David : Save now , in the heights !
41011011	And Jeshu entered Urishlem , into the temple , and surveyed every thing . And when it was the time of the evening , he went forth to Beth-ania with the twelve .
41011012	And the day after , when he went from Beth-ania , he hungered .
41011013	And he saw a certain fig-tree from afar which had leaves on it , and he came to it , if he might find upon it somewhat ; but when he came , he found on it only the leaves , for the time was not for figs ( to have been ingathered ) .
41011014	And he said to it , Henceforth and for ever man from thee fruit shall not eat . And his disciples heard .
41011015	And they came to Urishlem . And Jeshu went into the temple of Aloha , and began to cast forth those who sold and bought in the temple , and he overthrew the tables of the money-changers , and the seats of them who sold doves :
41011016	and he would not suffer any man to carry goods through the temple .
41011017	And he taught , and said to them , Is it not written , That my house the house of prayer shall be called of all nations ? but you have made it a den of thieves .
41011018	And the chief priests and Sophree heard it , and inquired how they might destroy him ; for they feared from him , because all the people admired his doctrine .
41011019	AND when it was evening , they went without from the city .
41011020	And in the morning , while they passed by , they saw that fig-tree that it was dry from its root .
41011021	And Shemun remembered and said to him , Rabi , behold , that fig-tree which thou didst curse hath dried .
41011022	And Jeshu answered and said to them , Let there be in you the faith of Aloha .
41011023	Amen I say to you , That whosoever shall say to this mountain , Be lifted up , and fall into the sea , and shall not be divided in his heart , but shall believe that that thing which he speaketh is , he shall have the thing that he saith .
41011024	On this account I tell you , that every thing whatever you supplicate and ask , believe that you receive , and it shall be unto you .
41011025	And when you stand to pray , forgive whatever you have against any man ; and your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you your transgressions .
41011026	But if you do not forgive , your Father who is in heaven will also not forgive you your transgressions .
41011027	And they came again to Urishlem : and as he walked in the temple , the chief priests and the Sophree and the elders came to him ,
41011028	and said to him , By what authority these things doest thou ? and who gave thee the authority to do them ?
41011029	But Jeshu said to them , I also will ask you one word , that you may tell me , and I tell you by what authority I these things do .
41011030	The baptism of Juchanon , from whence was it ? from heaven , or from the sons of man ? Tell me .
41011031	And they reasoned among themselves , and said , If we say to him , that ( it was ) from heaven , he saith to us , And why did you not believe him ?
41011032	And if we should say , From the sons of man , there is fear from the people ; for all have held Juchanon that he was truly a prophet .
41011033	And they answered , saying to Jeshu , We know not . He saith to them , I also do not tell you by what authority I these things do .
41012001	And he began to discourse with them in parables . A certain man planted a vinery , and surrounded it with an enclosure , and dug in it a wine-press , and built in it a tower , and gave it to be held by husbandmen , and journeyed .
41012002	And he sent to the husbandmen his servant in the time to receive the fruits of the vinery .
41012003	But they beat him , and sent him away empty .
41012004	He sent to them again another servant ; and also that one they stoned , and bruised him , and sent him away with dishonour .
41012005	And he sent again another , and him they killed ; and many other servants he sent , and of them they beat , ( and ) of them they killed .
41012006	But at last having one son , the beloved , he sent him to them ; for he said , Now will they be confounded by my son .
41012007	But those husbandmen said among themselves , This is the heir ; come let us kill him , and the inheritance will be ours .
41012008	And they took and killed him , and cast him without from the vinery .
41012009	What therefore shall the Lord of the vinery do ? He will come , destroy those labourers , and will give the vinery to others .
41012010	And also that scripture have you not read , The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner ?
41012011	from the Lord is this done , and it is wondrous in our eyes .
41012012	And they sought to apprehend him , but feared from the people : for they knew that concerning themselves he had spoken this parable . And he left them , and went .
41012013	And they sent to him men from the Sophree and from the house of Herodes , that they should ensnare him in discourse .
41012014	And they came and questioned him : Malphona , we know that thou art true , and that thou bearest not care for man : for thou regardest not the person of the sons of man , but in truth the way of Aloha thou teachest : Is it lawful to give headmoney to Caesar , or not ?
41012015	shall we give , or shall we not give ? But he knew their deceit , and said to them , Why do you tempt me ? bring me the dinara , ( that ) I may see it .
41012016	And they brought it to him . He said to them , Of whom ( is ) this image and writing ? And they said , Of Caesar .
41012017	Jeshu said to them , Of Caesar give to Caesar , and of Aloha to Aloha . And they were astonished at him .
41012018	AND the Zadukoyee came to him , those who say that ( there is ) no resurrection ; and they questioned him , saying ,
41012019	Malphona , Musha has written for us , That if the brother of a man die , and leave a wife , and leave not children , his brother shall take his wife and raise up seed unto his brother .
41012020	Seven brethren there were . The first took a wife , and died , and left not seed .
41012021	And the second took her , and died , and he also left not seed : and the third likewise .
41012022	And the seven of them took her , and did not leave seed : last of all died also that woman .
41012023	In the resurrection therefore , whose from them shall she be the wife ? for the seven of them had her .
41012024	Jeshu saith to them , Do you not on this account err , because you know not the scripture , nor the power of Aloha ?
41012025	For when they rise from the dead , they take not wives , neither are wives ( given ) unto husbands ; but as the angels that are in heaven are they .
41012026	But concerning the dead , that they rise : have you not read in the book of Musha , how from the bush Aloha said to him , I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Ishok , and the God of Jacub ?
41012027	And Aloha is not of the dead , but of the living . You therefore do greatly err .
41012028	AND one from the Sophree approached and heard how they disputed , and , perceiving that he had well rendered to them the answer , inquired of him , Which is the first commandment of all ?
41012029	Jeshu saith to him , The first of all the commandments ( is ) , Hear , Israel , The Lord our Aloha is one Lord :
41012030	and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind , and with all thy strength : this is the first commandment .
41012031	And the second , which is like it , ( is ) that thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself . Another commandment greater than these there is not .
41012032	That Sophra said to him , Well , Rabi , and truly hast thou spoken : for One there is and no other than He :
41012033	and that a man love Him with all the heart , and with all the understanding , and with all the soul , and with all the strength , and that he love his neighbour as himself , is better than all burnt-offerings and sacrifices .
41012034	Jeshu , seeing that he had wisely returned the word , answered and said to him , Thou art not far from the kingdom of Aloha . And no man dared again to question him .
41012035	And Jeshu answered and said , while he taught in the temple , How say the Sophree that the Meshicha is son of David ?
41012036	For David himself saith by the Spirit of Holiness , The Lord said to my Lord , Sit thou at my right hand , until I set thy adversaries a footstool beneath thy feet .
41012037	David therefore himself calleth him My Lord ; and how is he then his son ? And all the multitude heard him gladly .
41012038	And in his doctrine he said to them , Beware of the Sophree , who will to walk in long robes , and love the shaloma in public places ,
41012039	and the chief seats in the congregations , and the head couches at suppers :
41012040	they who devour the houses of widows , and for the occasion prolong their prayers : they shall receive the greater judgment .
41012041	AND as Jeshu sat before the house of treasure , he beheld how the multitude cast money into the place of treasure ; and many rich threw in much .
41012042	And there came a certain poor widow , and threw in two menin , which are a shemona .
41012043	And Jeshu called to his disciples , and said to them , Amen I tell you , That this poor widow more than all the men who throw hath thrown into the house of treasure .
41012044	For all they from what is ( super ) abundant to them have thrown ( in ) , but this from her deficiency all whatever she had ; she hath thrown in her whole possession .
41013001	And as Jeshu went forth from the temple , one of his disciples said to him , Malphona , behold , see those stones and those buildings ?
41013002	But Jeshu said to him , Seest thou these great buildings ? There will not be left here a stone upon a stone which ( will ) not be destroyed .
41013003	And while Jeshu sat on the Mount of Olives before the temple , Kipha and Jacub and Juchanon and Andreas asked him by themselves ,
41013004	Tell us when ( these events ) shall be , and what is the sign when these all draw nigh to be accomplished .
41013005	But he , Jeshu , began to say to them , See that no man deceive you .
41013006	For many will come in my name , and will say , I am ( He ) ; and many will be deceived .
41013007	But when you hear of battles and the rumour of wars , fear not : for it is that they are to be ; but not yet is the end .
41013008	For people shall rise against people , and kingdom against kingdom ; and earthquakes will he in various places ; and there will be famines and convulsions . These are the beginning of sorrows .
41013009	But look ( to ) yourselves ; for they will deliver you to the judgments ; and in their assemblies will they scourge you , and before kings and governors you shall stand on account of their testimony .
41013010	But first will be preached my gospel among all the nations .
41013011	But when they lead you to deliver you up , be not previously anxious what you shall say , nor premeditate ; but that , whatever is given you in that hour , that say . For it is not you speaking , but the Spirit of Holiness .
41013012	But the brother will betray his brother to the death , and the father his son ; and children will rise up against their fathers , and shall put them to death ;
41013013	and you will be hated by all men on account of my name : but he who shall persevere to the end , he shall be saved .
41013014	But when you see the unclean sign of desolation , that which is spoken of by Daniel the prophet , standing where it ought not , ( he who readeth , let him understand ! ) then let those who are in Jehud flee to the mountain
41013015	And he who is upon the roof , let him not descend nor enter in to carry any thing from his house ;
41013016	and he who is in the field , let him not turn back to take up his garments .
41013017	But woe to those who are with child , and to those who give suck , in those days !
41013018	But pray that your flight may not be in the winter :
41013019	for in those days shall be affliction such as hath not been from the beginning of the creation which Aloha created , and until now , nor shall be .
41013020	And unless the Lord cut short those days , no flesh would live ; but on account of the elect whom he hath chosen , those days he hath cut short .
41013021	Then , if any man shall say to you , Behold , here is the Meshicha ! and , Behold , ( he is ) there ! believe not .
41013022	For there will arise false Meshichas and prophets of a lie , and will give forth signs and wonders , to deceive , if possible , the elect also . But you , beware .
41013023	Behold , I have told you every thing before .
41013024	But in those days after that affliction the sun will be darkened , and the moon will not give forth her light ,
41013025	and the stars will fall from heaven , and the powers of the heavens will be moved .
41013026	And then will they see the Son of Man coming in the cloud with great power and with glory .
41013027	And then will he send his angels , and will assemble his chosen ones from the four winds , from the extremity of the earth to the extremity of the heavens .
41013028	But from the fig-tree learn a parable . When her branches are tender , and she shoots forth her leaves , you know that the summer draws nigh :
41013029	so also you , when you see that these things are done , understand that it is near , ( even ) at the door .
41013030	Amen I tell you , That this race shall not pass until these all shall be .
41013031	Heaven and earth shall pass away , but my words shall not pass away .
41013032	But of that day and of that hour man knoweth not , nor the angels of heaven , nor the Son , but only the Father .
41013033	Look : be watchful and pray ; for you know not when the time is .
41013034	For as a man who hath journeyed , and left his house , and hath given authority to his servants , and to every man his work , and the door-keeper he hath instructed to be watchful ;
41013035	( so ) watch you , therefore , because you know not when cometh the Lord of the house , - in the evening , or in the dividing of the night , or at cock-crowing , or in the morning ;
41013036	lest he should come suddenly , and find you sleeping .
41013037	But what to you I say , that unto all I say , Be watchful .
41014001	BUT after two days was the Petscha of unleavened cakes : and the chief priests and the Sophree sought how with guile they might apprehend and kill him .
41014002	And they said , Not on the festival , lest there be a commotion among the people .
41014003	And when he was at Bethania in the house of Shemun the leper , as he reclined , there came a woman who had with her a vase of the balsam of the choicest nard of great prices ; and she opened it , and poured it upon the head of Jeshu .
41014004	But there were men of the disciples who were displeased among themselves , and said , Why make destruction of this balsam ?
41014005	for it could have been sold for more than three hundred dinoreen , and given to the poor . And they were angry with her .
41014006	But he , Jeshu , said , Let her alone ; why do you trouble her ? A good work hath she wrought upon me .
41014007	For in all time you have the poor with you , and , when you will , you can do them good ; but I am not at all time with you .
41014008	( With ) that which was hers she hath done this , and beforehand as for the funeral she hath anointed my body .
41014009	And Amen I say to you , That wheresoever my gospel shall be preached in the whole world , this also which she hath now done shall be told in memorial of her .
41014010	But Jihuda Scarjuta , one of the twelve , went to the chief priests , to betray Jeshu to them :
41014011	and they when they had heard rejoiced , and promised silver to give him . And he sought to him opportunity to betray him .
41014012	And the first day of the unleavened bread , in which the Jihudoyee sacrifice the Petscha , the disciples say to him , Where wilt thou that we go to prepare for thee to eat the Petscha ?
41014013	And he sent two of his disciples , and said to them , Go to the city , and , observe , a man meeteth you bearing a vessel of waters . Go after him ;
41014014	and when he hath entered , say to the house-lord , Our Master saith , Where is the place of feasting , where I can eat with my disciples the Petscha ?
41014015	And , behold , he showeth you a large upper room furnished and prepared : there make ready for us .
41014016	And the disciples went forth , and came into the city , and found as he had told them : and they prepared the Petscha .
41014017	And when it was evening he came with his twelve .
41014018	And as they reclined and ate , Jeshu said to them , Amen I tell you , That one of you who eateth with me shall betray me .
41014019	But they began to be sad , and said to him one , one , Is it I ?
41014020	But he said to them , One of the twelve who dippeth with me in the dish .
41014021	And the Son of man goeth , as it is written concerning him ; but woe to that man by whom is betrayed the Son of man ! It had been better for that man if he had not been born .
41014022	And while they were eating , Jeshu took bread , and blessed , and brake , and gave to them , and said to them , Take ; this is my body .
41014023	And he took the cup , and praised and blessed , and gave to them ; and they drank of it , all of them .
41014024	And he said to them , This is my blood of the new Covenant , which for many is shed .
41014025	Amen I say to you , That again I will not drink from the fruit of the vine till that day in which I will drink it newly in the kingdom of Aloha .
41014026	And they praised , and went forth to the mount of Olives .
41014027	AND Jeshu said to them , All of you will be offended with me in this night : for it is written , I will strike the Shepherd , and scattered shall be his sheep .
41014028	But when I have arisen , I go before you into Galila .
41014029	Kipha saith to him , If all shall be offended with thee , yet I ( will ) not .
41014030	Jeshu saith to him , Amen I tell thee , That thou , to-day , in this ( very ) night , before the cock shall crow , three times wilt deny me .
41014031	But he the more said , If I shall die with thee , I will not deny thee , my Lord . And so also all of the disciples said .
41014032	And they came to the place which is called Gedsimon ; and he said to his disciples , Sit here until I have prayed .
41014033	And he took with him Kipha and Jacub and Juchanon , and began to be sorrowful and agonized .
41014034	And he said to them , My soul is afflicted unto death ; wait for me here , and be watchful .
41014035	And he removed a little , and fell upon the earth , and prayed that , if it were possible , the hour might pass from him .
41014036	And he said , Father , my Father , thou canst ( do ) every thing , cause to pass from me this cup : but not my will , but thine .
41014037	And he came and found them sleeping : and he said to Kipha , Shemun , dost thou sleep ? couldst thou not one hour watch ?
41014038	Be wakeful and pray , that you enter not into temptation : the spirit is willing and ready , but the body is infirm .
41014039	And he went again , prayed , and said that word .
41014040	And he turned again , came and found them sleeping , because their eyes were made heavy , and they knew not what to say to him .
41014041	And he came three times ( the third time ) , and said to them , Sleep on , and be at rest . The end approacheth , and the hour cometh , and , behold , the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
41014042	Arise , we will go ; behold , he draweth nigh who betrayeth me .
41014043	And while he was speaking , Jihuda Scarjuta , one of the twelve , came , and with him a multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and the Sophree and the elders .
41014044	And the traitor who betrayed had given to them a sign , and said , He whom I shall kiss is He : take him carefully and lead him .
41014045	And immediately he approached , and said to him , Rabi , Rabi , and kissed him .
41014046	Then they laid on him their hands and seized him .
41014047	But one of those who stood drew a sword , and struck the servant of the high priest , and took off his ear .
41014048	But Jeshu answered and said to them , As against a robber are you come out against me , with swords and with staves to apprehend me ?
41014049	Every day with you was I teaching in the temple , and ye did not take me ; but to fulfil the scriptures this is done .
41014050	Then his disciples forsook him and fled .
41014051	But a certain youth followed him , and he was covered ( with ) a linen cloth , naked ; and they laid hold on him :
41014052	but he left the linen cloth , and escaped naked .
41014053	And they led Jeshu to Kaiapha , chief of the priests : and were gathered together to him all the chief priests and the scribes and the elders .
41014054	But Shemun from afar came after him , until within the court of the chief of the priests : and he sat with the servants , and warmed ( himself ) at the fire .
41014055	But the chief priests and all the assembly of them sought against Jeshu testimony to put him to death , but they found not .
41014056	For when many bore witness against him , their testimonies were not equal .
41014057	But men rose up against him , witnesses of falsehood , and said ,
41014058	We heard him say , I dissolve this temple which is made with hands , and in three days I build another not made with hands .
41014059	But neither so was their testimony equal .
41014060	And the chief of the priests arose in the midst , and questioned Jeshu , and said , Returnest thou no answer ? what witness against thee these ?
41014061	But Jeshu was silent , and answered him nothing . And again the chief of the priests demanded , and said , Art thou the Meshicha , the Son of the Blessed ?
41014062	And he , Jeshu , said to him , I am : and you shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of the Power , and coming upon the clouds of heaven .
41014063	Then the chief of the priests tore his robe , and said , Why now seek we witnesses ?
41014064	Behold , from his own lips you have heard the blasphemy : how is it seen by you ? And they all judged that he was guilty of death .
41014065	And some began to spit on his person , and they struck him on his face , and did buffet him , saying , Prophesy ! and the servitors struck him upon his cheeks .
41014066	And Shemun being below in the court , there came a certain damsel of the chief of the priests .
41014067	She saw him as he warmed ( himself ) , and knew him , saying to him , Thou also wast with Jeshu Natsroia .
41014068	But he denied , and said , I know not what thou sayest . And he went without into the vestibule ; and the cock crew .
41014069	And again that damsel saw him , and she began to say to those who were standing , This man is also of them .
41014070	But he again denied . And after a little while those who stood said to Kipha , Assuredly thou art from them , for thou art also a Galiloia , and thy speech is similar .
41014071	But he began to imprecate and to swear , I know not this man of whom thou speakest . And in the hour the cock crew the second time .
41014072	And Shemun remembered the word that Jeshu had spoken to him , That before the cock should crow twice , three times thou shalt deny me . And he began to weep .
41015001	AND forthwith in the morning the chief priests with the elders and with the scribes and with the whole congregation made council ; and they bound Jeshu , and led him and delivered him to Pilatos the governor .
41015002	And Pilatos asked him , Art thou the King of the Jihudoyee ? And he replied and said to him , Thou hast said .
41015003	And the chief priests accused him of many ( things ) :
41015004	but he , Pilatos , asked him again and said to him , Returnest thou not an answer ? see how many are witnessing against thee .
41015005	But he , Jeshu , did not give any answer ; so that Pilatos admired .
41015006	But he was accustomed at every festival to release to them of the bound one whom they requested ;
41015007	and there was one who was called Bar-aba , who was bound with the makers of sedition , they who murder in the sedition had committed .
41015008	And the people cried out and began to demand , that as he was used he would do to them .
41015009	But Pilatos answered and said , Will you that I release to you the King of the Jihudoyee ?
41015010	For Pilatos knew that for envy the chief priests had delivered him .
41015011	But the chief priests the more incited the multitude , that Bar-aba he should release to them .
41015012	But he , Pilatos , said to them , What then will you that I do to this , whom ye call King of the Jihudoyee ?
41015013	And they again cried , Crucify him !
41015014	Pilatos said to them , Why ? what evil hath he done ? And they the more exceedingly cried , Crucify him .
41015015	But Pilatos was willing to serve the will of the people , and released to them Bar-aba , and delivered up to them Jeshu , scourged , to be crucified .
41015016	And the soldiers led him into the court which is the praetorium , and called the whole band ;
41015017	and they robed him in purple , and twisted and set upon him a crown of thorns ,
41015018	and they began to salute him , Hail , King of the Jihudoyee !
41015019	and they struck him upon the head with a cane , and spat in his face , and kneeled upon their knees and worshipped him .
41015020	And when they had mocked him , they stripped him of the purple , and clothed him with his own vestments , and led him forth to crucify him .
41015021	AND they constrained one who was passing , Shemun Kurinoia , who was coming from the field , the father of Alexander and of Rufus , to bear his cross .
41015022	And they brought him to Gogultha , a place which is interpreted A skull .
41015023	And they gave him to drink wine which was mixed with myrrh ; but he would not receive .
41015024	And when they had crucified him , they parted his garments , and cast for them lots who should take them .
41015025	And it was the third hour when they crucified him .
41015026	And there was written the occasion of his death in the inscription , This is the King of the Jihudoyee .
41015027	And they crucified with him two thieves , one on his right and one on his left ;
41015028	and was accomplished the Scripture which said , That with the wicked he was reckoned .
41015029	AND they also who passed by blasphemed against him , wagging their heads and saying , Ho , undoer of the temple and builder of it in three days ,
41015030	deliver thyself and come down from the cross !
41015031	And so also the chief priests laughing one with one , and the Sophree , and saying , Others he saved , himself he cannot save .
41015032	The Meshicha King of Isroel , let him descend now from the cross , that we may see and believe on him ; and they also who were crucified with him reviled him .
41015033	AND when it was the sixth hour , there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour .
41015034	And in the ninth hour Jeshu cried with a high voice and said , Il , Il , Lamona Shabaktoni ! Which is , Alohi ! Alohi ! why hast thou forsaken me ?
41015035	And certain who heard , of them who were standing , said , Elia he calleth ;
41015036	but one ran and filled a sponge with vinegar , and bound it on a rod that he might drink . And they said , Let alone , we will see if Elia cometh to take him down .
41015037	But he , Jeshu , cried with a high voice , and completed :
41015038	and the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom .
41015039	But when that centurion who stood near him saw that he cried thus , and ended , ( he ) said , Assuredly this man was the Son of Aloha .
41015040	And there were women from afar who were beholding ; Mariam Magdalitha , and Mariam mother of Jacub the less and of Josi , and Shaloom ;
41015041	those who , when he was in Galila , adhered to him , and ministered to him , and many others who went up with him to Urishlem .
41015042	AND when it was evening of the preparation which is before the shabath ,
41015043	came Jauseph , he who was from Rometha , an honourable counsellor , who also himself waited for the kingdom of Aloha . And he took courage , and went in to Pilatos and requested the body of Jeshu .
41015044	But Pilatos wondered if he were now dead ; and he called the centurion and asked him whether before the time he was dead :
41015045	and when he had learned , he gave the body to Jauseph .
41015046	And Jauseph bought linen , and took him down and wrapped him in it , and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn in the rock , and rolled a stone against the door of the sepulchre .
41015047	But Mariam Magdalitha and Mariam , she who was ( the mother ) of Josi , beheld where he was laid .
41016001	And when the shabath had passed Mariam Magdalitha and Mariam , ( the mother ) of Jacub and Shaloom , bought aromatics , and came to anoint him .
41016002	BUT in the morning of the first day in the week , they came to the sepulchre when the sun had risen ,
41016003	and they said between themselves , Who will roll away the stone for us from the door of the sepulchre ?
41016004	And they looked and saw that the stone was rolled away , for it was very great .
41016005	And they went into the sepulchre , and saw a youth sitting on the right . And he was clothed in a white robe . And they were astonished .
41016006	But he said to them , Fear not ! Jeshu Natsroia you seek , he who was crucified , he has risen ; he is not here . Behold the place where he lay .
41016007	But go , tell his disciples and Kipha that , behold , he goeth before you into Galila ; there shall you see him as he told you .
41016008	And when they had heard , they fled , and went forth from the sepulchre , for astonishment and tremor had seized them ; and they said nothing to any one , for they were afraid .
41016009	But in the morning of the first day of the week he arose , and was first seen by Mariam Magdalitha , she who had seven devils cast out from her .
41016010	And she went and declared to them who were with her , who mourned and wept .
41016011	And they , when they had heard what they told , that he lived and had appeared to them , believed them not .
41016012	After these things he appeared to two of them in another fashion as they walked and went to a village .
41016013	And they went and told the rest , neither did they believe .
41016014	BUT afterward he appeared to the eleven as they reclined , and he reproved the littleness of their faith and the hardness of their heart , because those who had seen that he had arisen they had not believed .
41016015	And he said to them , Go into all the world , and proclaim my gospel to every creature :
41016016	He who believeth and is baptized is saved ; and he who believeth not is condemned .
41016017	And these signs shall follow those who believe : In my name they shall cast out devils , and with new tongues shall they speak ;
41016018	and serpents they shalt take up ; and if the poison of death they drink , it shall not hurt them ; and their hands shall they lay upon the sick , and they shall be healed .
41016019	But Jeshu our Lord , after he had spoken with them , unto the heavens ascended , and sat on the right hand of Aloha .
41016020	And they went forth and preached in every place , and our Lord helped them , and confirmed their words by the signs which they wrought .
42001001	BECAUSE many have willed to record histories of those transactions of which we are persuaded , according to that which they have delivered to us ,
42001002	( they ) who from the first were eye-witnesses and ministers of his doctrine ;
42001003	it appeared also to me , that having been intimately near to them all , I should record every thing in its order for thee , illustrious Theophile ,
42001004	that thou mayest know the truth of those doctrines in which thou hast been instructed .
42001005	THERE was in the days of Herodes , king of the Jihudoyee , a certain priest whose name was Zakaria , of the service of the house of Abia , and his wife ( was ) of the daughters of Aharun ; her name was Elishaba .
42001006	And they were both just before Aloha , and walked in all his commandments , and in the righteousness of the Lord , without blame .
42001007	But they had no son because Elishaba was barren , and both had become many in their days .
42001008	But it was while he was acting-as-priest in the order of his ministry before Aloha ,
42001009	according to the custom of the priesthood he came to set on incense , and entered into the temple of the Lord .
42001010	And all the congregation of the people were praying without at the time of incense .
42001011	And there appeared to him , to Zakaria , the angel of the Lord , standing on the right hand of the altar of incense .
42001012	And Zakaria trembled when he saw him , and fear fell upon him .
42001013	And the angel said to him , Fear not , Zakaria , for thy prayer is heard , and thy wife Elishaba shall bear thee a son , and thou shalt call his name Juchanon .
42001014	And to thee shall be joy and exultation , and many shall rejoice in his birth :
42001015	for he shall be great before the Lord , and wine and strong liquor shall he not drink , and with the Spirit of Holiness shall he be filled , from the womb of his mother .
42001016	And many of the sons of Isroel shall he convert to the Lord their Aloha .
42001017	And he shall go before him in the spirit and the power of Elia the prophet , to turn the hearts of the fathers unto the children , and those who believe not to the knowledge of the righteous , and to prepare for the Lord a perfect people .
42001018	And Zakaria said to the angel , How shall I know this ? for I am old , and my wife many in her days .
42001019	And the angel answered and said to him , I am Gabriel , I stand before Aloha , and I have been sent to speak with thee and to announce to thee these things .
42001020	From henceforth thou shalt be dumb , and shalt not be able to speak , till the day when these things shall be done , because thou hast not believed these words , which shall be fulfilled in their time .
42001021	But the people were standing , and expecting Zakaria . and were wondering at his delay in the temple .
42001022	But when Zakaria had come forth , he could not speak to them ; and he made them understand that he had seen a vision in the temple , and signing he signed to them , and remained dumb .
42001023	And when the days of his service were fulfilled , he came to his house .
42001024	And it was after those days Elishaba his wife conceived , and she secluded herself five months .
42001025	And she said , These things hath the Lord done for me in the days of my desolation , to take away my reproach from among the children of men .
42001026	BUT in the sixth month Gabriel the angel was sent from before Aloha to Galila , to a city whose name ( is ) Natsrath ,
42001027	unto a Virgin espoused to a man whose name was Jauseph , of the house of David , and the name of the Virgin was Mariam .
42001028	And the angel entered to her , and said to her , Peace to thee , full of grace ! our Lord is with thee , thou blessed among women !
42001029	But she , when she saw , was troubled at his words , and reasoned what this salutation was .
42001030	And the angel said to her , Fear not , Mariam , for thou hast found favour with Aloha .
42001031	For , behold , thou shalt conceive , and shalt bring forth a son , and thou shalt call his name Jeshu .
42001032	He will be great , and the Son of the Most High shall he be called , and Aloha the Lord shall give unto him the throne of David his father .
42001033	And he shall reign over the house of Jakub for ever , and of his kingdom there shall be no end .
42001034	And Mariam said to the angel , How shall this be , because a man is not known to me ?
42001035	The angel answered and said to her , The Spirit of Holiness shall come , and the Power of the Most High shall shadow over thee ; on account of this He who ( shall be ) born from thee is the Holy , and the Son of Aloha shall be called .
42001036	And behold , Elishaba thy kinswoman , she also beareth a son in her old age , and this is the sixth month to her , - to her who is called the barren .
42001037	For nothing is difficult to Aloha .
42001038	And Mariam said , Behold , I am the handmaid of the Lord , be it unto me as thou hast said . And the angel went from her .
42001039	AND Mariam arose in those days , and went with haste to the mountain to a city of Jehud ;
42001040	and she entered into the house of Zakaria , and saluted Elishaba .
42001041	And it was that when Elishaba heard the salutation of Mariam , the infant leaped in her womb . And she was filled with the Spirit of Holiness ;
42001042	and she cried with a loud voice , and said unto Mariam , Blessed art thou among women , And blessed is the fruit of thy womb !
42001043	Whence unto me is this , That the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
42001044	For , lo , as fell the voice of thy salutation on my ears , For great Joy leaped the infant in my womb .
42001045	And happy is she who hath believed , For there is a fulfilment of those things which have been spoken to her from the Lord .
42001046	And Mariam said : My soul doth magnify the Lord ,
42001047	And my spirit rejoiceth in Aloha my Saviour ,
42001048	Who hath looked upon the lowliness of his handmaid : For , behold , from now all generations shall give blessedness to me .
42001049	Because he hath done for me great things , he who is mighty , And holy is his name .
42001050	And his grace is for ages and generations Upon those who fear him .
42001051	He hath wrought victory with his arm ; He hath scattered the proud in the thoughts of their hearts .
42001052	He hath overturned the mighty from their thrones , And hath exalted the humble .
42001053	The hungry he hath satisfied with good things , And the rich he hath sent away empty .
42001054	He hath helped Isroel his servant , And hath remembered his mercy ;
42001055	As he spake with our fathers , With Abraham and with his seed for ever .
42001056	And Mariam stayed with Elishaba three months , and returned to her house .
42001057	BUT to Elishaba had come the time that she should give birth , and she gave birth to a son .
42001058	And her neighbours and the sons of her family heard that Aloha had magnified his grace upon her ; and they rejoiced with her .
42001059	And it was the eighth day , and they came to circumcise the child ; and they called him by the name of his father , Zakaria .
42001060	And his mother answered and said to them , Not so ; but he shall be called Juchanon .
42001061	And they said to her , No man in thy kindred is called by this name .
42001062	And they signed to his father ( to show ) how he willed they should call him .
42001063	And he requested a tablet , and wrote , and said , Juchanan is his name . And every man wondered .
42001064	And immediately his mouth and his tongue were opened , and he spake , and blessed Aloha .
42001065	And there was fear upon all around them ; and in all the hill country of Jehud were these things spoken .
42001066	And all who heard reasoned in their hearts , and said , What is this child to be ? And the hand of the Lord was with him .
42001067	And Zakaria his father was filled with the Spirit of Holiness , and he prophesied , and said :
42001068	Blessed be the Lord , the Aloha of Israel ; For he hath visited his people , and wrought for him redemption ,
42001069	And hath raised up for us the horn of redemption In the house of David his servant ;
42001070	As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets , Who have been from of old ,
42001071	That we should be delivered from our adversaries , And from the hand of all who hate us ;
42001072	To perform his grace with our fathers , And to remember his holy covenant ;
42001073	The oath which he sware to Abraham our father , -
42001074	That to us he would grant That , being delivered from the hand of our adversaries , Without fear we might serve before him
42001075	All our days in righteousness .
42001076	And thou , child , the Prophet of the Most High Shalt thou be called ; For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord , And thou shalt prepare his way ;
42001077	To give the knowledge of salvation to his people In the forgiveness of their sins ,
42001078	Through the compassions of the grace of our Aloha ; Whereby the morn-splendour shall visit us from on high ,
42001079	To illumine those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death . And to direct our feet into the way of peace .
42001080	And the child grew , and was strong in the spirit , and was in the desert till the day of his manifestation unto Isroel .
42002001	NOW it was in those days that there went forth a mandate from Augustus Caesar to enrol the people of his dominion .
42002002	This enrolment was first made under the government of Qurinos in Suria .
42002003	And every man went to be enrolled in his city .
42002004	And Jauseph also went up from Natsrath of Galila , unto Jehud , to the city of David , which is called Beth-lechem , because he was of the house and of the family of David ,
42002005	with Mariam his espoused while with child , there to be enrolled .
42002006	And it was that while they were there , the days were fulfilled that she should give birth :
42002007	and she brought forth her son , the first-born , and wrapped him in bandages , and laid him in the manger ; because there was no place for them where they stayed .
42002008	But there were shepherds in the country who were staying there , and keeping watch by night over their flocks .
42002009	And , behold , the angel of Aloha came to them , and the glory of the Lord shone upon them ; and they feared with great fear .
42002010	And the angel said to them , Fear not ; for , behold , I announce to you great joy , which shall be to all people :
42002011	for there is born for you to-day the Redeemer , who is the Lord the Meshicha , in the city of David .
42002012	And this is to you the sign , You shall find the infant wrapped in bandages , and laid in a manger .
42002013	And instantly there were seen with the angel many hosts of the heavens , glorifying Aloha ,
42002014	and saying , Glory to Aloha in the heights , and upon earth peace and good hope for the sons of men .
42002015	And when the angels were gone from them into heaven , the shepherds spake one with another , and said , Let us go unto Beth-lechem , and see the thing which the Lord hath made known to us .
42002016	And they came with speed , and found Mariam , and Jauseph , and the infant who was laid in the manger ;
42002017	and when they saw , they showed the word which had been spoken to them concerning the child .
42002018	And all who heard wondered at those ( things ) which were told them by the shepherds .
42002019	But Mariam kept all these words , and compared them in her heart .
42002020	And those shepherds returned , glorifying and praising Aloha for all that they had seen and heard as they had been spoken to them .
42002021	AND when the eight days completed to circumcise the child , his name was called Jeshu , for he was so called by the angel before he was conceived in the womb
42002022	And when were completed , the days of their purification according to the law of Musha , they carried him up to Urishlem , to present him before the Lord :
42002023	( as it is written in the law of the Lord , That every male openeth the matrix the holy to the Lord shall be called : )
42002024	and to offer the sacrifice as it is said in the law of the Lord , A pair of turtle-doves , or two of the young of pigeons .
42002025	But there was a certain man in Urishlem , whose name was Shemun ; and this man was just and righteous , and he had waited for the consolation of Isroel , and the Spirit of Holiness was upon him .
42002026	And it was said to him from the Spirit of Holiness , that he should not see death , until he had seen the Meshicha of the Lord .
