44015003	And conducting , the church dismissed them ; and they went through all Punika , and also among the Shomroyee , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles ; and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
44015004	AND when they came to Urishlem , they were received by the church , and by the apostles , and by the presbyters . And they recounted to them how much Aloha had done with them ;
44015005	but ( that ) certain had arisen who had believed from the doctrine of the Pharishee , and said , It behoved you to circumcise them , and require them to keep the law of Musha .
44015006	But the apostles and presbyters assembled to consider this doctrine .
44015007	And when there had been much investigation , Shemun arose , and said to them , Men , brethren , you know that from the first days from my mouth did Aloha choose that the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe .
44015008	And Aloha , who knoweth what is in the hearts , testified of them , and gave them the Spirit of Holiness , as to us .
44015009	And nothing distinguished between us and them , because he had purified by faith their hearts .
44015010	And now why tempt you Aloha , that you would lay a yoke upon the necks of the disciples , which nor our fathers nor we could bear ?
44015011	But by the grace of our Lord Jeshu Meshiha , we believe that we shall be saved , as they .
44015012	And all the assembly were silent . And they listened to Paulos and Bar Naba , who related how Aloha had done by their hands signs and mighty works among the Gentiles .
44015013	AND after they were silent , Jakub arose , and said , Men , brethren , hear me :
44015014	Shemun hath related to you how Aloha hath begun to elect from the Gentiles a people to his name .
44015015	And with this accord the words of the prophets ; as when it is written ,
44015016	After these I will return , And raise the dwelling of David which hath fallen ; And I will build that which hath fallen from it , And will raise it up :
44015017	That the residue of men may seek the Lord , And all the Gentiles , on whom my name is called ,
44015018	Saith the Lord , who doeth all these . Known from eternity are the works of Aloha .
44015019	On this account I say , that we should not molest those who from the Gentiles have been converted unto Aloha ;
44015020	but that we send to them , that they shall separate from the uncleanness of ( idol ) sacrifice , and from fornication , and from the strangled , and from blood .
44015021	For Musha from former generations in all cities hath had preachers in the synagogues who on all shabaths read him .
44015022	Then the apostles and presbyters , with all the church , elected men from them , and sent to Antiokia with Paulos and Bar Naba Jihuda , who was called Bar Shaba , and Shilo , men who were chief among the brethren .
44015023	AND they wrote an epistle by their hands , thus : The apostles and presbyters and brethren , to those who are in Antiokia and in Syria and in Cilicia , the brethren who are of the Gentiles ; peace .
44015024	It hath been heard by us , that men from us have gone forth and disturbed you with words , and have subverted your souls by saying , that you should be circumcised and observe the law , whom we have not commanded .
44015025	On account of this we have deliberated , all being assembled , and have chosen men and sent them to you , with Paulos and Bar Naba , our beloved ;
44015026	men who have delivered their lives for the sake of the name of our Lord Jeshu Meshiha .
44015027	And we have sent with them Jihuda and Shilo , that by word they may tell you the same things .
44015028	For it hath been the will of the Spirit of Holiness , and also of us , not to lay upon you greater burden beyond these things which are constraining ;
44015029	that you abstain from that which hath been sacrificed ( to idols ) , and from blood , and from that which is strangled , and from fornication ; and while you keep yourselves from these , you will be well . Be confirmed in our Lord .
44015030	Now they who were sent came to Antiokia , and they assembled all the people and gave the epistle .
44015031	And when they had read , they rejoiced and were comforted .
44015032	And by the word the brethren were the more strengthened , and Jihuda and Shilo established them because they were prophets also .
44015033	And when they had been there a time , the brethren dismissed them with peace unto the apostles .
44015035	BUT Paulos and Bar Naba remained in Antiokia , and taught and preached , with many others , the word of Aloha .
44015036	And after ( certain ) days Paulos said to Bar Naba , Let us return and visit the brethren in every city in which we have preached the word of Aloha , and see what they do .
44015037	But Bar Naba willed to take Juhanon , he who is surnamed Markos .
44015038	But Paulos willed not to take him with them , because he had forsaken them when they were in Pamphylia , and had not come with them .
44015039	On account of this contention they separated one from the other ; and Bar Naba took Markos , and they went by sea and came to Cypros .
44015040	But Paulos chose for him Shilo , and went forth commended by the brethren to the grace of Aloha .
44015041	And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches . And he came to Derbe the city , and to Lystra .
44016001	BUT a certain disciple was there whose name was Timotheus , the son of a certain Jihudoytha , a believer , and his father an Aramoya .
44016002	And all the disciples who were of Lystra and Ikonia testified concerning him .
44016003	This Paulos willed to take with him ; and he took and circumcised him because of the Jihudoyee who were in the place ; for they all knew his father that he was an Aramoya .
44016004	And when they had gone into the cities they preached and instructed them to keep those statutes which the apostles and presbyters who were in Urishlem had written .
44016005	So were the churches confirmed in the faith , and multiplied in number every day .
44016006	But they went through the countries of Phrygia and Galatia ; and the Spirit of Holiness forbad them , that they should not preach the word of Aloha in Asia .
44016007	And when they came to the region of Mysia they willed to go from thence to Bithynia ; and the Spirit of Jeshu permitted them not .
44016008	AND when they had gone forth from Mysia they came to the region of Troas .
44016009	And in a vision of the night , Paulos saw as a certain man , a Makedonoia , who stood and besought him , saying , Come unto Makedunia and help me .
44016010	But when Paulos had seen this vision , he immediately willed to go forth to Makedunia , for he understood that our Lord called us to evangelize them .
44016011	And we went from Troas and proceeded directly to Samuthracia , and from thence the day after we came to Neapolis the city ,
44016012	and from thence to Philippos , which is the head of Makedunia , and is a colony . But we were in that city certain days .
44016013	And we went out on the day of shabath without the gate of the city to the bank of the river , because there was seen a house of prayer ; and sitting down we discoursed with the women who assembled there .
44016014	And a certain female , a seller of purple , who feared Aloha , her name was Lydia , of Theatira the city , ( was there , ) whose heart our Lord opened , and she heard that which Paulos spake .
44016015	And she was baptized , she and the sons of her house . And she besought us and said , If it be that you truly think that I have believed in our Lord , come , remain in my house ; and she constrained us much .
44016016	AND it was while we went to the house of prayer , a certain damsel met us in whom was a spirit of divination , and she had produced her lords much gain by her divination .
44016017	And she came after Paulos and after us , and cried and said , These men are the servants of Aloha the Most High , and announce to us the way of salvation .
44016018	And this she did many days . And Paulos was indignant , and said to that spirit , I command thee in the name of Jeshu Meshiha to come out of her . And in that hour it came out .
44016019	And when her lords saw that the hope of their gain had gone from her , they laid hold on Paulos and Shilo and drew them to the public place , and brought them unto the prefects and to the chiefs of the city ,
44016020	and said , These men are troubling our city , because they are Jihudoyee ,
44016021	and are preaching to us those rites which it is not permitted us to receive and perform , because we are Rumoyee .
44016022	And a great gathering assembled against them . Then the prefects rent their vestments , and commanded to scourge them .
44016023	And when they had scourged them much , they cast them into the house of the bound , and commanded the keeper of the house of the bound to keep them watchfully .
44016024	But he , having received this command , brought in and shut them in the inner house of the house of the bound , and fastened their feet in the stocks .
44016025	And in the dividing of the night , Paulos and Shilo prayed and glorified Aloha , and the chained-ones heard them .
44016026	And suddenly there was a great trembling , and the foundations of the house of the bound trembled , and at once the doors of all were opened , and the chains of all were loosened .
44016027	And when the keeper of the house of the bound awoke , and saw that the doors of the house of the bound were open , he took a sword and sought to kill himself , because he thought that the chained-ones had fled .
44016028	And Paulos cried with a high voice and said to him , Do thyself no harm , for we are all here .
44016029	And he kindled for himself a lamp , and sprang , and came , perturbed , and fell at the feet of Paulos and of Shilo :
44016030	and he brought them without , and said to them , My lords , what behoveth me to do that I may be saved ?
44016031	And they said to him , Believe in our Lord Jeshu Meshiha , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
44016032	And they spoke with him the words of the Lord , and with all the sons of his house .
44016033	And in the same hour of that night , he took and washed them from their stripes , and was forthwith baptized , and all the sons of his house .
44016034	And he took and brought them up into his house , and set for them the table , and exulted , he and the sons of his house , in the faith of Aloha .
44016035	And when it was morning the prefects sent to the bearers of rods to say to the chief of the house of the bound , Loose those men .
44016036	AND when the chief of the house of the bound heard , he entered and spoke that word to Paulos , that the prefects have sent that you might he dismissed ; and now go forth ( and ) proceed in peace .
44016037	Paulos saith to him , They scourged us in the eyes of the world , ( we ) being innocent , ( and ) Roman men , and threw us into the house of the bound ; and now would they bring us forth secretly ? No , indeed , but they shall come and bring us out .
44016038	And the bearers of rods went and told the prefects these words which had been spoken to them . And when they heard that they were Rumoyee , they feared .
44016039	And they came to them , and besought them to come forth and depart from the city .
44016040	And when they had gone forth from the house of the bound , they entered with Lydia , and there saw the brethren , and consoled them . And they went forth
44017001	and passed by Amphipolis and Apolonia , cities , and came to Thessalonika , where was a synagogue of the Jihudoyee .
44017002	AND Paulos entered , as his custom was , with them , and three shabaths spoke to them from the scriptures ,
44017003	expounding , and showing , That Meshiha was to suffer and to rise from the house of the dead , and he is Jeshu the Meshiha whom I preach to you .
44017004	And men of them believed and adhered to Paulos and Shilo , and many of the Javnoyee who feared Aloha , and distinguished women not a few .
44017005	And the Jihudoyee envied , and joined to them evil men from the public place of the city , and made a great multitude , and conturbed the city . And they came and stood at the house of Jason , and demanded that they should bring them out from thence and deliver them to the multitude .
44017006	And when they could not find them there , they drew Jason and the brethren who were there , and brought them to the chiefs of the city , crying , These are they who have troubled the whole land ; and behold again have they come here ;
44017007	and their receiver is this Jason ; and all these against the commands of Cesar are risen , in saying that there is another king , Jeshu .
44017008	And the chiefs of the city and all the people were troubled when they heard these things ;
44017009	and they took pledges from Jason and also from the brethren , and then dismissed them .
44017010	But the brethren immediately in that night dismissed Paulos and Shilo unto Beroa the city ; and when they were come thither they entered into the synagogue of the Jihudoyee :
44017011	for more noble were those Jihudoyee who were there than those Jihudoyee who were in Thessalonika ; and they heard from them the word daily with joy , while they decided from the scriptures whether these things were so .
44017012	And many of them believed , and so also of the Javnoyee , men many , and distinguished women .
44017013	And when those Jihudoyee who were of Thessalonika knew that the word of Aloha was preached by Paulos in Beroa the city , they came there also , and ceased not to move and trouble the people .
44017014	And the brethren dismissed Paulos that he should go down by sea ; and Shilo and Timotheos remained in that city .
44017015	AND they who accompanied Paulos came unto Athinos the city ; and when they departed from the midst of it they took from him an epistle to Shilo and Timotheos , that they should speedily come to him .
44017016	But he , Paulos , while he waited in Athinos , was embittered in his spirit , ( for he ) saw how the whole city was filled with idols .
44017017	And he spake in the synagogue with the Jihudoyee , and with those who worshipped Aloha , and in the public place with those who met there daily ;
44017018	and the philosophers also who were of the doctrine of Epikuros , and others who were called Estoiku , disputed with him . And some of them said , What willeth this accumulator of words ? And others said , He preaches foreign gods ; because Jeshu and his resurrection he preached unto them .
44017019	And they took him and brought him to the house of judgment which is called Arios-pagos , saying to him , Can we know what this new doctrine is which thou art preaching ?
44017020	for thou sowest foreign words in our hearing , and we desire to know what these things are .
44017021	But all the Athinoyee , and those foreigners who are there , of no other thing are careful , but to say and to hear something new .
44017022	AND as Paulos stood on Arios-pagos he said , Men of Athinos , I observe you that in all ( things ) you exceed in the worship of demons .
44017023	As I walked about and saw the place of your worship , I found a certain altar on which was inscribed , To GOD THE HIDDEN : him then whom while not known you worship , This I declare to you .
44017024	For ALOHA who made the world and all that is in it , and is himself the Lord of heaven and of earth , in temples made with hands resideth not .
44017025	Neither is he served by the hands of men , nor needeth he any thing , for it is he who giveth to every man life and soul .
44017026	And of one blood hath he made the whole world of men to dwell upon the face of all the earth , and he hath distinguished the times by his decree , and set the limits of the dwelling of mankind ,
44017027	that they should seek Aloha and inquire , and from his creatures find himself , because he is not far from every one of us .
44017028	For in him we live , and are moved , and are ; as also one of your sages hath said , From him is our descent .
44017029	Men , therefore , whose descent is from Aloha , should not think that gold or silver or stone sculptured by the art and skill of man is like the Divinity .
44017030	For the times of error Aloha hath made to pass away ; and in this time he commandeth all men , that every man in every place should repent ;
44017031	because he hath set a day in which he will judge the whole earth in righteousness by that Man whom he hath ordained ; and he will convert every man to the faith of him in having raised him from among the dead .
44017032	And when they heard of resurrection from among the dead , ( some ) of them mocked , and ( some ) of them said , At another time we will hear thee concerning this .
44017033	And so Paulos went forth from among them .
44017034	And certain of them adhered to him and believed : but one of them was Dionosios of the judges of Arios-pagos , and a certain woman whose name was Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	AND when Paulos had gone forth from Athinos , he came unto Kurinthos .
44018002	And he found there a certain man , a Jihudoya , whose name was Akilos , who was from the country of Pontos , ( and ) who at that time had come from the country of Italia , himself and Priskila his wife , because Klaudios Cesar had commanded that all the Jihudoyee should go out from Ruma ; and he drew near to them :
44018003	( and ) because he was a son of their art , he dwelt with them and wrought with them : but in their art they were tentmakers .
44018004	And he discoursed in the synagogue every shabath , and persuaded the Jihudoyee and the Heathens .
44018005	And when from Makedunia Shilo and Timotheos had come , Paulos was constrained in his speech , because the Jihudoyee arose against him and blasphemed , while he testified to them that Jeshu is the Meshiha .
44018006	And he shook his garments and said to them , From now I am clean : I go unto the Gentiles .
44018007	And he went forth from thence , and entered into the house of a man named Titos , who worshipped Aloha ; and his house adjoined the synagogue .
44018008	And Krispos , master of the synagogue , believed in our Lord , he and all the sons of his house . And many of the Kurinthoyee heard and believed in Aloha , and were baptized .
44018009	And the Lord said in a vision unto Paulos , Fear not , but speak and be not silent ;
44018010	for I am with thee , and no man can do thee harm ; and I have much people in this city .
44018011	But he abode a year and six months in Kurinthos , and taught them the word of Aloha .
44018012	AND when Galion was proconsul of Akaia , they gathered together against Paulos , and brought him before the tribunal ,
44018013	saying , This ( man ) part from the law persuadeth men to worship Aloha .
44018014	And when Paulos sought to open his mouth and speak , Galion said to the Jihudoyee , If it were concerning some thing of evil , or of wickedness , or of abomination , you would complain , O Jihudoyee , it would be proper for me to receive you ;
44018015	but if they be questions concerning language and names , and concerning your law , let them be known among yourselves ; for I am not willing to be a judge of these matters .
44018016	And he drove them from his tribunal .
44018017	And all the Heathens seized Sosthenis the presbyter of the synagogue , and beat him before the tribunal . And Galion was careless of these .
44018018	And when Paulos had been there many days , he gave the salutation to the brethren , and proceeded by sea to go to Syria : and Priskila and Akilos went with him , when he had shaved his head at Kankreos , because he had vowed a vow .
44018019	And they came to Ephesos . And Paulos entered the synagogue and discoursed with the Jihudoyee ;
44018020	and they requested of him to tarry with them ; and he was not willing ;
44018021	for he said , It behoveth me faithfully to perform the feast which cometh at Urishlem ; and if Aloha willeth , I will come again to you . And Akilos and Priskila he left at Ephesos ;
44018022	and he voyaged by sea and came to Cesarea : and he went up and wished the peace of the sons of the church , and went unto Antiokia .
44018023	And when he had been there certain days , he went forth and itinerated successively through Phrygia and Galatia , confirming all the disciples .
44018024	And a certain man whose name was Apolu , a Jihudoya , who was by family of Aleksandria , and erudite in speech , and accurate in the scriptures , came to Ephesos .
44018025	This was discipled in the way of the Lord , and was fervid in spirit , and he spake and taught freely concerning Jeshu , while knowing not any thing but the baptism of Juhanon .
44018026	And he began boldly to speak in the synagogue . And when Akilos and Priskila heard him , they brought him to their house , and fully showed to him the way of the Lord .
44018027	And when he willed to go to Akaia , the brethren were careful of him , and wrote to the disciples to receive him . And when he had gone he helped much , through grace , all the believers .
44018028	For he disputed forcibly against the Jihudoyee before the assemblies , while he showed from the scriptures concerning Jeshu , that he is the Meshiha .
44019001	AND while Apolu was in Kurinthos , Paulos itinerated through the upper countries unto Ephesos ; and he asked those disciples whom he found there ,
44019002	Have you received the Spirit of Holiness from that you believed ? They answered and said to him , It hath not been heard by us whether there be the Spirit .
44019003	He saith to them , And into what were you baptized ? They said , Into the baptism of Juhanon .
44019004	Paulos saith to them , Juhanon baptized the people with the baptism of repentance , saying that they should believe in him who was coming after him , who is Jeshu Meshiha .
44019005	And when they heard these ( words ) , they were baptized in the name of our Lord Jeshu Meshiha .
44019006	And Paulos laid on them the hand , and the Spirit of Holiness came upon them , and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
44019007	But all the men were twelve .
44019008	And Paulos entered the synagogue , and discoursed boldly three months , and persuaded concerning the kingdom of Aloha .
44019009	And men of them were obdurate , and contended , and reviled the way of Aloha , before the assembly of the people . Then Paulos removed and separated from them the disciples , and every day discoursed with them in the school of a man whose name was Tyranos .
44019010	And this was done two years , until all who dwelt in Asia , Jihudoyee and Aramoyee , had heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	And great power-works wrought Aloha by the hand of Paulos ;
44019012	so that they brought even from the garments that were upon his body napkins or wrappings , and laid them upon the sick , and the diseases went from them ; and demons also went forth .
44019013	BUT men , Jihudoyee , also , who went about and adjured demons , willed to adjure in the name of our Lord Jeshu over those who had unclean spirits , saying , We adjure you in the name of Jeshu whom Paulos preacheth .
44019014	There were seven sons of a man , a certain Jihudoya , chief of the priests , whose name was Skeva , who did this .
44019015	And that evil demon answered and said to them , Jeshu I acknowledge , and Paulos I know ; but who are you ?
44019016	And the man in whom was the evil spirit sprang upon them , and was strong against them , and threw them , and they , naked and wounded , fled from that house .
44019017	And this was known to all the Jihudoyee and Aramoyee who dwelt in Ephesos : and fear fell upon them all , and the name of our Lord Jeshu Meshiha was exalted .
44019018	And many of those who believed came and acknowledged their sins , and confessed whatever they had done .
44019019	Many also of the magicians collected their writings and brought and burned them before all men ; and they reckoned the price of them , and it ascended to silver five myriads .
44019020	And thus with great power prevailed and increased the faith of Aloha .
44019021	But when these were fulfilled , Paulos set in his mind to itinerate throughout all Makedunia and Akaia , and to go into Urishlem . And he said , When I shall have gone thither , it behoveth me Ruma also to see .
44019022	And he sent two men of those who ministered to him to Makedunia , Timotheos and Aristos ; but he remained a time in Asia .
44019023	BUT there was made at that time a great tumult on account of the way of Aloha .
44019024	For there was a certain worker of silver there whose name was Dimitrios , who made shrines of silver of Artemis , and he produced for the sons of his art great gains .
44019025	This ( man ) assembled all the sons of his art and those who wrought with them , and said to them , Men , you know that all our merchandise is from this work ;
44019026	and you also hear and see , that not only the sons of Ephesos , but also many of all Asia , this Paulos persuadeth , and hath perverted them , saying , that there be no gods which by the hands of men are made .
44019027	And not only is this business defamed and brought to an end , but also the temple of Artemis the great goddess is reputed as nothing , and she also , the goddess of all Asia , and ( whom ) all the nations worship , is despised .
44019028	And when they heard these ( words ) they were filled with wrath ; and they cried , and said , Great is Artemis of the Ephesoyee .
44019029	And the whole city was perturbed , and they ran together and came to the theatre ; and seizing , they led with them Gaios and Aristarkos , men of Makedunia , companions of Paulos .
44019030	AND Paulos willed to enter the theatre , and the disciples restrained him .
44019031	And the chiefs of Asia , because they were his friends , sent , praying of him not to deliver himself by going into the theatre .
44019032	But the crowd who were in the theatre were greatly commoved , and others cried other things ; for many of them knew not on what account they were assembled .
44019033	But the people of the Jihudoyee who were there appointed of them a man a Jihudoya , whose name was Aleksandros ; and when he stood ( forth ) he signed that he would apologize to the people .
44019034	And when they knew that he was a Jihudoya , all of them cried with one voice , as two hours , Great is Artemis of the Ephesoyee !
44019035	And the chief of the city stilled them , saying , Men , Ephesoyee , who is there of mankind who knoweth not that the city of the Ephesoyee is a votaress of the great Artemis , and of her image which descended from heaven ?
44019036	Therefore , since no man can contradict this , it behoves you to be silent , and to do nothing in haste .
44019037	Yet have you brought these men who have neither spoiled temples nor blasphemed our goddess .
44019038	But if this Dimitrios and the sons of his craft have strife with any man , behold , the proconsul is in the city , ( and ) there are officers : let them go nigh and judge one with another .
44019039	And if you require other ( procedure ) , in the place which is given by the law for an assembly it shall be resolved .
44019040	For now also are we standing in peril of being accused as disturbers , because we cannot make excuse for the concourse of this day , inasmuch as we have met uselessly , and have made a tumult without cause .
44019041	And when these he had said , he dissolved the assembly .
44020001	And after the tumult had stilled , Paulos called the disciples and consoled them and kissed them , and going forth went unto Makedunia .
44020002	And when he had itinerated those regions , and had consoled them with many words , he came into the country of Hales ,
44020003	and was there three months . But the Jihudoyee wrought treachery against him , when he was about to go into Syria , and had thought to return into Makedunia .
44020004	And ( there ) went forth with him into Asia Supatros who was from Berula , the city ; and Aristarkos and Sakundos , who ( were ) from Thessalonika ; and Gaios , who was from Derbe the city ; and Timotheos , who was from Lystra ; and from Asia , Tukikos and Trophimos .
44020005	These went before us , and waited for us in Troas .
44020006	But we went forth from Philipos , a city of the Makedunoyee , after the days of the Phatiree , and voyaged by sea and came to Troas in five days , and there were we seven days .
44020007	AND on the first day in the week , when we were assembled to break the eucharist , Paulos discoursed with them , because the day following he was to depart ; and he prolonged his discourse until the dividing of the night .
44020008	And there were many lamps of fire in the high-room where we were assembled .
44020009	And a certain youth whose name was Eutikos sat in a window and heard . And he had sunk into a heavy sleep while Paulos prolonged his discourse , and in his sleep he fell from the third floor , and was taken up as dead .
44020010	And Paulos descended , and fell upon him and embraced him , and said , Be not agitated , for his life is in him .
44020011	When he had gone up , he broke bread and tasted , speaking with them until the morning arose ; and then went he forth to proceed by land .
44020012	And they brought the young man alive , and rejoiced over him greatly .
44020013	But we went down to the ship , and voyaged to the port of Thesos , because there we were to receive Paulos , for thus he had instructed us , while he himself would proceed by land .
44020014	But when we had received him from Thesos , we took him up into the ship and came to Mitylene .
44020015	And from thence the day after we voyaged over against Kios the island , and again the day after we came to Samos ; and we tarried at Trogalium , and the day after we came to Militos :
44020016	for Paulos had decided with himself to pass by Ephesos , that he might not be hindered there , because he hastened , that , if it were possible , on the day of the Pentecost in Urishlem he might work .
44020017	AND from Militos he sent to bring the presbyters of the church of Ephesos ;
44020018	and when they came to him , he said to them : You know , that from the first day that I entered Asia , how I was with you all time ,
44020019	serving Aloha in much lowliness and with tears , and in those temptations which passed upon me through the devices of the Jihudoyee .
44020020	Neither neglected I any thing that was profitable for your souls , that I might preach to you and teach in public places and in houses ,
44020021	while I testified to Jihudoyee and to Aramoyee concerning repentance that is toward Aloha , and faith which is in our Lord Jeshu Meshiha .
44020022	And now I , bound in the Spirit , go to Urishlem ; not knowing what I shall know in her .
44020023	Nevertheless , the Spirit of Holiness in every city testifieth to me and saith , that bonds and afflictions are for me .
44020024	But by me my life is reckoned nothing , so that I may accomplish my course , and the ministry I have received from our Lord Jeshu , to bear witness concerning the gospel of the grace of Aloha .
44020025	And now , I know that again my face you will not see , you , all , among whom I have gone about , preaching to you the kingdom of Aloha .
44020026	I testify to you this very day , that I am pure from the blood of you all .
44020027	For I have not shunned to make known to you all the will of Aloha .
44020028	Take heed therefore to yourselves , and to the whole flock over which the Spirit of Holiness hath constituted you the bishops ; to pasture the church of the Meshiha which he hath purchased with his blood .
44020029	For I know that after I shall have gone , there will enter with you furious wolves which will not spare the flock .
44020030	And also from you , of yourselves , will men arise speaking perverse things to turn away disciples to go after them .
44020031	On account of this be watchful , and remember , that for three years I ceased not by night and by day with tears to instruct every one of you .
44020032	And now I commend you to Aloha , and to the word of his grace , who is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance with all the saints .
44020033	Silver , or gold , or raiment have I not coveted ;
44020034	and you know to the necessity of myself , and of those who are with me , these hands have ministered .
44020035	And I have shown you every thing , ( that ) so it behoveth to labour , and to be careful of those who are infirm , and to remember the word of our Lord Jeshu , that he said , He is blessed who giveth , more than he who receiveth .
44020036	And when these he had said , he kneeled on his knees and prayed , and all the men with him .
44020037	And there was a great weeping with all of them , and they embraced him and kissed him ;
44020038	but most agonized ( were they ) by that word which he had spoken , that again they were not to see his face . And they accompanied him to the ship .
44021001	And we separated from them and voyaged directly unto Ko the island , and the day after we came to Rodos , and from thence to Patara ;
44021002	and we found there a ship which was going to Punike , and we ascended into her and voyaged .
44021003	And coming near Kypros the island , we left it on the left hand and came unto Syria , and thence came we to Tsur : for there was the ship to relieve from her burden .
44021004	And having found disciples there , we sojourned with them seven days . And these said daily unto Paulos in the Spirit , That he should not go unto Urishlem .
44021005	And after those days we departed to go on the way . And they accompanied us , all of them , they and their wives and their children , till without the city , and kneeled upon their knees on the sea shore , and prayed . And we kissed one another ,
44021006	and we ascended to the ship , and they returned to their homes .
44021007	But we voyaged from Tsur , and came to Aku the city , and gave the salutation to the brethren who were there , and abode among them one day .
44021008	And the day after we departed and came to Cesarea ; and we entered and abode in the house of Philipos the preacher , he who was of the seven .
44021009	And he had four virgin daughters who prophesied .
44021010	And when we had been there many days , there came down from Jihud a certain prophet whose name was Agabos .
44021011	And he came in to us , and took the loins'-girdle of Paulos , and bound his own feet and his hands , and said , Thus saith the Spirit of Holiness , So the man the master of this girdle will the Jihudoyee bind in Urishlem ; and they will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
44021012	And when we heard these words , we and the sons of the place entreated of him not to go unto Urishlem .
44021013	THEN answered Paulos and said , What do you , weeping and bruising my heart ? For not to be bound only am I prepared , but also to die in Urishlem , for the sake of the name of our Lord Jeshu Meshiha .
44021014	And when he would not be persuaded by us , we desisted , and said , The will of our Lord be done .
44021015	And after those days we prepared and went up to Urishlem .
44021016	And there went with us men , disciples , from Cesarea , who conducted with them a certain brother of the first disciples whose name was Mnason , and he was from Kypros , to receive us into his house .
44021017	And when we were come to Urishlem , the brethren received us joyfully .
44021018	And the day following we entered with Paulos to Jakub , while all the presbyters were with him .
44021019	And we gave them salutation . And Paulos recounted to them in order what Aloha had done among the Gentiles by his ministry .
44021020	And when they heard , they glorified Aloha . And they said to him , Thou seest , our brother , how many myriads there are in Jihud who believe , and all of them are zealous for the law .
44021021	But it hath been said to them of thee , that thou teachest all the Jihudoyee who are among the Gentiles to remove from Musha ; telling them that they should not circumcise their sons , nor walk in the customs of the law .
44021022	On this account , when they hear that thou art come hither , do that which we tell thee .
44021023	We have four men who have a vow to be purified .
44021024	Take them , and go , purify with them , and lay out upon them the expenses , that they may shave their heads ; and it will be known to every man that what hath been said against thee is false , and that thou fulfillest and keepest the law .
44021025	Concerning those of the Gentiles who believe , we wrote that they should keep themselves from sacrifices , and from fornication , and from the strangled , and from blood .
44021026	Then Paul took those men the day after , and was purified with them . And he entered and went into the temple , making known to them the fulfillment of the days of the purification , so that an oblation might be offered for each man of them .
44021027	And when the seventh day was come the Jihudoyee who were from Asia saw him in the temple , and stirred up against him all the people . And they lifted their hands against him ,
44021028	crying out , and saying , Men , sons of Israel , help ! This is the man who contrary to our people teacheth every where , and contrary to the law , and against this place . And also Aramoyee hath he brought into the temple , and profaned this holy place .
44021029	For they had before seen with him Trophimus the Ephesian in the city , and supposed that with Paulos he had entered the temple .
44021030	And the whole city was commoved , and all the people assembled , and they laid hold of Paulos , and dragged him without from the temple ; and instantly the gates were shut .
44021031	And while the multitude sought to kill him , the tribune of the cohort heard that the whole city was agitated .
44021032	And forthwith took he a centurion and many soldiers and ran upon them ; and when they saw the tribune and the soldiers , they desisted from beating Paulos .
44021033	And the tribune drew near and took him , and commanded them to bind him with two chains . And he asked concerning him who ( he was ) , and what he had done ?
44021034	And men from the crowd cried against him variously , and because of their crying he was not able to know what was the truth ; and he commanded that they should lead him to the fortress .
44021035	And as Paulos came to the stairs the soldiers carried him , on account of the violence of the people :
44021036	for after him was much people ; and they cried , and said , Away with him !
44021037	And as they came to enter into the fortress , Paulos himself said to the tribune , May I be permitted to speak to the people ?
44021038	But he said to him , Javanith knowest thou ? Art thou not that Metsroya who before these days stirred up and led forth into the waste four thousand men workers of evils ?
44021039	Paulos said to him , I am a man a Jihudoya from Tarsos of Cilicia , an illustrious city in which I was born : I pray you permit me to speak to the people .
44021040	And when he had permitted him , Paulos stood upon the stairs , and signed to them with his hand ; and when they had ceased , he spoke to them in Hebrew , and said to them ,
44022001	Brethren and fathers , hear the defence which I make to you .
44022002	And when they heard that Hebrew he was speaking with them , the more they ceased ; and he said to them ,
44022003	I am a man a Jihudoya ; and I was born in Tarsos of Cilicia , but was brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and instructed perfectly in the law of our fathers . And I was zealous for Aloha , even as all of you are also .
44022004	And this way I persecuted unto the death , while I bound and delivered to the house of the bound both men and women ;
44022005	as the chief of the priests can testify of me , and all the elders , that from them I received letters to go to the brethren who were in Darmsuk , that also them who were there I should bring to Urishlem bound , that they might be fined .
44022006	And as I went , and began to approach Darmsuk in the dividing of the day , suddenly from heaven there shone upon me a great light ,
44022007	and I fell upon the earth , and heard a voice , which said to me , Shaol , Shaol , why persecutest thou me ?
44022008	But I answered and said , Who art thou , my Lord ? And he said to me , I am Jeshu Natsroya , whom thou persecutest !
44022009	And the men who were with me saw the light , but the voice they understood not which spake with me .
44022010	And I said , What shall I do , my Lord ? And he said to me , Arise , go into Darmsuk , and there shall it be told thee of whatever it is commanded thee to do .
44022011	And while I could not see because of the glory of that light , they who were with me took me by my hands , and I entered Darmsuk .
44022012	And a man , one Hanania , righteous in the law , as the Jihudoyee who were there testified of him ,
44022013	came to me , and said to me , Shaol , my brother , open thine eyes . And in a moment my eyes were opened , and I beheld him .
44022014	And he said to me , The God of our fathers hath appointed thee to know his will , and to see that Just One , and to hear the voice from his lips ,
44022015	that thou mayest be a witness to all men of all that thou hast seen and heard .
44022016	And now why delayest thou ? Arise , baptize , and be washed from thy sins , while thou callest his Name .
44022017	And being returned , I came hither to Urishlem . And I prayed in the temple .
44022018	And I saw him in a vision , when he said to me , Hasten , and remove thee from Urishlem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
44022019	And I said , My Lord , they know also how I delivered to the house of the bound , and smote in all the synagogues , those who have believed in thee .
44022020	And when the blood of thy martyr Estephanos was shed , I also stood with them , and fulfilled the will of his murderers , and kept the garments of them who stoned him .
44022021	And he said to me , Go : for I send thee far away to preach to the Gentiles .
44022022	And when they had heard Paulos until this word , they lifted up their voice , and cried , Take from the earth one like this ; for he ought not to live .
44022023	And as they shouted and cast their garments and threw dust to the heaven ,
44022024	the tribune commanded that he should be brought into the fortress , and commanded him to be questioned by scourging , that he might know for what cause they cried against him .
44022025	And as they exposed him with thongs , Paulos said to the centurion who stood near him , Is it allowed you to scourge a Roman man who is not condemned ?
44022026	And when the centurion heard , he approached the tribune , and said to him , What doest thou ? For this is a Roman man .
44022027	And the tribune approached him , and said to him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said to him , Yes .
44022028	The tribune answered , and said to him , I with much money purchased the Roman-right . Paulos said to him , But I was born in it .
44022029	And immediately those who had sought to scourge him desisted from him ; and the tribune feared when he learned that he was a Roman , because he had bound him .
44022030	AND the day after he willed to know truly what was the accusation which the Jihudoyee brought against him . And he ordered him and commanded the great priests and all the synagogue of their rulers to come ; and he took Paulos and brought ( him ) down , and stood him among them .
44023001	And Paulos , looking upon their assembly , said , Men , brethren , I in all good conscience have conversed before Aloha , unto this day .
44023002	And Hanania the priest commanded them who stood by him to smite Paulos upon his mouth .
44023003	And Paulos said to him , It will be that Aloha will smite thee , ( thou ) whitened wall : thou sittest to judge me according to the law , while thou transgressest the law , and commandest that they smite me !
44023004	And they who stood there said to him , The priest of Aloha revilest thou ?
44023005	Paulos said to them , I knew not , my brethren , that he is the priest ; for it is written , Of the chief of thy people thou shalt not speak evil .
44023006	And when Paulos knew that ( part ) of the people were of the Zadukoyee and ( part ) of it of the Pharishee , he cried in the assembly , Men , my brethren , I am a Pharisha , the son of Pharishee ; and for the hope of the resurrection of the dead am I judged .
44023007	And when he had said this , the Pharishee and the Zadukoyee fell on one another , and the people was divided .
44023008	For the Zadukoyee say that there is no resurrection , nor angels , nor spirit ; but the Pharishee confess all these .
44023009	And there was made a great noise . And certain sophree of the choice of the Pharishee arose and contended with them , and said , We have not found any thing of evil in this man ; but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken with him , what is there in this ?
44023010	And when there was a great commotion among them , the tribune feared lest they should tear Paulos in pieces , and he sent to the Rumoyee to come and carry him away from the midst of them , and take him into the fortress .
44023011	And when it was night our Lord appeared unto Paulos , and said to him , Be strong : for as thou hast testified of me in Urishlem , so is it to be that thou also in Ruma shalt testify .
44023012	AND when it became morning , men of the Jihudoyee gathered and bound a vow upon themselves , that they would not eat or drink till they had killed Paulos .
44023013	But there were of those who established by oath this compact more than forty men .
44023014	And they drew nigh to the priests and to the elders , and said , A vow we have vowed upon us , that nothing will we taste until we have killed Paulos .
44023015	And now do you and the princes of the synagogue request from the tribune to bring him to you , as if you sought to investigate more truly his work , and we are prepared to kill him while he shall come to you .
44023016	And the son of the sister of Paulos heard this plot , and he entered the fortress and informed Paulos .
44023017	And Paulos sent ( and ) called one of the centurions , and said to him , Bring this youth to the tribune , for he has somewhat to tell him .
44023018	And the centurion conducted the youth , and introduced him to the tribune , and said , Paulos the prisoner called me , and requested of me to bring this youth to thee , because he hath somewhat to tell thee .
44023019	And the tribune took the youth by his hand , and led him on one side , and asked him , What hast thou to tell me ?
44023020	And the youth said to him , The Jihudoyee have determined to request of thee to send down Paulos , tomorrow , to their synagogue , as if willing to learn somewhat more from him :
44023021	thou therefore yield not to them ; for , behold , more than forty men of them watch for him in ambush , and have bound a curse upon themselves , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and , behold , they are ready , and wait thy promise .
44023022	And the tribune dismissed the youth , when he had admonished him , Let no man know that these thou hast informed me .
44023023	And he called two centurions , and said to them , Go , prepare two hundred Romans to go to Cesarea , and seventy horsemen and right-handed spearmen two hundred , to go forth at the third hour of the night ;
44023024	but provide also a beast to carry Paulos , and escape to Felix the governor .
44023025	And he wrote a letter , and gave it to them , which was thus :
44023026	Klaudios Lusios unto Felix the victorious governor , peace .
44023027	The Jihudoyee had seized this man to kill him ; and I arose with the Romans and rescued him , when I had learned that he is a Roman .
44023028	And when I sought to know the occasion of which they accused him , I brought him down to their synagogue .
44023029	And I found that concerning questions of their law they accused him ; and a cause worthy of bonds or of death was not in him .
44023030	And when it was told me of the treachery of a plot which the Jihudoyee wrought against him , I straightway sent him to thee ; and I have commanded his accusers to come and speak with him before thee . Farewell .
44023031	Then the Rumoyee , as they had been commanded , took Paulos by night , and brought him to Antipatros the city ;
44023032	and the day after the horsemen sent away their foot-companions to return to the fortress .
44023033	And they came to Cesarea . And they gave the letter to the governor , and made Paulos stand before him .
44023034	And when he had read the letter , he asked him from what province he was . And when he had heard that ( he was ) from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said to him , I will hear thee when thy accusers have come . And he commanded that they should keep him in the pretorium of Herodes .
44024001	AND after five days Hanania the great priest came down with the elders , and with Tartelos a rhetor , and informed the governor against Paulos .
44024002	And being called , Tartelos came forth to accuse him , and said , For many years have we dwelt ( in peace ) through thee , and many reformations have been made for this people in the bearing of thy office ;
44024003	and all we in every place receive thy bounty , victorious Felix .
44024004	But , not to weary thee with many ( words ) , I pray thee to hear our humbleness with brevity .
44024005	For we have found this man to be a destroyer , and an exciter of agitation among all the Jihudoyee , and in all the land : for he is a chief of the doctrine of the Natsroyee ,
44024006	and he willed to pollute our temple ; and having apprehended him , we sought to judge him according to our law ;
44024007	but Lusios the tribune came , and with great force transferred him from our hands ,
44024008	and hath sent him unto thee , and commanded his accusers to come to thee ; and thou canst by questioning him learn from him concerning all these things of which we accuse him .
44024009	The Jihudoyee themselves also contended against him , saying , that so these things were .
44024010	And the governor signed to Paulos to speak . And Paulos answered , and said , For many years I know that thou hast been the judge of this people , and on this account I joyfully make defence for myself ;
44024011	while thou shouldst know that it hath not been more than twelve days since I went up to Urishlem to worship .
44024012	Neither found they me speaking with any man in the temple , neither have I gathered an assembly in their synagogue nor in the city ;
44024013	nor is it in their power to demonstrate before thee any thing of what they accuse me .
44024014	Nevertheless , this do I confess , that in that very doctrine of which they speak , in it serve I the God of my fathers , believing in all that is written in the law and in the prophets ,
44024015	and having hope in Aloha that which they also hope : that there shall be a resurrection from the house of the dead , of the just and of the evil .
44024016	Because of this also I labour to have a good conscience before Aloha and before men , continually .
44024017	But after many years I came to the sons of my people to bestow alms , and to present an oblation .
44024018	And these found me in the temple being purified , not with a concourse nor with tumult ; but men Jihudoyee who had come from Asia raised a tumult ;
44024019	( and ) these it behoved to stand with me before thee , and to accuse of that whatever they have ( against me ) .
44024020	Or let these themselves declare , what crime they found in me , when I stood before their assembly ,
44024021	unless for this one word which I proclaimed while standing in the midst of them , For the resurrection of the dead am I judged this day before you .
44024022	But Felix , because he knew this way fully , delayed them , saying , When the tribune comes I will hear between you .
44024023	And he commanded the centurion to keep Paulos in quietude , and that none of his acquaintances should be hindered from ministering to him .
44024024	And after a few days Felix , and Drusilla his wife , who was a Jihudoytha , sent and called Paulos , and they heard from him concerning the faith of the Meshiha .
44024025	And as he discoursed with them of righteousness , and of holiness , and of the judgment which is to come , Felix was filled with fear , and he said , Now go , and when I have opportunity I will send for thee .
44024026	For he hoped that a bribe would be given him by Paulos , and on this account he continually sent to bring him , and to speak with him .
44024027	And when two years were fulfilled to him , another governor came in his place , who was called Porcios Festos . But Felix , as to do a favour to the Jihudoyee , left Paulos bound .
44025001	And when Festos came to Cesarea , after three days he went up to Urishlem .
44025002	And the chief priest and elders showed him concerning Paulos , and besought from him ,
44025003	asking of him this favour , that he would bring him to Urishlem , while they would act treacherously in the way by killing him .
44025004	And Festos returned the word , That Paulos was kept in Cesarea , and I am hastening to proceed ;
44025005	let those therefore of you who are able , go down with us , and accuse him of whatever guilt there is in the man .
44025006	And when he had been there eight days or ten , he went down to Cesarea . And the day after he sat on the tribunal , and commanded to bring Paulos .
44025007	And when he had come , the Jihudoyee who had come down from Urishlem surrounded him , and accusations many and hard brought against him , which they were not able to prove ;
44025008	while Paulos put forth the mind , that he had not offended in any thing , neither against the law of the Jihudoyee , nor against the temple , nor against Caesar .
44025009	But Festos , because he willed to accord a favour to the Jihudoyee , said to Paulos , Art thou willing to go up to Urishlem , and there concerning these things to be judged before me ?
44025010	Paulos answered , and said , At the tribunal of Caesar stand I . There it is right for me to be judged . Not any thing have I transgressed against the Jihudoyee , as also thou knowest ;
44025011	and if a crime I have committed , or any thing worthy of death , I ask not ( to be exempted ) from death . But , if there be nothing in me of which these accuse me , no man shall give me to them as a gift . I invoke the appeals of Caesar .
44025012	Then Festos , having spoken with the sons of his council , said , The appeals of Caesar hast thou invoked ? To Caesar goest thou .
44025013	AND when days had been , Agripos the king and Bernike came down to Cesarea to salute Festos .
44025014	And when they had been with him ( some ) days , Festos recounted to the king the judgment of Paulos , saying , A certain man has been left bound by Felix ;
44025015	and when I was at Urishlem , the chief priests and elders of the Jihudoyee informed me against him , and begged that I would do for them judgment against him .
44025016	And I told them , it was not the custom of the Romans to give any man as a gift to be killed , until his adversaries have come and accused him to his face , and there be given him place to defend himself against that of which he is accused .
44025017	And when I had come hither , without delay , the day after I sat on the tribunal , and commanded to bring the man to me .
44025018	And his accusers stood up with him , but could not find any evil accusation to prove against him , ( such ) as I had expected ,
44025019	but ( had ) various questions with him regarding their worship , and concerning Jeshu , a man who was dead , of whom Paulos said that he was alive .
44025020	And because I stood not upon the investigation of these ( matters ) , I said to Paulos , Dost thou require to go to Urishlem , and there be judged concerning these ?
44025021	But he required to be kept unto the judgment of Caesar ; and I commanded that he should be kept until I may send him to Caesar .
44025022	And Agripos said , I would hear this man . And Festos said , To-morrow thou shalt hear him .
44025023	And the day after came Agripos and Bernike with great pomp , and entered the house of judgment , with the tribunes and the chiefs of the city . And Festos commanded , and Paulos came .
44025024	And Festos said , King Agripos , and all men who are with us , concerning this man whom you see have all the people of the Jihudoyee taken me at Urishlem and here , crying , that This ought not further to live ;
44025025	but I perceived not that he had done any thing worthy of death . And because he required to be reserved for the judgment of Caesar , I have commanded that he should be sent .
44025026	But ( as ) I know not what to write of him unto Caesar , therefore have I willed to bring him before you , and especially before thee , king Agripos , that , having inquired into his case , I may find what to write .
44025027	For it is not fit when we send a man bound , not to record his transgression .
44026001	And Agripos said to Paulos , It is permitted thee to speak for thyself . Then Paulos stretched forth his hand and made defence , and said ,
44026002	Of all that I am accused by the Jihudoyee , king Agripos , I consider myself happy , that before you I ( have to ) make defence .
44026003	Especially because I know that you are conversant with all questions and laws of the Jihudoyee ; therefore , I pray you with patient mind to hear me .
44026004	For the Jihudoyee themselves-if they would testify-know my manners from my youth , which were mine from the beginning among my people at Urishlem ;
44026005	because they of a long time were assured of me , and they know that in the high doctrine of the Pharishee I lived .
44026006	And now , concerning the hope of the promise that was made to our fathers by Aloha , stand I , and am judged .
44026007	And for this hope ( to which ) our twelve tribes , with diligent prayers by day and night , are expecting to come , for this very hope am I accused by the Jihudoyee , king Agripos !
44026008	What judge you ; ought we not to believe that Aloha will raise the dead ?
44026009	For I , at the first , proposed in my mind to do many things against the name of Jeshu Natsroya .
44026010	This I also did in Urishlem . And many holy ones I cast into the house of the bound , by the authority which I had received from the great priests ; and when they were killed by them , I participated with those who condemned them .
44026011	And in every synagogue I was furious against them , while I constrained them to blaspheme the name of Jeshu ; and , being filled with great wrath against them , I went forth unto other cities also to persecute them .
44026012	And while going on this account to Darmsuk , with authority and permission from the great priests ,
44026013	at the dividing of the day , in the way , I saw from heaven , O king , shining upon me and upon all who were with me , a light which ( was ) more excellent than the sun .
44026014	And we fell all of us upon the earth ; and I heard a voice that said to me in Hebrew , Shaol , Shaol , why persecutest thou me ? It is hard to thee to kick against the pricks !
44026015	And I said , Who art thou , my Lord ? And he said , I am Jeshu Natsroya , whom thou persecutest .
44026016	And he said to me , Stand upon thy feet , because for this I have appeared to thee , to appoint thee a minister and witness of that ( for ) which thou hast seen me , and ( for ) which thou shalt see me .
44026017	And I will deliver thee from the people of the Jihudoyee , and from the other nations to whom I send thee ,
44026018	to open their eyes , that they may turn from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan unto Aloha , and receive the forgiveness of sins , and a lot with the saints through faith , which ( is ) in me .
44026019	Wherefore , king Agripos , I withstood not with perversity the heavenly vision ,
44026020	but preached , at first to them who were in Darmsuk , and to them who were at Urishlem , and in all the districts of Jihud , and also to the Gentiles have I preached , that they should repent , and turn to Aloha , and do works worthy of repentance .
44026021	And for these things the Jihudoyee seized me in the temple , and would have killed me ;
44026022	but Aloha hath helped me until this day ; and , behold , I stand and testify to the small and to the great , yet nothing beyond Musha and the prophets do I speak , but those things which they said should come to pass ;
44026023	that the Meshiha should suffer , and should be the chief of the resurrection from the house of the dead , and should preach light to the people and to the nations .
44026024	AND as Paulos was thus making defence , Festos cried with a high voice , Thou art mad , Paulos ; much learning hath made thee mad !
44026025	Paulos said to him , I am not mad , victorious Festos , but words of truth and righteousness I speak .
44026026	And king Agripos also , especially , knoweth concerning these things ; and therefore speak I with openness before him ; because not one of these things I think have been hidden from him ; for they were not done in secrecy .
44026027	Believest thou , king Agripos , the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
44026028	King Agripos said to him , ( Within ) a little thou persuadest me to become a Christian .
44026029	And Paulos said , I would from Aloha that in little and in much , not only thou , but also all who hear me to-day , were as I am , except these bonds .
44026030	And the king arose , and the governor , and Bernike , and those who sat with them :
44026031	and when they were removed thence they spake one with another , and said , Nothing that is worthy of death or of bonds hath this man done .
44026032	And Agripos said to Festos , This man could have been dismissed , if he had not called the appeal of Caesar .
44027001	And Festos commanded concerning him that he should be sent unto Caesar in Italia . And he delivered Paulos , and other prisoners with him , to a certain man , a centurion of the band of Sebaste , whose name was Julios .
44027002	And when he would proceed , we went down to a ship which was from Adramantos the city , to go to the region of Asia . And Aristarkos , a Makedonoya who was of Thessalunike the city ,
44027003	entered the ship with us . And the day after we came to Tsaidon . And the centurion behaved with kindness towards Paulos , and permitted him to go to his friends and be refreshed .
44027004	And from thence we voyaged ; and because the winds were contrary we made a circuit unto Cypros .
44027005	And we went through the sea of Cilicia and of Pamphulia , and came to Mura , a city of Lukia .
44027006	And the centurion found there a ship from Aleksandria which was going to Italia , and he placed us in her .
44027007	And because she sailed heavily , ( after ) many days we had scarce come over against Knidos the island , and as the wind did not permit us to go directly , we went round by Kreta against Salmona the city ;
44027008	and hardly voyaging we passing around it came to the place which is called the Fair Havens . AND it was nigh to the city named Lasia .
44027009	And we were there much time , until the day when the day of the fast of the Jihudoyee had also passed , and there had become danger for one to voyage by sea . And Paulos counselled them
44027010	and said , Men , I perceive that with distress and much loss we are to voyage , not only to the burden of the ship , but also to our own lives .
44027011	But the centurion hearkened to the governor and to the lord of the ship rather than to the counsel of Paulos .
44027012	And because that haven was not convenient to winter in , many of us desired to proceed thence , and if possible to come and winter in a certain harbour in Kreta , called Phoniks , and which looked to the south .
44027013	And when the wind of the south blew , and we thought we could come as we desired , we sailed round Kreta .
44027014	And after a little there came forth against us a blowing of the tempest which is called Tuphonikos Euroklidon ;
44027015	and the ship was carried away , and could not stand against the wind , and we gave her into its hand .
44027016	And when we had passed a certain isle that is called Cyra ; we could scarcely take up the boat .
44027017	And when we had uplifted her , we girded and strengthened the ship . And because we feared lest we should fall into the precipitancy of the sea , we brought down the sails , and so went forward . i
44027018	And while there rose against us the hard tempest , the next day we threw the goods into the sea .
44027019	And the third day the things of the ship itself we cast forth . And when the storm had held more days ,
44027020	and neither the sun was seen , nor the moon , nor stars , the hope that we should be saved at all was cut off .
44027021	And while no man had taken any food , then stood Paulos among them , and said , Men , if you had been persuaded by me , you would not have voyaged from Kreta , and we should have been exempted from loss , and from this distress .
44027022	Yet now I counsel you to be without anxiety ; for not one of you will perish , but the ship only .
44027023	For in this night there appeared to me the angel of Aloha , ( of ) him whose I am , and whom I serve .
44027024	And he said to me , Fear not , Paulos , for thou art to stand before Caesar ; and , behold , Aloha hath given thee the gift of all who voyage with thee .
44027025	Therefore , men , take courage ; for I believe Aloha , that so it shall be as he hath told me .
44027026	Nevertheless , upon a certain island we have to be cast .
44027027	AND after fourteen days ( in ) which we had wandered and been beaten in the sea of Hadrios , in the dividing of the night , the mariners thought that we drew nigh to land .
44027028	And they cast the lead , and found twenty cubits ; and again a little they proceeded , and found fifteen cubits .
44027029	And fearing lest we should be found in a place in which were rocks , they cast forth from the hinder part of the ship four anchors , and prayed that it would become day .
44027030	But the mariners sought to escape from the ship , and lowered from her the boat into the sea , on the pretext that they would go in her , and bind the ship to the land .
44027031	And when Paulos saw , he said to the centurion and to the soldiers , If these in the ship remain not , you cannot be saved .
44027032	Then cut the soldiers the cable of the boat from the ship , and let her drive .
44027033	But Paulos himself , until it was morning , persuaded all of them to take food , saying to them , To-day it is fourteen days ( in which ) from danger you have tasted nothing .
44027034	Wherefore I beseech you receive meat for the establishment of your lives ; for a hair of the head of one of you will not perish .
44027035	And when these he had said , he took bread , and praised Aloha before them all , and he broke and began to eat .
44027036	And they were all comforted , and received food .
44027037	But we were in the ship two hundred and seventy and six souls .
44027038	And when they were satisfied with food , they lightened the ship , and took up the wheat and sent it into the sea .
44027039	And when it was day , the sailors knew not what land it was ; but they saw along the coast a certain inlet of the sea , ( into ) which they purposed if possible to drive the ship .
44027040	And they cut the anchors from the ship , and left them in the sea , and they loosed the bands of the oars , and raised a small sail to the wind which blew , and went forward to the face of the land .
44027041	And the ship struck on a high place between two depths of the sea , and infixed herself in it ; and her forepart stood upon it , and was immovable , but her afterpart was loosed from the violence of the waves .
44027042	And the soldiers would have killed the prisoners , lest they should cast forth to swim , and escape from them ;
44027043	and the centurion restrained them from this , because he was willing to save Paulos . And those who could cast forth to swim he commanded to be the first to swim , and to pass to the land .
44027044	And the rest , on boards , and on other timbers of the ship , passed ; and thus all of them escaped to land .
44028001	AND afterwards we learned that Melita was called that island .
44028002	And the Barbaroyee who dwelt in it many kindnesses showed us . And they kindled a fire , and called all of us to warm , because there was great rain and cold .
44028003	And Paulos took many sticks and placed upon the fire ; and there came forth a viper from the heat of the fire , and bit ( him ) in his hand .
44028004	And when the Barbaroyee saw it hang upon his hand , they said , Perhaps this man is a murderer , whom , though he is escaped from the sea , justice suffereth not to live .
44028005	But Paulos shook his hand , and cast the viper into the fire , and nothing of evil befell him .
44028006	But the Barbaroyee expected that he would immediately have swelled and fallen dead upon the ground ; and when they had for a great while expected and saw that nothing of evil befell him , they changed their words , and said he was a god .
44028007	But there were possessions in that place ( belonging ) to a certain man whose name was Publios , who himself was the chief of the island ; and he cheerfully received us into his house three days .
44028008	But the father of Publios was ill in a fever , and a disease of the bowels . And Paulos went in to him , and prayed and laid his hand on him , and healed him .
44028009	And when this was done , the rest also of them who were diseased in the island came to him and were cured .
44028010	And with great honours they honoured us ; and when we went forth from thence they supplied us .
44028011	But we went forth after three months and voyaged in an Alexandrine ship which had wintered at the island ; and she had upon her the sign of the Twins .
44028012	And we came to Sarakosa the city , and remained there three days .
44028013	And from thence we went round and came to Regium the city . And after one day the south wind blew , and in two days we came to Putialos , a city of Italia .
44028014	And we found there brethren , and they prayed of us , and we were with them seven days , and then went we unto Ruma .
44028015	And when the brethren who were there heard , they came forth to meet us unto the street that is called Apios Foros , and unto the Three Taverns . And when Paulos saw them he thanked Aloha , and was strengthened .
44028016	And we entered Ruma . And the centurion allowed Paulos to sojourn where he willed , with the soldier , him who guarded him .
44028017	And after three days Paulos sent to convoke the principal men of the Jihudoyee ; and when they were assembled , he said to them , Men , brethren , I , who in nothing have risen against the people , nor the law of our fathers , in bonds was delivered from Urishlem into the hands of the Rumoyee .
44028018	And they who examined me willed to dismiss me , because they found not in me any fault worthy of death .
44028019	And when the Jihudoyee had risen against me , I was constrained to call the appeal of Caesar ; ( yet ) not as though I had in any thing to be the accuser of the sons of my people .
44028020	Wherefore I have besought you to come , that I might see you , and declare to you these things ; for on account of the hope of Israel am I bound with this chain .
44028021	They said to him , We have not received letters concerning thee from Jihud , and none of the brethren who have come from Urishlem have spoken any thing evil of thee .
44028022	But we are willing to hear from thee what it is that thou thinkest ; for we know that this doctrine is by no man received .
44028023	AND they appointed him a day ; and many assembled and came where he sojourned ; and he explained to them concerning the kingdom of Aloha , testifying and persuading them concerning Jeshu , from the law of Musha and from the prophets , from the morning until the evening .
44028024	And some of them were persuaded by his words , and others were not persuaded .
44028025	And they removed from him , while not agreeing together . And Paulos said to them this word , Well spake the Spirit of Holiness , by the mouth of Eshaia the prophet , against your fathers ,
44028026	saying , Go unto this people , and say unto them , Hearing , you will hear and will not understand . And you will see , but not discern :
44028027	For stupified is the heart of this people , And their hearing they have made heavy , And their eyes have they closed , Lest they should see with their eyes , And hear with their ears , And understand with their hearts , And be turned unto me , and I should forgive them .
44028028	Be this therefore known to you , that to the Gentiles is sent this redemption , for they will also hear it .
44028030	And Paulos hired his own house , and was in it two years , and received there all those who came to him .
44028031	And he preached concerning the kingdom of Aloha , and taught with confidence concerning our Lord Jeshu Meshiha , none forbidding .
45001001	PAULOS , a servant of Jeshu Meshiha , called , and an apostle , who hath been separated unto the gospel of Aloha ,
45001002	which from of old he had promised by the hand of the prophets , in the holy writings ,
45001003	concerning his Son , who was born , according to the flesh , of the seed of the house of David ,
45001004	and is known ( to be ) the Son of Aloha by power , and by the Holy Spirit , who raised him from among the dead , Jeshu Meshiha our Lord :
45001005	by whom we have received grace and apostleship among all nations , that they should become obedient unto the faith of his name :
45001006	and you also are of them , called in Jeshu Meshiha :
45001007	To all who are in Ruma , beloved of Aloha , called and saints ; peace and grace be with you from Aloha our Father , and from our Lord Jeshu Meshiha .
45001008	First , I praise my God through Jeshu Meshiha on behalf of you all , that your faith is heard ( of ) in all the world .
45001009	For a witness unto me is Aloha , whom I serve in the spirit in the gospel of his Son , that without ceasing at all time I remember you in my prayers .
45001010	And I pray that from now there may be opened unto me the way , by the will of Aloha , to come to you .
45001011	For I greatly desire to see you , and to impart to you the gift of the Spirit ,
45001012	that thereby you may be established , and that together we may be comforted by your faith and mine .
45001013	BUT I will that you know , my brethren , that many times I have willed to come to you , and have been hindered until this ;
45001014	that among you also I may have fruit as among the rest of the nations of the Javnoyee and Barbaroyee , the wise and the foolish ,
45001015	because to every man am I obligated to preach ; and so am I urged to evangelize unto you also who are in Ruma .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the gospel , because it is the power of Aloha for the salvation of all who believe in him , whether of the Jihudoyee first , or of the Aramoyee :
45001017	for the righteousness of Aloha in it is revealed from faith to faith , as it is written , The righteous by faith shall live .
45001018	For the wrath of Aloha is revealed from heaven against all the unrighteousness and depravity of the sons of men , who the truth in unrighteousness detain .
45001019	Because the knowledge of Aloha is revealed in them ; for Aloha revealed it in them .
45001020	For the occult things of Aloha from the foundations of the world , unto his creatures by intelligence are apparent , and his power and his Godhead eternal , that they may be without excuse .
45001021	For when they knew Aloha , they did not as Aloha glorify him and praise him , but became vain in their imaginations , and their heart was darkened , that they understood not .
45001022	And while thinking in themselves that they were wise , they were fools .
45001023	And they changed the glory of Aloha the Incorruptible into the likeness of the image of corruptible man , and into the likeness of birds and of four-footed ( beasts ) and of reptiles of the earth .
45001024	Because of this Aloha delivered them up to the unclean lusts of their hearts , that they would debase their bodies among them .
45001025	And they changed the truth of Aloha into a lie , and worshipped and served the creatures rather than their Creator , to whom be praises and blessings for ever and ever . Amen .
45001026	WHEREFORE Aloha delivered them up to passions of vileness : for their females changed the use of their nature , and to what is not natural were used .
45001027	And also their males likewise left the natural use of their females , and were inflamed with concupiscence one with another , and male with male wrought shamefulness , and the just retribution for their perverseness in themselves received .
45001028	And as they did not decide in themselves to know Aloha , so did Aloha cause them to be delivered up to a mind of vainness , and to do what is not fit ;
45001029	being filled with all wickedness , and uncleanness , and rancour , and malice , and rapacity , and envy , and murder , and contention , and deceit , and evil imaginings , and murmurings ,
45001030	and slanders , and hating of Aloha : vilifiers , inflated ones , boasters , inventors of evil things , mindless , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	( men ) to whom a compact is nothing , and ( who ) neither love peace nor ( have ) mercy in them ; who ,
45001032	knowing the judgment of Aloha , that they who these things do , unto death are condemned , ( yet ) not only do them , but also participate with those who do them .
45002001	Wherefore thou hast no excuse , O man , who judgest thy neighbour ; for in that for which thou judgest thy neighbour , thou condemnest thyself ; for in those which thou judgest , thou also art conversant .
45002002	AND we know what is the judgment of Aloha in truth against them who in these things converse .
45002003	But thinkest thou , O man , who judgest them who in these converse , while thou also conversest in them , that thou wilt escape the judgment of Aloha ?
45002004	Or upon the riches of his goodness , and upon his long-suffering , and upon the space he giveth thee , presumest thou ? and knowest not that the goodness of Aloha unto repentance leadeth thee ?
45002005	Yet , through the hardness of thy unrepenting heart , layest thou up the treasure of wrath for the day of wrath , and the revelation of the just judgment of Aloha ,
45002006	who rendereth to every man according to his works .
45002007	To them who seek , in perseverance of good works , glory and honour and incorruption , he giveth eternal life ;
45002008	but to them who are rebellious , and obey not the truth , but unrighteousness obey , he will render wrath and indignation
45002009	and affliction and distress , upon every man who worketh evils ; to Jihudoyee first , and to Aramoyee ;
45002010	but glory and honour and peace to every one who worketh good , to the Jihudoya first , and also to the Aramoya ;
45002011	for there is no acceptance of faces with Aloha .
45002012	For they who without the law have sinned , without the law also will perish : and they who in the law have sinned , by the law will be judged .
45002013	For not the hearers of the law are righteous before Aloha , but the doers of the law are justified .
45002014	FOR if the Gentiles , who have not the law , from their nature shall perform the law , these , while not having the law , unto themselves become a law .
45002015	And these show the work of law written upon their hearts , and their conscience testifieth of them , while their reasonings accuse or excuse one another ;
